about: June 28-29-30th 2019 12th annual 1000 Islands Regatta
impressum: Famiily friendly festival with food trucks - retail & craft vendors and 3 nights of live music.  This year will feature multiple national level music artists.  ...What Is Hydroplane Racing Anyways  A hydroplane is nothing less than a plane without wings! At heart-pounding speeds, air whips through the tunnel - the empty space between the boat’s sponsons - and lifts the boat up so that pratically only the propeller is touching the water.   Hydroplane (Hy-dro-Plane) noun: Single seater fiberglass or carbon fiber equipped with two sponsons and a center section as light as 750LB for 1.5L and heavy as 2700 Lb for Grand Prix class. It is thrust through the water by a surface piercing propeller powered by up to 1500 HP Grand Prix motor at speeds of 150-160Mph. Visibility is reduced to almost zero in the corners with water turned up by the skid fins that help the boat to turn sharply. Loss of control at high speeds and risk of collision is high. There is no power steering and braking systems such as in your car.  Just a front "canard" wing to help keep the boat on the water! GUARANTEED THRILLS. 1000 Islands Regatta More than 10 years running, Full days of racing with no interruption due to wind the last 3 years and counting.   Incredible race site right in the heart of the city, the only festival occupying the Blockhouse Island in 2014. Very affordable large scale event, only $5 for weekend pass and kids up to 12 are in for FREE.   Full array of Food vendors with Live music on all day & night, fully licensed area to enjoy cocktails & beer while watching the racing. Fully furnished and staffed kids zone to keep your little ones occupied.    Business partnerships formed with more than 50 local organizations, supporting our local businesses. Over $1 million in local economic spin-offs for the area with 85 boats and their crews & families in town for 3 days.   Accepting volunteers to help put on this great event and ensure its survival into the future. See moreWhat Is Hydroplane Racing Anyways  A hydroplane is nothing less than a plane without wings! about: McMaster's Student Bar

culinary team: Food & Beverage Manager: Richard Haja Head Chef: Stu Gold
column44: Renovated in 2009, the newly named TwelvEighty is the former famous Quarters.   TwelvEighty is the on-campus bar & grill owned by students, staffed by students ...and LOVED by students!  Day Time Operations:  Ever find yourself sitting in a crowded space with your lunch on your lap, trying to enjoy your meal and you just can’t seem to get comfortable? What about standing in line at La Piazza or Commons? Have no fear, TwelvEighty is here! When you’re on campus for classes, hanging around doing school work, or just meeting up with friends, remember that TwelvEighty is conveniently located in the basement of the MUSC just for you! We provide high quality food at a competitive price for students and faculty, while still maintaining a fun and laid-back atmosphere. We have booths, tables, outlets for your electronic devices and TV screens to make your time at TwelvEighty entertaining and relaxing. We accept cash, debit, credit and the flex dollars from your McMaster Meal Plan.  Are you over the age of 19? We have alcoholic beverages at a very low price to meet anyone’s budget. Stop by for lunch, dinner, drinks or all three and check out our menu and delicious daily specials. Want to know what we’re serving that day? Our specials are posted daily on our Facebook and Twitter pages! Interested in what’s happening at TwelvEighty on a regular basis? Check out our monthly calendar posted in the restaurant and find out what event you want to attend next!  TwelvEighty Nightlife:   Join us for TwelvEighty Nightlife events hosted by MSU Campus Events! Check out https://www.facebook.com/MSUCampusEvents/ for dates and more information!  Special Events:  Have you involved yourself in various clubs and groups on campus? If you’re ever looking for a place to hold a social event and celebrate with your fellow club mates, TwelvEighty has the space and the resources to make your event happen! Check out our new catering menu for discounted pricing for your club or group – we do dine-in orders if you’re holding your event in our venue, or pick up orders if it’s located somewhere else on campus.  Owned and operated by the McMaster Students Union. See moreand LOVED by students! column44: This Heritage building was built in 1912 and served the educational needs of Qualicum Beach for both elementary and secondary school until 1952, when a new seco...ndary school was built. The building reverted to an elementary school only until 1976, when a new school was built. The Board of Education used the building until 1985. As the wrecking ball swung closer and closer to the building, dedicated citizens of the community banded together and formed a non-profit cultural association. With the help of many volunteers, countless hours of hard work and fundraising events, the building was renovated and opened to the public in February 1988 See morendary school was built. column44: Few concepts are as old as beer and fatherhood. Some might even say that throughout much of human history, they have been irrevocably linked (but that is a stor...y for another time.) This story starts in 2009 in small town Ontario, with four hockey dads and their four hockey sons. Artist, entrepreneur, corporate exec and maverick, they gathered around a shared love of the hand crafted and authentic, and a vision of producing high quality craft beers that could combine artistry and accessibility. Add a whole lot of time spent together in rinks and on soccer pitches, experimenting over stove tops, planting hops and touring microbreweries around the world, and slowly, things began to brew. That friendship, like our craft beers, is based on a simple formula: stand up 4 each other, stand up 4 something bigger than yourself and stand up 4 the antiquated notion that quality craft beer matters… and then be patient. See morey for another time.) This story starts in 2009 in small town Ontario, with four hockey dads and their four hockey sons. We book punk bands
column44: Early in 2013, Chuck and Esther decided to start booking bands together.   A lot of people ask what the 737 stands for. Is it an area code? Nope. Do you like ai...rplanes? Nope. Chuck's terrified of flying. Turns out, it's a Mighty Mighty Bosstones reference. (google 737 club).   Our goal is to promote bands we love from anywhere we can get them from. Chuck has almost 20 years of promoting punk rock under his belt, and Esther has about 17 years of just going to shows and getting drunk under hers.   We tend to have a very diy attitude towards what we do. When we have an upcoming show, you will see at least one of us standing at the copy machine at Monk's making posters, pounding the streets 3 times a week putting up posters and spamming other events with handbills. We like it.   We never have show's for less than $12. The bands need to get paid. I think once we made like $35. But with that being said, we're not here to make money. We do it for the love of punk rock. Hope to see you at the show! Address: 86 Homewood Avenue, Hamilton  21 Charles Street, Milton Hamilton, Ontario
about: Live acoustic concerts in Hamilton and Milton featuring local Canadian talent and encouraging the growth of music through lessons in Milton.
products: coffee, tea, desserts
column44: ACOUSTIC CONCERTS  “Acoustic Blend Café” is an organization hosting monthly acoustic music concerts that have been operating in the Hamilton area since 2009. In... 2016, we expanded the concept by starting a concert series in Milton. The operating year runs from October through to May, producing 6 - 7 concerts each series.  The 2.5 hour concerts are offered in a relaxed, coffee house setting with light refreshments, feature an “open mic” to start, then showcase local musical talent from any genre, the only condition being that they are acoustic in nature. The performers come from a variety of backgrounds so that each concert features a different style of music. Our goal is to provide an affordable venue for progressing and emerging talent to perform, and to broaden the Canadian music scene in a culture that is seeing live music venues steadily closing.   MUSIC LESSONS  To further support the development of music, in September 2017 we will be offering music lessons at The Milton Tutoring Centre.  We will teach voice, piano, guitar and ukulele, with the potential of expanding to other instruments as interest grows.   All levels are welcomed, aged 5 and up. Private and group lessons (minimum of 6 students required) are available, catering to different learning styles.  Group lessons provide confidence playing for others in a friendly, encouraging atmosphere.  It allows the students to also learn from their peers while exposing them to different styles of music. There are also possibilities of performing in our concerts, opening for professional musicians as part of our monthly concert series! about: En chanson comme en humour, les grands noms d’aujourd’hui et de demain s’y côtoient.  Réservations: 819 847-0470
column44: D'abord une église méthodiste puis un lieu de rencontre pour les francs-maçons, le bâtiment qui accueille le Vieux Clocher de Magog a connu de multiples vocatio...ns depuis sa construction en 1881. Sa vocation culturelle s'est imposée au cours des années 1970. Tour à tour repère de la troupe de théâtre Les Baladins, bar-spectacle puis centre culturel, le bâtiment a pris le nom de Vieux Clocher en 1975.   L'histoire de la salle de spectacles que l'on connaît aujourd'hui débute véritablement en 1981 alors que Bernard-Y. Caza s'en porte acquéreur. Il entreprend de faire du Vieux Clocher un centre culturel d'envergure qui gagne rapidement en notoriété tant auprès des artistes que du public. Le Vieux Clocher ouvre ses portes le 16 octobre 1981 avec l'artiste invité Stephen Faulkner.  Au fil des ans, le Vieux Clocher profite de quelques agrandissements, ce qui lui permet d'accueillir 400 personnes. Grâce à l'intimité qui y règne et à son acoustique exceptionnelle, cette salle devient une institution, un lieu unique où les artistes présentent leur spectacle en primeur avant la rentrée montréalaise. On y reçoit les plus grands noms en humour et en chanson. Le trottoir des artistes, une allée piétonnière ornée de tuiles commémoratives, témoigne d'ailleurs de leur premier passage au Vieux Clocher de Magog.  Mis en nomination deux fois au Gala de l'ADISQ dans la catégorie « Diffuseur de l'année » et récipiendaire d'un prix Mélior, le Vieux Clocher de Magog est toujours un incontournable où se produisent avec plaisir les artistes d'aujourd'hui et de demain. Address: 182 Bridge Street - Gemmill Park Almonte, Ontario
about: Almonte Celtfest 2020 has been cancelled. Stay tuned for 2021 updates!
column44: Celtfest is a free afternoon of Ottawa Valley and Celtic entertainment, performed in the natural amphitheatre of Gemmill Park in the heart of Almonte. It is a ...time to share the historical Celtic traditions with today’s local performers. Celtfest also presents a select group of unique artisans and vendors of specialty goods with a Celtic flair.  Mission     Our mission is to celebrate and promote the Celtic heritage of the Ottawa Valley through music and dance and to make this accessible to all. We want to give up-and-coming performers an opportunity to display their talents in their home community. To do this, we feature a free event with a number of entertainers who have a Celtic quality, as well as a wide variety of vendors of Celtic goods. We also provide a tent for seniors and entertainment for children, along with great food and beverages for all.      The history of Celtfest began in 1997. Motivated by a love of Celtic heritage, Brian and Dan O’Connell, along with Terry Currie, looked for a way to keep their musical traditions alive and pass on the legacy of the Celts to the wider community.   Throughout generations, fiddling and stepdancing have had a strong presence in the Ottawa Valley. Celtic music has continued to thrive in kitchens, pubs, and churches, Brian O’Connell explains. “In the early to mid 90s, there was a revival of Celtic music, such as Riverdance. We felt with all the local talent in the area, we could put together an event that would promote local musical talent and a day to reflect on the Celtic heritage. See Moretime to share the historical Celtic traditions with today’s local performers. Celtfest also presents a select group of unique artisans and vendors of specialty goods with a Celtic flair. about: Strong coffee Sweet tunes Community vibes
A supporting atmosphere with the intent to nourish good conversation and a deep connection with like-minded individuals.
public transit: TTC - St. George Subway Station is located just a 2 minute walking distance
impressum: We intend to fulfill a need not yet accommodated within our city. Alternity is a space where wellness is the primary, in all regards. Our mission is to create a... space with alternatives for how we indulge, consume, and connect with each other. A community living room where we can gather and come closer to like-minded individuals.   Coffee culture has long been based around the coming together of great minds and thinkers. The philosophers, artists, revolutionaries, and change-makers (way-seers) of our communities. A place where great change has developed through conversation and the coming together of minds.   The physical space created for Alternity was developed with the concept ‘Heterotopia’ in mind. A term coined by Foucoult meaning 'a social space of otherness at once physical and interpsychic’, created to curate the mind spaces for an experience.  The space is felt when you walk through the doors.  Hand picked furniture and decor from local artisans brings a natural element to the city. Our wood furniture comes from Indonesia and maintains its natural form and our walls are infused with art from all over the world. about: Andina Brewing Company is a Vancouver based microbrewery, producing great artisanal beer. A fusion of Canadian & South American flavours, opening in 2017
column44: Andina Brewing Company is located in Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada. It was founded by Colombian/Canadian brothers, Andrés and Nicolás Amaya. The Amaya Bro...thers have lived in Vancouver for more than 18 years and are passionate about beer, music, culture, and family and friends.  "We offer a brand new concept in the local craft beer market. Our beer is full bodied, crisp and smooth, very drinkable and perfect to share on any occasion. We offer an environment in our brewery that is a unique blend of South American and Canadian flavours. If you are looking for something new and out of the ordinary stop by our brewery and taste the difference! Come and try our Ceviche paired with one of our beers, or try them all. You will love it! Salud! " – The Amaya Brothers  Follow us on Twitter, Instagram and Facebook for updates on our progress.

Page Types: Family Style Restaurant | Cafe | Breakfast & Brunch Restaurant
column44: Welcome to Octopus’ Garden! Can you tell we’re Beatles fans? We certainly are, and much like the song says “We would sing and dance around because we know we c...an’t be found!” Singing, dancing and music are just part of what awaits you in our garden. Here’s the rest of the story:  We take care to specialize in fresh, local, high-quality food - served to you at affordable prices. Our cheese, meat, bread, eggs, milk, butter, hot sauces, honey, tea, jams, and maple syrup are all sourced from local producers. We serve fresh-roasted, organic, fair trade coffee and espresso. Most of our organically grown fruit and vegetables are right from our own farm.   We sell produce! Yes that’s right, if you need some produce to bring back with you, we will sell you the produce grown right from our own farm (just a few miles away). Our seasonal fruits and vegetables are grown year-round, using organic farming methods. Even our water hoses are free from harmful chemicals! Now it doesn’t get any fresher than that!  We encourage you to unwind with your choice of locally produced beer and wine on our beautiful outdoor patio next to the babbling Cleveland Brook.  Spend some time upstairs browsing our Glass Roots studio where we sell our beautifully blown glass pieces as well as works from other local artists. They are all truly one-of-kind and unique artistic creations.  Have the kids with you? Great! Kids love the indoor play area – perfect for those rainy days. We also offer lots of great books and boardgames for all ages to read and play while you are relaxing.  Need to find out what’s happening outside of the Garden? We have you covered with free wireless internet. We even have a complimentary computer for you to use – free of course!  Special events hosted at An Octopus' Garden Cafe:  ||The Friday Night Garden Party Jam - Every Friday evening at 7 PM, local musicians gather to play music in an informal setting. If you’ve ever experienced an ‘East Coast Kitchen Party’ then you’ll know exactly what goes on in the Garden on Friday nights. Come to play, listen, dance, meet new friends or see familiar faces...this is always a fun night.  ||Concert Series – Our concert series has been steadily growing year after year. We are expecting another year of amazing concerts by local and touring artists. Please visit our events calendar to see who’s coming soon. about: Mount Pleasant's favourite social club & watering hole.
column44: Founded in 1935, the Australia-New Zealand Association was formed, with the purpose to meet and welcome visitors from down under, and gather together socially f...rom time to time. ANZA continued their meet & greet, and social functions throughout the years, until the flow of visitors ceased due to travel restrictions brought on by the start of World War Two.  In 1952 the ANZA was revived but the nature of ANZA changed, and it became primarily a Social Club for Australians & New Zealanders living in the Greater Vancouver area, holding regular monthly dances/ socials at HMCS Discovery in Stanley Park. These proved so popular that they were increased to twice monthly, and ANZA introduced their Annual Picnic, and held very successful Annual Garden Parties.  With such rapid growth, it was decided by the Members that ANZA should get its own premises, where all records could be stored, work performed and activities held. In May 1961, during the reign of two-time, eight year President Graeme Robson, a Clubhouse fund was started.  After scouring the city, it was finally decided that ANZA would purchase the property that we currently occupy at 3 West 8th Avenue. After two years of alterations, renovations and acquisitions all of the many City, Fire and Liquor regulations were finally met and the club was finally granted a liquor license by the LCB.  The club now began to flourish. With ANZA Travel a part of the family, discounted flights/travel to Oz and NZ were a big bonus to members, and membership numbers increased astronomically. Bi-monthly socials became weekly, then twice-weekly. If you weren't here by 7:30, you probably wouldn't get in. Participation, special event groups, attendance, theme nights, The ANZA Players, Anzettes, Bar-B-Qs, Bowling, Bridge, the Camera Club, Car Rallies, Darts, Golf, Hiking, Picnics, Rugby, a Softball Team, and the Ski Club. The Ski Club proved so successful that the club purchased two ski chalets at Snowline on Mt. Baker.  As the nature of travel changed, and the group flight discount incentive declined, so did ANZA attendance. Most, if not all, of the original founding members married and started raising children, and while there were enthusiastic successors, they were fewer in number. The ski chalets were sold to keep the club afloat.  While the ANZA had always been sort of a family social venue, the turn of the century saw a sort of generational torch pass. The ANZA began to attract a couple of distinct new crowds. There came a night club kind of crowd, particularly on the weekends. The Pacific Bluegrass Society took up Monday night residence in the upstairs hall.  The ANZA has evolved into a sort of neighbourhood institution - much like the British "local". The Tiki lounge in the downstairs part of the building is now a longstanding home to weekly events such as Darts league, Open Mic and Open Dex, all very popular with Mt. Pleasant folk. Upstairs is home to live music and DJ events, quite often hosting Gay and Lesbian community events, as well as African and Reggae inspired nights. But you never really do know what you'll find in the upstairs hall, making it a popular destination for the adventurous!  We're pleased to announce that we have recently renovated the upstairs hall, with help from a Cultural Infrastructure Improvement Grant. Thanks, Vancouver! Come and check it out if you haven't already! See Morerom time to time. column44: L'Aquarium Café Bar a pignon sur rue depuis février 2003 sur l'étonnante rue Masson, dans un quartier Rosemont qui ne cesse de s'embellir.  Fruit de l'imaginati...on des deux propriétaires, l'endroit se révèle une destination sympatique où musique blues, jazz et musique du monde se marient aux expositions éclatées qui sont présentées chaque mois.  En semaine, l'Aquarium revêt des couleurs de bar de quartier avec ses 4 à 7 animés.  Nous offrons aussi une connection à internet sans fil.  Les vendredis et samedis soirs, l'Aquarium présente des musiciens de talent, qui par leurs prestations inspirées, contribuent à l'atmosphère intimiste et conviviale du café bar.  L'Aquarium encourage et soutient la vie musicale en donnant une large place aux musiciens locaux.  La musique fait partie de l'âme de l'endroit depuis son ouverture.  L'Aquarium est fier d'offrir une place aux artistes du coin.  Peintres ou photographes, leurs oeuvres ornent les murs du bar, conférant ainsi un cachet unique à chaque visite.  L'Aquarium Café Bar, une destination incontournable au coeur du quartier Rosemont à Montréal. Address: 5 St. Anne Street Saint Albert, Alberta
about: Located in beautiful downtown St. Albert, The Arden Theatre continues to be a destination for world class talent across all genres of entertainment.
company overview: Located in St. Albert, Alberta, Canada, The Arden Theatre has gained an international reputation for excellence. Since opening its doors in 1983, The Arden Thea...tre has played host to some of the world’s most respected artists as well as dance schools, musicians, actors, and school groups from the community.   Busy over 300 days of the year, the Arden Theatre is home to over 150 events playing to more than 60,000 patrons.   The Arden is also home to the Northern Alberta International Children’s Festival, an annual five-day festival attracting over 50,000 children and families; and to the renowned St. Albert Children’s Theatre, a cultural leadership program using musical theatre to help young people learn leadership and communication skills. about: The Army, Navy and Air Force Veterans in Canada is the oldest veteran's organization in the country. Established in Montreal in 1840 by a charter from the t
general information: The Army, Navy and Air Force Veterans in Canada is the oldest veteran's organization in the country. Established in Montreal in 1840 by a charter from the then ...new young Q|ueen Victoria, it was a Canadian counterpart to the long established Army and Navy Veterans in Great Britian, which along with Militia Institutes and United Services Institutes was vigourously supported by the celebrated Duke of Wellington. The ANAVETS in Canada as we know it, is a not-for-profit organization with 18,000 members in 70 units across Canada. It was created by Act of Parliament in 1917, which was amended in 1946 to include RCAF veterans. We have one unit in the USA called the ANAVICUS. See Morenew young Q|ueen Victoria, it was a Canadian counterpart to the long established Army and Navy Veterans in Great Britian, which along with Militia Institutes and United Services Institutes was vigourously supported by the celebrated Duke of Wellington. mission: 1. To unite fraternally, persons who have served in Her Majesy's armed forces or any auxiliary force thereof or in the armed forces or any auxiliary force of an...y nation allied to the British Commonwealth of Nations engaged in an active combat zone and persons who support the purposes and objects of the Association, which Association shall be a non-partisan and non-sectarian body for that purpose of good fellowship, mutual improvement and assistance, and patriotic endeavour and service to Canada and the British Commonwealth of Nations; 2. To increase the public influence of veterans by organization, by parades and by giving as an entity expressions of opinion upon public questions affecting the rights of veterans or concerning the welfare of the whole or any part of the British Comonwealth of Nations; 3. To stimulate the spirit of patriotism in Canada and promote closer unity and coordination within the British Commonwealth of Nations; 4. To assist the British Commonwealth of Nations when occasion requires in enlisting recruits for Her Majesty's forces; 5. To acquire, maintain and operate clubs, homes and meeting places for the benefit of veterans, and to furnish, stock, and equip the same with such furniture, furnishings, plants,animals, implements, equipment, appliances, libraries, and means of entertainment and amusement, as may be considered desirable by the Association; 6. To aquire and maintain museums in connection with any premises of the Association for the interest, education, or benefit of its members; 7. To levy upon its members, or upon bodies to whom it has granted charters as authorized herein, fees or assessments from time to time as may be required for the support of the Association and the carying out of its objecs; and to raise funds for the purpose of the Association by such means, with other, as providing entertainment, operating canteens and places of refreshment and amusement; and 8. To assist any of Her Majesty's naval, military air forces on active service, by establishments for, the rest and comfort of, and as meeting places for, those composing such forces. Page Types: Live Music Venue | Performance Art Theatre
about: A beautifully renovated church turned intimate performance venue in Regina's Cathedral Neighbourhood and the home of Artesian Presents, a not-for-profit organization that presents concerts, theatre productions, lectures, and a variety of private events.
column44: Diction: ar·te·sian (är-tee'zhan) - a confined aquifer containing groundwater that will flow upward through a well, called an artesian well, without the need fo...r pumping. A reference to our local wellspring of talent.  Inspiration: Our involvement with local band The Lazy MKs, theatre groups like Curtain Razors and the Regina Fringe Festival and dance companies like New Dance Horizons helped us realize the demand for intimate spaces to showcase original music and performance. So we had the idea of creating a venue for the wealth of local and regional talent. Restoration:  Built in 1950 and designed by Storey and Van Egmond(!), the Calvary Evangelical Church was built solid and sound. We have restored the beautiful yellow pine and fir windows, reopened the choir balcony, insulated the basement, removed outrageous electric blue shag carpet, and replaced the leaking steeple. New front doors were salvaged from Herchmer School and the performance theatre doors were saved from Marian High School. Fir beams, salvaged from grain elevators, form the structure of the new entrance. The foyer's tin ceiling was rescued from a turn-of-the-century commercial building in Wolseley, SK. You can find many repurposed treasures throughout the building.  Destination: Our long-term vision is to honor and encourage high-calibre talent with an appreciative, attentive audience. A creative space to go to when you want to hear every note in an originally-written song; experience every nuance of a playwright's work. We are committed to assisting the arts, music and culture communities cross-promote and build a larger audience. Join us in supporting our artists. Remember that we have an amazing community of talented musicians, dancers, performers, writers, filmmakers, and visual artists. Culture creates community.  ||Artesian is all ages, licensed, and wheelchair accessible ||See Morer pumping. A reference to our local wellspring of talent. Act Name: The Artists' Recital Space At Atelier Rosemarie Umetsu
about: A brand new Recital Space centrally loacted in downtown Toronto. Spacious with great accoustic it is ideal for recitals, photoshoots, events of all types.
column44: The Yamaha Recital Space at Atelier Rosemarie Umetsu is 2,500 square feet with 12 foot wood ceilings, and superb accoustic. It has 2 rooms, the main recital spa...ce with a seating capacity of 100 seats, and a light filled teracotta floor foyer, perfect for receptions and has a 100 person capacity. It is also home to a brand new 7ft Yamaha C6X.  The recital space is centrally located in the Annex area in Toronto at Bedford/Davenport. Easy TTC convenience and parking. It is on a prime main floor and set in the ambience of a Fashion Atelier. Guests enjoy perusing through spectacular gowns on display that are created for the stage.  Yamaha Canada Music and Atelier Rosemarie Umetsu partnered in 2016 to create the Yamaha Recital Space at Atelier Rosemarie Umetsu. Both Yamaha Canada Music and Atelier Rosemarie Umetsu have long been involved in the music scene and supporting artists in Toronto.   The Yamah Recital Space at Atelier Rosemarie Umetsu can be rented for concerts, fundraisers, CD releases, private parties, weddings,  launches, photoshoots, practice facility.  There are various packages offered beyond the basic space rental, and Students have a special student rate.  If interested in renting this fab new space, please contact us here via Facebook or email us at info@atelierrosemarieumetsu.com. Both Yamaha Canada Music and Atelier Rosemarie Umetsu have long been involved in the music scene and supporting artists in Toronto.   The Yamah Recital Space at Atelier Rosemarie Umetsu can be rented for concerts, fundraisers, CD releases, private parties, weddings,  launches, photoshoots, practice facility.  There are various packages offered beyond the basic space rental, and Students have a special student rate.  If interested in renting this fab new space, please contact us here via Facebook or email us at info@atelierrosemarieumetsu.com.

general information: With a roster of award winning acts such as Lee Kernaghan, John Williamson, Troy Cassar-Daley, Songbirds, Beccy Cole and Gina Jeffreys, Artist Network Australia... represents performers not only from Australia's Country music scene but also from all other genres. Artist Network Australia are instrumental in programming premier music events throughout Australia such as the Perth City Muster, Mount Isa Rotary Rodeo, Mud Bulls and Music, Urban Country Music Festival to name a few. column44: ARTIST NETWORK is regarded as one of Australia’s leading Entertainment, Booking and Touring Agencies and represents some of the most in demand artists in the co...untry as well as international touring acts.  Specialising in country, heritage and contemporary acts, ARTIST NETWORK showcases across Australian venues, theatres, events, music festivals and entertainment Cruise’s the very best domestic and international live entertainment on offer.  Based in Sydney, Artist Network provides expertise and representation to clients through their knowledge and understanding of market trends, entertainment economy and best buy promotional opportunities.  ARTIST NETWORK currently represents respected Australian artists such as John Williamson, Lee Kernaghan, Troy Cassar-Daley, Adam Harvey, Beccy Cole, Glenn Shorrock, Brian Cadd, Frankie J Holden and Wilbur Wilde, Amber Lawrence, Chelsea Basham as well as being promoters for international artists such as Boz Scaggs, Air Supply, Kenny Rogers, Natalie Cole, Burt Bacharach and Michael Bolton to name but a few.  The company also works alongside major festivals such as the Tamworth Country Music Festival and the Gympie Music Muster in developing their range of offerings and scheduling of concerts and events.  ARTIST NETWORK has expanded into booking and managing all the world class live entertainment for luxurious entertainment cruises such as ‘Cruisin’ Country’, ‘Rock the Boat’, ‘Cruise N Groove’ and ‘BRAVO – Cruise of the Performing Arts’. Their vision has lead the way in this new “festival at sea” offering.  At the helm is CEO, Marius Els, an active member of numerous music industry boards and long-time supporter of the Australian music industry.  Supporting Marius and leading the rest of the team is Zenon, Operations and Office Director. Zenon works across all international and domestic tours as well as through research and industry connections, works alongside and advises management and artists on the roster on future planning and longevity.  Whatever you need, the team at Artist Network can provide you with live music experiences to never forget. See Moreuntry as well as international touring acts. Page Types: Charity Organization | Nonprofit Organization | Performance Art Theatre
about: Arts on the Ave is a non-profit society who produces the Kaleido Family Arts Festival, Deep Freeze: A Byzantine Winter Festival, & the Carrot Coffeehouse.
company overview: Arts on the Ave Edmonton Society is a non-profit, community based, grassroots initiative engaged in developing 118th Avenue  (75 – 106 Streets) into a community... arts district.  Arts on the Ave Edmonton Society sees 118 Ave, between NAIT to Northlands, as a place whose “personality” is vividly expressed through the arts.  This place has a dynamic momentum, “an arts pulse” where the artist and community continually engage.  At its core, Arts on the Ave believes in cultivating artistic fellowship through arts celebrations, signature art festivals, and traditions. The Society’s goals are to create opportunities for all individuals to experience the joy of artistic expression and to nurture creative environments. Arts on the Ave is comprised of visual and performance artists, literary and film artists, photographers, and musicians that collaborate and create in the 118 Avenue District. See More arts district.  Arts on the Ave Edmonton Society sees 118 Ave, between NAIT to Northlands, as a place whose “personality” is vividly expressed through the arts.  This place has a dynamic momentum, “an arts pulse” where the artist and community continually engage.  At its core, Arts on the Ave believes in cultivating artistic fellowship through arts celebrations, signature art festivals, and traditions. The Society’s goals are to create opportunities for all individuals to experience the joy of artistic expression and to nurture creative environments. Arts on the Ave is comprised of visual and performance artists, literary and film artists, photographers, and musicians that collaborate and create in the 118 Avenue District.
column44: Arts on the Ave Edmonton Society is a non-profit, community based, grassroots initiative engaged in developing 118th Avenue  (75 – 106 Streets) into a community... arts district.   Arts on the Ave produces the Kaleido Family Arts Festival each September, Deep Freeze: A Byzantine Winter Festival each January, and runs the Carrot Community Arts  Coffeehouse year round.   Begun in 2005 and incorporated into a Society in 2007, this creative coalition has experienced exponential growth with a current involvement of over 200 multi-disciplinary artists and invested community members. This active growth has been spurred on by highly dedicated and involved members. In April 2008 Arts on the Ave was the proud recipient of the 21st Mayor’s Celebration of the Arts.  Arts on the Ave has organized and presented a broad range of activities: extensive art showings, a variety of inter-disciplinary festivals as well as activities that are a blend of artistic expressions in an educational, mentoring and sharing environment. Using the existing cultural fabric to enliven Edmonton’s inner-city neighbourhoods, Arts on the Ave has showcased local talent, and crossed boundaries to establish a multi-disciplinary arts cluster.  The organization is engaged with the city and dedicated to the community through the cultivation of positive urban renewal. It is through culture-led urban regeneration initiatives, a vision of creative spaces and place-making that these art-infused communities have begun to flourish and provide a safe, nurturing environment for artists to thrive. See More arts district. about: Welcome to the Artspace! Operating out a thriving community hub, we offer the space & equipment to host a wide variety of acts, gatherings, & more!
public transit: PG Transit #55 stops across the street from us! PG Transit #5 passes by the back!
products: -Public event space -Private meeting space (At this time, we are not able to host large private gatherings such as receptions, birthday parties, etc...)
column44: We've got the space, you have the event; let's make something happen!  Go to bit.do/artspacerentalrequest to submit a booking request & we'll get back to you wi...thin the week.  Artspace capacity is 149 people. We have two bathrooms, a mobile concession counter (no fridge/freezer though), and enough seating to fill the room. Lights, sound equipment, a projector, and a projection screen are all available for a small extra fee. For larger music events, we recommend hiring our in-house sound technician if you do not have a sound crew & equipment. (This does add extra costs to your rental.) We also have more than 30ft of wallspace available for artshows & displays.  If you'd like to be one of our Artists-On-Display, check out the info packet & online booking form at bit.do/artistondisplay. about: Augusta house is a classic restaurant and bar to dine or enjoy a drink with friends. Live entertainment Wednesday - Saturday nights
column44: Welcome to The Augusta House  Located in Hamilton’s Durand District just off James St. S. The Augusta House is a wonderful destination for all ages, locals and ...visitors alike. Established in 2010, our restaurant has gone through many changes over the years yet through them all our motto has endured; to offer an enjoyable atmosphere, tantalizing food options and refreshments aimed to please all. Supplying recognizable brands, fresh menus twice a year and entertaining events both on and off site have kept our family of patrons passing through our door today and for years to come. Specializing in what we like to call “continental fusion”, our chef takes some of your favorite classic dishes and puts a modern twist on them so that you might learn to enjoy them all over again.  Live music every Friday and Saturday night, golf tournaments, tasting events, and impromptu celebrations keep the fun times rolling throughout the year. So whether you’re looking for a cozy spot during the cool months, or a seat on the sunny patio in the warm ones, we are sure that The Augusta House has something spectacular to offer you today!  A proud member of The Unique Restaurant Group. “Make every night in Hamilton a Unique one!” See Morevisitors alike. about: www.auxecuries.com / 7285, rue Chabot, Montréal (H2E 2K7) / Métro Fabre / 514-328-7437
general information: Chaine Youtube : http://www.youtube.com/user/AUXECURIES
founding date: L'inauguration du nouveau bâtiment a eu lieu le 14 octobre 2011
mission: Le Théâtre Aux Écuries est un incubateur théâtral. C’est un centre de création à l’écoute des rythmes, des besoins, des rêves des créateurs. Le Théâtre Aux Écur...ies soutient les compagnies théâtrales, les artistes indépendants et les auteurs. Son équipe est là pour accompagner leur démarche et leur permettre de créer dans les meilleures conditions possibles. C’est un espace où l’on cherche, où l’on prend son temps.  Le Théâtre Aux Écuries, c’est : La maison des compagnies résidentes et fondatrices; Des projets en incubation sur deux ans, et bien souvent plus; Des résidences de création inspirantes; Des spectacles issus de démarches de création atypique; Un suivi artistique et administratif personnalisé pour chaque créateur; Trois espaces de répétition qu’on souhaite pleins à craquer; Des événements spontanés; Un lien avec le quartier Villeray et ses écoles.  Le public du Théâtre Aux Écuries est curieux, audacieux. Il découvre l’aboutissement des recherches soutenues. Il aime la convivialité, la fête et l’inattendu.  Le Théâtre Aux Écuries est dirigé artistiquement par Nini Bélanger, Navet Confit, Marcelle Dubois, Olivier Ducas, Francis Monty, Olivier Morin, Marilyn Perreault, Annie Ranger et Guillaume Tremblay.   La pluralité des voix, des esthétiques et des réseaux lui confère toute sa richesse et fait partie intégrante de son ADN. Car le théâtre est avant tout un art collectif. See Moreies soutient les compagnies théâtrales, les artistes indépendants et les auteurs. about: The official page of Avant-Garde Bar. Helping people experience ideas, music and cultures.
public transit: Avant-Garde bar is located on 135 ½ Besserer St., Downtown Ottawa, two blocks away from Rideau centre, between Waller St. and Dalhousie St., parallel to Rideau St. The nearby structures are Rideau Centre, Agora book store, Novotel Hotel, Les Suites Hotel and University of Ottawa.
column44: The official page of Avant-Garde Bar.   Community spaces are places where people feel comfortable and are able to connect through common interests and passions....  The idea for Avant-Garde was conceived through many conversations with residents of Ottawa, who craved for a meeting place that inspires. It is not simply an art bar, it is a revolutionary culture hub, where local poets, artists, designers, and political activists gather to discuss and implement their latest projects. We are proud supporters of local and international artists, who love to experiment and push the limits of music. See More  The idea for Avant-Garde was conceived through many conversations with residents of Ottawa, who craved for a meeting place that inspires. It is not simply an art bar, it is a revolutionary culture hub, where local poets, artists, designers, and political activists gather to discuss and implement their latest projects. We are proud supporters of local and international artists, who love to experiment and push the limits of music.

column44: AVERAGE JOE’S SPORTS BAR  Average Joe’s  has become a fixture in the downtown Lethbridge  Sports Bar and entertainment scene.  From it’s beginnings in 2000 in a... cramped but cozy space , to it’s current 10,000 square foot venue, Average Joe’s has been welcoming the people of Lethbridge.  The inviting atmosphere, cozy furnishings, and friendly staff have made this a favorite spot for one and all.  Every day sees working professionals, sports fans, students, and “Average Joe’s” unwinding at the end of the day.    For the sports fan, Average Joe’s is a little piece of heaven, with not a bad seat in the house.  The 10 available satellite or cable feeds allow you to watch the sporting event of your choice on one of 42 televisions, including 3 giant 150 inch screens.  Monday Night Football and Pay Per View UFC Fights are regular events at the bar.  You don’t just have to watch.  Scattered throughout are challenges to try your hand at, such as pool, shuffleboard, foosball, air hockey, buzz time trivia, pinball, darts and numerous video games.  You can even keep your golf swing grooved year round on one of Average Joe’s two Par T golf simulators featuring over 100 famous golf courses from around the world.    Beer is big at Average Joe’s, with 11 kegs on tap and over 40 choices in the cooler.  The sky is the limit when it comes to the types of cocktails and shooters the bartenders can whip up.  The kitchen cooks up a full variety of pub food.  Patrons can choose from over 30 varieties of chicken wings.  Average Joe’s has become famous for it’s homemade burgers made from a well guarded secret recipe.  The pizzas are made in house with many specialty topping combinations.  How about beef jerky or chicken ranch?     JOE’S GARAGE  Average Joe’s Sports Bar has a very special “back room” called Joe’s Garage.  This is where a great range of entertainment takes place.  Three huge garage doors separate the garage from the main bar room.  These doors can be either open or closed depending on what action is happening in the garage.  Regular events include karaoke, dueling pianos and Yuk Yuks comedy club.  The garage stage is also a place for concerts.  It has been the scene of great entertainment from bands like Streetheart, Nazareth, The Irish Descendants and Doug and The Slugs.  There have also been tribute acts, like Johnny Cash and Bon jovi, and local favorites like the Chevelles and Trevor Panzak.  The Garage can also be booked for private functions for groups ranging from 50 to 140.  It is a place to listen, a place to laugh, a place to sing and a place to dance.  No wonder, Joe’s Garage has become a favorite entertainment venue in Lethbridge.  Remember, “ What Happens In the Garage, Stays In The Garage”. column44: Ayer's Cliff Fair is the common name for the Annual Exhibition of the Stanstead County Agricultural Society.  The first meeting of the Stanstead County Agricult...ural Society took place in 1845 and its main purpose was for farmers in the region to get together and exchange ideas on farming. Residents of this county would enter their farm animals and crops for competition. Meanwhile, the ladies would exhibit their cooking and hand-crafted work. From 1845 to 1872, the exhibitions were held at various locations in the county, but in 1872, Ayer's Cliff, Quebec became its permanent home.  The first three-day fair was held in 1913. At that time horse races were one of the attractions. Today the Ayer’s Cliff Fair has maintained the original events but has added various attractions such as: a midway (rides), musical shows and many arcade games with prizes. Families from far and wide come together to enjoy the excitement and camaraderie of this annual exhibition. column44: Established in 1991 and affectionately known as Baba's by its regulars, it is the place to go for live music in a small personal environment. Featuring one of t...he only year round smoking decks in Charlottetown, Baba's has friendly staff, some of the best food in Charlottetown coming from "Cedars Eatery" downstairs, great coffee and live music at least six nights a week.  Due to Baba's size, the bands performance is always intimate and every one has a backstage pass with the opportunity to chat with band members after the show. Baba's has been a starting point gig for bands such as Joel Plaskett, The Trews, Skratch Bastid, Wintersleep, Slowcoaster and Matt Mays. With a strong, loyal, regular clientele base, news about good music spreads through word of mouth fast.  If you're looking to hear a cover band play, this is not the bar for you. Quoted by Much Music as "the World's biggest little rock and roll bar!!" Baba's will always remain true!! about: The oldest theatre in Alberta, generously renovated into a state of the art performing arts facility.
column44: The oldest theatre in Alberta is back on its feet once again. The focus of the new theatre is primarily live performance, including plays and concerts. But, wan...ting to maintain Stan Bailey's legacy of diversity, you'll find that the newly renovated Bailey is quite versatile, and can be a suitable home for multiple performance media. We've taken our vaudevillian stage and added 1.2 million dollars in state of the art theatre tech. Some of this tech includes an Ion touchscreen lighting board, Six robotic arms from Apollo Design Technologies, and a brand new digital fly system. Not content to simply be a state of the art theatre, The Bailey's primary mandate is the maintenance of the historic legacy that it carries, that is, being a cultural nexus within the City of Camrose. A place where the hard working people of Camrose would gather to be entertained, to dive into someone else's story,  to laugh when they laugh, or cry when they cry. Whether it was seeing the rapid fire sitcom-esque vaudvillian shows, throwing popcorn over the balcony, or getting paid an unexpected visit from our resident ghost, everyone leaves the Bailey with new memories. about: Resto-Bar branché du centre-ville d'Alma. Venez découvrir notre succulent menu et prendre un verre entre amis . Le Crapaud est un INCONTOURNABLE !!
column44: Ouvert en 1982, Le Resto-Bar le Crapaud est, depuis plus de 30 ans, une institution pour les habitants d’Alma et de tout le Lac-St-Jean. Situé en plein cœur du ...Centre ville, le complexe du Crapaud c’est une ambiance conviviale, un personnel accueillant et chaleureux ainsi qu’un décor à couper le souffle. Le Crapaud saura vous faire passer de bons moments à coup sûr. Les 60 Employés de l’établissement sont prêts à vous accueillir que ce soit entre amis, en groupe ou en couple!  Ce resto-bar à l’ambiance décontractée et au répertoire musical varié, plaît à toutes les sortes de clientèles. De l’étudiant à l’homme d’affaire, on y vient avant tout pour prendre un verre entre amis, profiter de la terrasse et se rassasier d’un éventail de plats savoureux. Vous avez le cœur à la fête? Une piste de danse au centre de l’établissement et un Dj sachant répondre aux gouts actuels de nos clients sauront vous faire bouger. Finalement, les sportifs y trouveront leurs comptes; puisque nous diffusons également les évènements sportifs majeurs. column44: Établi en 2000 à Trois-Rivières, le Temple a su faire sa place dans le domaine de la vie nocturne pour devenir la référence en matière de festivité entre Québec... et Montréal.  Le Temple est un établissement de 4000 pieds carrés qui est reconnu pour accueillir les plus gros événements nocturnes en Mauricie.  Depuis plus de 15 ans, cette boîte de nuit qui est située en plein coeur du centre-ville de Trois-Rivières fait vibrer les trifluviens.   Nous pouvons retrouver à l'intérieure du commerce, une nouvelle section pub/lounge offrant plusieurs places assises, une piste de dance éclairé par l'un des meilleurs jeux de lumières construit dans les bars du Québec, une section VIP fraîchement rénovée aux tendances du jour et bien sur, l'incontournable terrasse à ciel ouvert sur le toit du célèbre 300 boulevard des forges.  Avec tout ces éléments, nous pouvons vous assurer que notre entreprise à tout ce qu'il faut pour satisfaire tous les types de clients ayant l'esprit festif.  Le Temple  Complice de vos souvenirs See More et Montréal.  Le Temple est un établissement de 4000 pieds carrés qui est reconnu pour accueillir les plus gros événements nocturnes en Mauricie. about: Barsa Taberna is a contemporary Spanish Restaurant situated across the street from the St. Lawrence Market. Ranked top new Restaurant of 2014.
public transit: A short walk from the Union station, downtown Toronto
awards: Top new restaurant 2014 Top 5 designed restaurants in the world 2014 Diner's choice open table 2014, 2015, 2017, 2018
column44: Our philosophy of contemporary Spanish cuisine has its roots in the traditional Spanish Cocina – meaning, tapas to larger plates that include the recipes and in...gredients from the Iberian Peninsula. Barsa's menu is designed to pay tribute to the avant-garde movement of the Nueva Cocina Española in what we call contemporary Spanish gastronomy.  At Barsa, art is not optional. It’s our salt and pepper, we think Gaudi, dare Dali and play Picasso. We are housed in a 19th century heritage protected building where internationally acclaimed designer John Tong has worked closely with owner Aras Azadian to recreate the atmosphere of Barcelona, while paying tribute to the City’s culture and immortalized artists. See Moregredients from the Iberian Peninsula. Barsa's menu is designed to pay tribute to the avant-garde movement of the Nueva Cocina Española in what we call contemporary Spanish gastronomy. Address: 1000 midday valley road Merritt, British Columbia
about: Bass Coast 2020 takes place July 10-13 in Merritt, BC, Canada.   A thoughtfully curated boutique music and art festival.
column44: “A DIY endeavour founded and run by women with no sponsors or corporate presence whatsoever, it’s a unique fixture in a region already known for its plethora of... festivals…” –Resident Advisor   “Bass Coast remains a pillar of not only innovative electronic music and art within the West Coast festival culture, but an event that stays true to the spirit of community building.” - Thump  Bass Coast Festival is a thoughtfully curated boutique music and art festival that takes place in the picturesque shared traditional territories of the Nłeʔkepmx and Sylix. Moving into its 12th year, Bass Coast has garnered a global reputation for showcasing innovative international talent and providing a springboard for Canadian artists.  2019 saw Bass Coast win the acclaimed 'Best Boutique Festival in North America" award from leading industry publication DJMag and make its Boiler Room debut with two full days of programming broadcast live on the preeminent streaming platform.  Bass Coast prides itself in being an inclusive gathering that brings together people from diverse backgrounds and inspires them to participate to the fullest. We invite you to collaborate with us on the 12th edition of Bass Coast Festival, July 10-13, 2020.  www.basscoast.ca See More festivals…” –Resident Advisor   “Bass Coast remains a pillar of not only innovative electronic music and art within the West Coast festival culture, but an event that stays true to the spirit of community building.” - Thump  Bass Coast Festival is a thoughtfully curated boutique music and art festival that takes place in the picturesque shared traditional territories of the Nłeʔkepmx and Sylix. Moving into its 12th year, Bass Coast has garnered a global reputation for showcasing innovative international talent and providing a springboard for Canadian artists.  2019 saw Bass Coast win the acclaimed 'Best Boutique Festival in North America" award from leading industry publication DJMag and make its Boiler Room debut with two full days of programming broadcast live on the preeminent streaming platform.  Bass Coast prides itself in being an inclusive gathering that brings together people from diverse backgrounds and inspires them to participate to the fullest. We invite you to collaborate with us on the 12th edition of Bass Coast Festival, July 10-13, 2020.  www.basscoast.ca

about: The bassment page is where you will find all kinds of info on past,present and up coming artists that will be playing. Please support local talent.   For artist submissions please email info directly to info@thebassmentkamloops.com
column44: Welcome to The Bassment, Kamloops hottest new venue for live music connoisseurs.  Mainstream it isn’t, but neither are the cliental that frequent The Bassment. ...   About the Venue  The Bassment is an intimate 40 person house concert venue which hosts both new and seasoned musical talent en route to larger concert destinations.   By donation cover goes directly to each performer.  Recommended $10 - $15   About the Music  Live rock, folk, indy, blues, jazz and so many more genres of live music are performed in The Bassment.  Please "LIKE" our Facebook page where we feature up and coming artists https://www.facebook.com/bassmentkamloops/timeline?ref=page_internal    Or send an email to dave@idome.ca to be notified of upcoming concert dates and information.   About You  You want in, you must RSVP.  No drop ins - no exception.  The first 40 to RSVP get admitted to The Bassment.   Bring your own beverage.  There is nothing for sale at The Bassment – it’s just pure music.   About The Bassment Hosts  “Build it and they will come” ignited Dave and Ronda Olds vision for The Bassment.  Created out of their own love of music, the musical family dreamed of creating an intimate musical venue where creativity, performance and enjoyment could enrich the musical scene in Kamloops. column44: The Bath Meeting House stands on the banks of the St. John River with the Trans Canada Trail at its rear. Built in 1904 as a Methodist church the simple wooden ...building now serves the area as a historic venue with art exhibits and displays of historical Carleton County photographs.  Music concerts are performed weekly on Tuesday evenings and a Canada Day celebration has become a tradition.  The Meeting House is available for private functions and special events. Act Name: Big Brothers Big Sisters of West Island
Page Types: Charity Organization | Public Service | Nonprofit Organization
about: Big Brothers Big Sisters facilitates life-changing relationships that inspire and empower children and youth to reach their potential, both as individuals and citizens.
general information: Big Brothers Big Sisters of West Island is a non-profit organization. We receive funding from Centraide as well as West Island Community Shares A portion of our funding comes from people like you who participate or help us at various fundraising activities throughout the year.
mission: Big Brothers and Big Sisters of West Island provides life changing relationships to children who are struggling. Many children today face challenges such as bul...lying, low self-esteem, and isolation. We match these children with a positive role model and, through quality one-on-one mentoring, guide them to overcome their obstacles and empower them to reach their full potential, forever changing the child and their community. See Morelying, low self-esteem, and isolation. We match these children with a positive role model and, through quality one-on-one mentoring, guide them to overcome their obstacles and empower them to reach their full potential, forever changing the child and their community.
company overview: For over 96 years, the Big Brothers Big Sisters program has made a difference in the lives of young people by providing a friend where one is needed  Big Brothe...rs Big Sisters of West Island has been creating friendships since 1975. We started out matching Big Brothers with Little Brothers and have grown to include a variety of different programs that serve both boys and girls. We are proud of our achievements and continue to strive to be on the leading edge of the Big Brothers Big Sisters movement in Canada.   Big Brothers of West Island was incorporated in 1975. Our Big Sister service began in 1980. In 1998, we launched our Elementary In-School Mentoring program. In October 2007 the Go Girls!program was implemented. about: http://www.beachesjazz.com July 2 - July 26, 2020FREE ADMISSION!(Thanks to our sponsors, supporters and people like you who keep it free every year!)
column44: The Beaches International Jazz Festival is celebrating it's 29th year, and we want you to come and celebrate with us! about: NYC-inspired restaurant and bar in the heart of West Queen West | Founded by Lynn McNeill and Will Munro in 2003.
general information: The Beaver has been feeding Parkdale and Queen West since 2003, offering quality and healthy comfort food in a laid-back café atmosphere. The café opens at 8 a....m. weekdays for coffee and baked goods. Lunch starts at 11am and the kitchen is open until 11 p.m. seven nights a week, with a killer back patio licensed for your drinking pleasures until 2 a.m. It also just happens to be one of the most vibrant hangouts for the city’s arts and music communities, one the Toronto Star has called “an alt-culture oasis.” Beaver Interior  The neighbourhood café at 1192 Queen West was formerly an art gallery, then a daytime cafe; when owner Lynn McNeil (veteran of Toronto’s bar and restaurant scene)and his then business partner Will Munro (the late, dearly missed local artist of global renown) took over the space. They were ahead of the wave that has transformed the area into a hub of dining and nightlife. The Beaver was first on the block to do brunch right, and a trailblazer in hot evening programming.  Now squarely at the centre of West Queen West action, the Beaver remains the nosh spot of choice for regulars and visitors alike in search of good food in a welcoming locale. They come for their morning cup of 49th Parallel coffee and fresh baked pastries, lunch on grilled panini and homemade soup and dine on signature mains like Smoked Chicken & Apple Quesadilla or Roasted Vegetable Chipotle Chili. On weekends they enjoy brunch staples and Beaver specialties like Baked Chocolate Almond French Toast and a House Sausage that’s actually made in house. Vegetarian and vegan dishes are always on the menu.  At night, the Beaver remains a happening space with rotating special events and guest DJs. Check here for the latest events. From morning to night (and back to the morning after!), the Beaver is your local. See Morem. weekdays for coffee and baked goods. about: A full service Bar & Grill featuring a new and improved menu, daily specials and live entertainment!
column44: The present building which is called "The Beaver Bank Station " was constructed by Daniel Hallisey in 1856 . It served as a hotel to the train station that was ...adjacent to it. Sir Robert Bordon was a frequent visitor to the hotel. This in later years became a telegraph and post office and served the community as such for the next 99 years. Officially named the " Hallisey House" by the Nova Scotia Heritage Society .      The present owners re-opened the Beaver Bank Station as a full service bar and grill at the request of many of the local residents , as they had no local establishment where they could relax,refresh and eat within the community. about: BEERS AT THE BEAR! Live music / DJs / drinks / beer garden / friends / good times
column44: HOME TO THE WEEKLY SESH EVERY TUESDAY NIGHT!   The Welly Club’s little sister, our favourite traditional boozer, The Polar Bear is a music venue steeped in hist...ory, having provided Hullians with live entertainment since the 1800’s.  The Polar Bear team have renovated the pub with a brand-new stage and seated beer garden, whilst still maintaining the ceramic bar (one of only 11 still to remain in the UK) and glass dome ceiling which have made our home a Grade two listed building, keeping the pub’s unique and traditional feel.  The Polar Bear provides a platform for local and national touring musicians every Tuesday with ‘The Sesh’ playing nothing but local music in between the three acts all evening, with DJs after the bands.   Celebrating good music is what the pub does best, and the venue has a variety of weekly nights that we’re very proud of. Including HU5TLE every Friday night, and CULT every Saturday night! See Moreory, having provided Hullians with live entertainment since the 1800’s. about: Bell MTS Place is True North Sports + Entertainment's marquee entertainment facility and hosts a variety of premier sports, music and entertainment events.
column44: Consistently lauded as one of the top sports and entertainment arenas in North America, Bell MTS Place has hosted many of the biggest musical/entertainment acts... and sporting events their respective industries have to offer. Regarded as one of the busiest arenas in Canada since its opening in 2004, Bell MTS Place hosts over 140 events a year. The success of Bell MTS Place stems from its unwavering commitment to providing a superior patron experience – at every event. Leading that charge are True North employees who seek to exceed expectations for customer service, operations and security at Bell MTS Place. The venue is not only a meeting place for premiere sports and entertainment events, it has also been a catalyst for development in downtown Winnipeg. Often cited as the anchor of Winnipeg’s downtown renaissance, a number of major projects designed to draw people to live and work in downtown Winnipeg are sprouting up all around Bell MTS Place including True North Square. about: Live music and performing arts facility. We also facilitate performance classes, visual arts as well as fashion arts classes.
column44: Located on the east side of Airdrie right next to Genesis Place and East Lake Park, Bert Church Live Theatre is a fully equipped, live performing arts facility....    The 377-seat facility provides audiences with a unique opportunity to experience world renowned performers in a local setting.   The facility features professional grade sound and lighting systems, combined with the charm of a small city venue that provides an up close and personal experience, free parking and is completely wheelchair accessible.   International stars such as Sass Jordan, Michelle Wright, Barney Bentall, Rik Emmett, 54-40, Jeff Martin and Sylvia Tyson have all graced our stage in recent years.   The theatre also hosts performing arts classes and camps for young people throughout the year. Page Types: Brewery | Beer Bar | Bed and Breakfast
about: Located on 53 acres of St. John River waterfront. We are accessible by boat in the summer, four wheeler in the fall and ski-doo in the winter! TCH exit 231
general information: Manager: Pete Cole
column44: For sales during Sun-Wed please call for an appointment 506-575-1093  A unique and inviting place to stop 2 minutes from the TCH! ...  Craft Brewery and B&B!  Licensed to sell by glass while overlooking the Saint John River.... and we sell 900ml and 1.89l Grunters/Growlers to take home!  We are located on the 53 acres of St. John River waterfront. Bed and Breakfast has 3 luxurious rooms with en suite, overlooking the water! Each room has a flat screen TV, comfortable chiropractic bed, heated floor bathroom with a tiled shower or a Jacuzzi tub; two rooms have their private sunrooms! We are conveniently located: only 2 minutes off the Trans-Canada highway, 15 minute drive from Kings Landing Historical Settlement. We are also accessible via four wheeler trails in the fall, by boat in the summer and ski doo trails in the winter! Our backyard trails tie into the provincial four wheeler and cross country skiing trails. Parking onsite for those travelling by car and 3 garages for bikers/ snowmobilers to store their rides overnight! You can sample our craft beer in a rustic atmosphere, while enjoying the view over beautiful Saint John River!  Come enjoy our European style breakfast that includes freshly baked homemade croissants, fresh fruit, and selection of jams, ham and cheese, fresh juice and coffee or tea. On occasion, we can also offer gourmet dinner options made with local seasonal ingredients. Please contact us for more details! Looking forward to welcoming you! about: Le Bistro vous propose une rencontre entre les terroirs locaux et la cuisine internationale.
column44: Le Bistro de L’Anse est installé dans un ancien camp de pêche construit en 1859 par Sir William Price, baron de la forêt. En 2002, cinq entrepreneurs du coin y ...ont démarré un bistro culturel qui devient rapidement un incontournable. En 2013, une coopérative de solidarité est formée par les travailleurs et les fidèles clients de l’entreprise afin de prendre la relève et poursuivre l’aventure. C’est en 2015 qu’une nouvelle branche s’ajoute aux activités de la coopérative : la création de la Microbrasserie la Chasse-pinte. Située dans l’ancienne caserne de pompiers du village, ses bières sont disponibles au Bistro de L’Anse et distribuées dans les épiceries de la région.  Le chef du Bistro, Didier Grimard, vous propose une rencontre entre les terroirs locaux et la cuisine internationale. Tous les samedis soirs, le Bistro se transforme en salle de spectacle et vous présente des groupes émergents du Québec et de la région. See Moreont démarré un bistro culturel qui devient rapidement un incontournable. column44: Blackjacks Roadhouse & Games Room features great Canadian and Chinese food. When you're a truck stop as big as we are, you have to cater to everyone. Our menu o...ffers "Trucker-Size" portions so big, we guarantee you won't leave hungry. For those late night customers we offer home cooked meals with breakfast 24/7.  Our pub & games room featuring 30 VlLTs, 5 min keno, Lotto 649 & Lotto Max that operates from 10AM to 3AM daily. The style of the roadhouse brings you back to days gone by with one of the largest collections of trucking, oilfield, farming, and motor sports racing memorabilia you will ever see. Our customers spend hours checking out our collection.    Blackjacks Roadhouse provides their own Free Shuttle Bus Service to and from Edmonton International Airport, all local hotels, Leduc, Nisku, Beaumont, Devon, and Castrol Raceway.  Castrol raceway is just across the highway and Blackjacks has become the meeting place for racers and patrons attending events from across North America.  With our stage and the most advanced sound equipment system in the area. Blackjacks Roadhouse is a leader in live entertainment.  We pride ourselves on Country and Country/Rock entertainment. Address: 5100 - 41 Avenue, Heritage Park Stony Plain, Alberta
about: Bluegrass Festival, July 31 to August 2, 2020 held in Stony Plain, just west of Edmonton Alberta.
column44: The Blueberry Bluegrass and Country Music Festival, located in Stony Plain Alberta, just west of Edmonton, is Canada's biggest bluegrass festival. Some of the b...iggest names in country and bluegrass have graced this festivals stage. Such as: Marty Stuart, Rhonda Vincent & the Rage, Del McCoury, Bill Monroe, Jimmy Martin, Claire Lynch and many others including some fine local talent. Blueberry is a supporter of local emerging talent. In 2017 we added two stages and indoor stage and a stage at the Pioneer Museum. The Venue has onsite reserved and un-reseerved camping available. Kids 16 and under are free when accompanied by an adult. A kids zone of games and crafts  will be held on the saturday and sunday. Parking lot jamming almost always follows after concerts so bring your instruments to join in on the fun! Concessions are also available for daytime snacking. Myhre's Music has a booth at this festival so don't worry about forgetting those picks, tuners, or capos. Myhres also has some quality instruments on display. Performers will be selling their merchandise at the festival. ATM machine available on site. Hope to see all of your smiling faces at the festival! Soon! See Moreiggest names in country and bluegrass have graced this festivals stage. Such as: Marty Stuart, Rhonda Vincent & the Rage, Del McCoury, Bill Monroe, Jimmy Martin, Claire Lynch and many others including some fine local talent. Blueberry is a supporter of local emerging talent. In 2017 we added two stages and indoor stage and a stage at the Pioneer Museum. The Venue has onsite reserved and un-reseerved camping available. Kids 16 and under are free when accompanied by an adult. A kids zone of games and crafts  will be held on the saturday and sunday. Parking lot jamming almost always follows after concerts so bring your instruments to join in on the fun! Concessions are also available for daytime snacking. Act Name: BlueShore Financial Centre for the Performing Arts at Capilano University
Address: Capilano University, 2055 Purcell Way North Vancouver, British Columbia
about: Visit our theatre at North Vancouver's Capilano University. Presenters of Jazz, Global Roots, Classical/Choral & Theatre.
column44: The BlueShore Financial Centre for the Performing Arts officially opened in October 1997 as the Capilano College Performing Arts Theatre. In support of the inst...itution's performing arts programs, the 372 seat theatre was built as a much needed performance space designed to nurture and showcase the university's emerging artists.   The centre has evolved to encompass a broad range of artistic programming including the founding and production of several distinct series including the Cap Jazz Series, Cap Global Roots Series, Cap Classical/Choral Series, Cap Theatre Series, the North Shore Jazz Series and the Pacific Arbour Speaker Series.  In June 2011, The Capilano Performing Arts Theatre became the North Shore Credit Union Centre for the Performing Arts. The name changed in September 2013 to The BlueShore Financial Centre for the Performing Arts. See Moreitution's performing arts programs, the 372 seat theatre was built as a much needed performance space designed to nurture and showcase the university's emerging artists. But beware, we reserve the right to hide or delete comments and/or block users who forget to use their manners. We don't want to take such drastic measures, so please brush up on your etiquette before posting on our page! What are you bringing to the table? •	Good chats o	We do not condone any racist, sexist, abusive, profane and/or explicit language anywhere on our page. o	 Boston Pizza complies with Facebook's Terms of Use and Code of Conduct and all postings are subject to the same rules. •	Good peeps o	We do not condone anything that breaks the law or promotes violence. column44: Albion, c’est le nom historique et poétique de l’Angleterre, mais c’est aussi une brasserie 100% lanaudoise. À l'Albion, ce sont donc des bières brassées sur pl...ace d’inspiration britannique qui vous sont proposées, le tout dans une ambiance chaleureuse et décontractée. Sachez qu’un soin immense est apporté tant au brassage qu’au service de nos bières. Nous sommes dotés du permis de brasseur artisan, ce qui veux dire que nos bières sont disponibles seulement à notre établissement.   Avec nos prix spéciaux au 5 à 7, notre terrasse l'été et l'ambiance incomparable de la place; l'Albion, c'est l'endroit idéal pour venir boire une bonne bière à Joliette! column44: Blanc de Blanc est un oasis de paix. Avec son ambiance intime et chaleureuse, des repas savoureux préparés avec amour, des pâtisseries cuisinées tous les matins... et un personnel accueillant, il saura vous charmer...  Offrant Internet sans fil gratuit, Blanc de Blanc est la destination de rêve pour ceux qui veulent travailler ou se détendre, rencontrer des amis ou se retrouver en famille en prenant un bon café et bien manger. Notre sélection de thés saura tout autant vous plaire.   En plus d'être un petit café chaleureux, Blanc de Blanc est aussi une buanderie. Venir y faire son lavage est un vrai plaisir !  Nous avons plusieurs options végétariennes au menu.   Blanc de Blanc is an oasis of peace. With its great menu, fresh pastries baked every morning and a welcoming staff, it is sure to make you want to come back! about: Budweiser Gardens is an award-winning, multi-purpose venue operated by Spectra Venue Management (formerly Global Spectrum), home of the London Knights.
column44: Spectra by Comcast Spectacor is the expert in hosting and entertainment, partnering with over 300 clients at 400 global properties to create memorable experienc...es for millions of visitors every year. Spectra’s expertise is embodied within three main divisions: Venue Management (formerly Global Spectrum), Food Services & Hospitality (formerly Ovations Food Services), and Ticketing & Fan Engagement (formerly Paciolan). Learn more at SpectraExperiences.com.  Budweiser Gardens opened in 2002 and is a two-time recipient of Major Facility of the Year (awarded at the Canadian Broadcast Industry Awards) in 2010 and 2012. The venue is also one of the highest ranked venues of its size in gross ticket sales within North America according to Billboard Magazine.  In addition to being the home of the London Knights of the OHL and London Lightning of the NBL, Budweiser Gardens hosts a variety of concerts and entertainment events. about: We are a volunteer-run, all-ages, community-based space on Niagara Street in Buffalo's West Side.  Our hours vary as we are only open for events.
column44: Sugar City exists to organize alternative community arts and cultural events in the buffalo area. Our goal is to share and create art based on participatory cul...ture and a do-it-together attitude. Events and initiatives include, but are not limited to music, films, a zine library, meeting space, local craft corner, art gallery, workshops, and workspaces. We want to break down the barriers of what is and isn't "art" because in some way everyone is an artist. Sugar City is about sharing creativity and energy. This organization focuses itself on the exhibition, performance, and creation of art for those who cannot obtain space from traditional sources.   Hours vary. We are more so event based. When we have art exhibits we have open gallery hours Friday 5:30-7:30PM. Please visit our website to check our calendar.  www.buffalosugarcity.org  We do not conduct any official business via Facebook.  Please email us buffalosugarcity@gmail.com for any inquiries.  Please be patient in waiting for a response as we are a volunteer run collaborative or come down to an event to talk with someone in person. You can find some info at buffalosugarcity.org See Moreture and a do-it-together attitude. about: The Burlington Performing Arts Centre (BPAC), located in beautiful downtown Burlington, is a cultural hub of the community and offers the best in the performing arts to the citizens of Burlington.
column44: The Burlington Performing Arts Centre offers vibrant and diverse entertainment for people of all ages. From classical to hip-hop, blues to ballet, and side-spli...tting comedy to incredible illusionists, there truly is something for everyone. Located just steps from Lake Ontario on Burlington’s beautiful waterfront, and within walking distance of numerous restaurants and shops, a visit to The Burlington Performing Arts Centre is sure to inspire and delight!  The Burlington Performing Arts Centre is the only freestanding green performing arts centre in Canada. Built to Leadership in Environmental Design (LEED) standards, the result is a performing arts centre that has a reduced impact on the environment.  Rent one of The Centre's four unique spaces for your next event!  bpacsales@burlington.ca http://www.burlingtonpac.ca/rent-the-centre.html See Moretting comedy to incredible illusionists, there truly is something for everyone.
