Page Types: Winery/Vineyard | Wine Bar | Live Music Venue
about: An adventurous renaissance in winemaking.
company overview: In the 1669, French explorers Dollier and Galinée travelled by canoe along the miles of sand beaches and shoreline of Lake Erie. At what is now Port Dover, they... made camp for the winter. Here they discovered what they described as an earthly paradise. Galinee was so awed by what he saw, and perhaps inspired by what he tasted, that he came to foretell the region’s wine future:  “I will tell you, by the way, that the vine grows here only in the sand, on the banks of lakes and rivers, but although it has no cultivation it does not fail to produce grapes in great quantities as large and as sweet as the finest of France. We even made wine of them, with which M. Dollier said holy mass all winter, and it was as good as vin de Grave. It is a heavy, dark wine like the latter. Only red grapes are seen, but in so great quantities that we found places where one could easily have made 25 to 30 hogsheads of wine!” - The Journey of Dollier and Galinée (1669-1670)  Jump forward over three hundred years. Seven individuals inspired by the land and its rich history, heritage and various cultural backgrounds, formed a partnership and established Burning Kiln Winery. These individuals (Frank DeLeebeeck, Mike McArthur, Scott Fixter, Dave Pond, Todd Saunders, Steve Malo and Gord Malo) combined their skills, talents and passions for people and place to create a destination full of wine and adventure.  Norfolk County is located in Ontario’s South Coast and geographically rests on the huge delta sandplain left over from the glacial deposits from thousands of years ago at the end of the last ice age. With a moderate climate and long growing seasons, the area eventually became home to abundant flora and fauna as well many great farms that included tobacco. The Burning Kiln name recalls the dangers of early tobacco farming and marks the end of this traditional farming activity today. From these ashes and traditions has emerged the rebirth and renaissance of what Dollier and Galinée had discovered – great land, great wine and great adventure!  The vineyard lands have adopted the noble European vinifera varietals including Pinot Noir, Chardonnay, Riesling, Cabernet Franc, Merlot and Savagnin vines first planted in 2006. Burning Kiln celebrated a remarkable first harvest in 2010 after a long summer of sun and warm lake breezes.  The first wines will be released in the Spring of 2011. about: Nanaimo's favourite specialty coffee house!  **Hashtag your photos on Instagram at #buzznanaimo
column44: The Buzz Coffee House is the fulfillment of a dream Scott and Kara Henderson had for a number of years, a place where people feel welcome, where community is bu...ilt, where customer service is key, and where we can serve the best darn coffee in Nanaimo!  We invite you to join us for coffee, tea, smoothies, goodies, and light lunches.   We are proud to serve Moja Coffee from North Van, Mighty Leaf Teas,  Fruit Smoothies, and Red Espresso Rooibos Tea.  We also sell whole beans or ground coffee, as well as Aeropress' and Aeropress grinders and other coffee products, so you can enjoy our coffee at home!  We are pleased to announce that Francine Baker has taken the reigns as the new owner of The Buzz Coffee House. column44: Le Cabaret de la dernière chance va fêter ses 34 ans, le 15 décembre 2016. Son mandat, depuis toujours, est de faire en sorte que les artistes en marge aient un...e place pour s’exprimer dans des conditions professionnelles, à longueur d’année. La renommée du Cabaret dans le milieu artistique provincial, n’est plus à faire. Elle est en partie basée sur son ouverture d’esprit, axée vers la liberté de création et l’innovation. « La Culture  se Vit! La Vie se passe… » De pairs avec Les Productions Parallèle 48, nous croyions que ce qui est important, c’est que les différentes cultures circulent. Notre  but commun, c’est de donner l’opportunité au gens d’ici, d’avoir  accès aux artistes en marge à l’année longue. Le Cabaret donne priorité à la qualité d’une création, sur sa rentabilité pour l’entreprise. Nous croyions que la c’est la vie culturelle, qui fait Vivre et fait vibrer les régions. Le Cabaret de la dernière chance pour l’Abitibi-Témiscamingue, c’est à la fois, l’acteur d’une vie culturelle florissante, l’égide protégeant la culture d’ici et  l’institution amenant les meilleures artistes de la relève du Québec à visiter la région.   Grâce à notre équipe conviviale et volontaire, nous continuerons d’épauler les artistes d’ici et d’ailleurs, en contribuant à rendre leurs créativités accessibles au plus grand nombre.   Les artistes, les organismes culturels et les festivals choisissent le Cabaret de la dernière chance pour ses qualités, sa philosophie, et son histoire. Nous croyons que le milieu culturel en général est conscient du trésor qu’est pour lui, ce lieu. Le Cabaret de la dernière chance est reconnaissant de l’apport collectif des artistes, à son entreprise et à l’ensemble de la population. En conséquence, il s’engage à aider les artistes. Le Cabaret tente sur mesure de correspondre, comprendre et répondre, aux besoins immédiats des artistes dans la mesure de ses moyens. Il offre gratuitement l’opportunité aux artistes d’exprimer leurs créations dans son enceinte. De surcroît, Le Cabaret se hasarde à traiter les artistes avec tout le respect qu’ils méritent.   Le spectateur, quant à lui, vient s’abreuver… Surtout de ce que les artistes ont à lui raconter par le biais de leurs œuvres musicales ou théâtrales, de leurs expositions, de leurs vidéos, de leurs poésies… et de l’espoir qui s’en dégage.  Le Cabaret de la dernière chance, c’est un train qui roule 7 jours sur 7, 12 heures par jours, 365 jours par année (ou presque) et qui ne peut se permettre de ralentir bien longtemps. C’est  un lièvre qui coure la nuit… À l’affût de l’idée, de l’aide, ou du petit quelque chose qui fera toute la différence... Amener quelqu’un de l’extérieur au Cabaret de la dernière, c’est comme un cadeau que l’on fait, pour le plaisir que ça procure de part et d’autre. Le Cabaret de la dernière chance est pour plusieurs une fierté régionale, comme la maison naturelle de notre expression culturelle locale. Le Cabaret de la dernière chance, c’est l’ami qui est là, pour nous ramasser et nous remettre sur pied. C’est la place où chacun se retrouve à un moment ou à un autre, à la recherche consciente ou non, de quelque chose qui les aidera à se retrouver eux- même. Le Cabaret de la dernière chance fait partie de ces rares endroits au Québec, où l’on entend l’écho du cri fragile de notre identité. column44: Since the official opening in October of 2002 we have made it our mission to provide wholesome foods prepared with the finest ingredients, as you would in your ...own home.  At Café 349 we serve fresh and often home-grown ingredients in stylish presentations of robust proportions.    We offer a full menu along with ever-changing “featured lunches” designed to tempt your tastebuds.   The combination of delicious homemade food and hand-crafted artwork creates a dining experience which is in perfect harmony with the café’s tranquil atmosphere and inviting décor. We are continuously attempting to improve and expand on what we have to offer our customers.   Ruth Smiley-Hahn, Proprietor   We are now a bring your own wine, beer and coolers restaurant! about: We are the locals. We are a Conscious Coffee Collective nestled in the heart of Crestwood offering hand-crafted food and drinks.
company overview: Café Blackbird was created from the idea that there is strength in community. To be a good neighbour is to help grow, promote, and support those who surround us.... Giving back in every way possible. Nestled in the heart of Crestwood we offer a place that welcomes everyone, providing the best experience and quality possible. From our locally sourced ingredients to our knowledgeable staff who prepare them for you. Passion flows throughout our veins. From the years we spent on the hunt to source the best roast of coffee; the determination to get as close to farm to table as possible; to promoting local artists and showcasing their work on our walls. We are a collective. We are passionate people who have come together to make a small dent in the world… one sip at a time. See More. Giving back in every way possible. Nestled in the heart of Crestwood we offer a place that welcomes everyone, providing the best experience and quality possible. From the years we spent on the hunt to source the best roast of coffee; the determination to get as close to farm to table as possible; to promoting local artists and showcasing their work on our walls. We are a collective. We are passionate people who have come together to make a small dent in the world… one sip at a time.
products: We believe that good quality food brings people together. It should not only feed our stomachs but our souls. That is why we use the best ingredients we can fin...d. The ones closest to home sourced right here in Edmonton. From our perfectly roasted coffee courtesy of Ace Coffee Roasters. Our beautifully blended teas brought to you by The Tea Girl. Freshly baked bread from Cob’s Crestwood. Along with a hint of spice in our specialty meats thanks to Meuwly’s. Plus, that little touch of green… compliments of Reclaim Urban Farm. See Mored. The ones closest to home sourced right here in Edmonton. From our perfectly roasted coffee courtesy of Ace Coffee Roasters. Our beautifully blended teas brought to you by The Tea Girl. column44: At Café Blackbird we do things differently. There is a passion that brews inside of us and we aren’t just talking about our coffee brew. We’re talking about eve...rything that we do and all that we are. So, who are we? We are the locals. We’re your neighbour. Your home. Your office. Your meeting space. Your getaway. We’re the perfect stop along your daily route.   Let’s break it down. We focus on quality. We focus on local. We focus on fresh. With our hand-crafted menus using quality local ingredients, to the perfectly dialed espresso, making you a normal human every morning. We are the proud Edmontonians, a creative conscious collective, who strive to make a difference in our City. See Morerything that we do and all that we are. So, who are we? We are the locals. column44: Cafe Latte Cino is a wonderful Cafe located in Orleans. We are open daily starting bright and early at 7:00 am and going late into the evening until 10:00 pm.  ...We offer a great selection of items for breakfast including waffles, french toast, eggs, sandwiches.  You can also have freshly squeezed juices and fresh made smoothies. For lunch and throughout the day, our paninis and sandwiches are mouth watering.  Each day you'll find a large variety of fresh, in-house made salads and soups.  You can also come in to please your sweet tooth with the most delicious cakes and deserts around.    When it comes to coffees and such we are proud to say we use top grade coffees. They are fresh roasted and ground each day so that you can enjoy premium coffees any time you visit.  Our Chai Lattes have the biggest following in this end of town and our Matcha is again, the best around. about: The Cafe Meteor Bistro was located downtown Haileybury. It was in operation from 2017 until 2019.  It has been sold and is now operated as a micro-brewery/brew-pub by Whiskeyjack Beer Company.
column44: The Cafe Meteor Bistro  is located downtown Haileybury at 485 Ferguson, a few steps from lake Temiskaming and the marina.  The restaurant is named after the fam...ous steamship that navigated  Lake Temiskaming for 40 years and brought pioneers on both sides of the Lake.   For the morning Café, we have our own Meteor coffee blend, our lattes, fresh pastries and breakfast sandwiches.  For lunch, we offer local comfort food and our menu changes every day.  Come and take a look at our ready-to-go options.  Le Café METEOR Bistro situé au 485 Ferguson au centre-ville de Haileybury et tout près du lac Témiskaming et de la marina, et nommé en l'honneur du  Météor a été le plus célèbre bateau à vapeur à avoir navigué sur le lac Témiskaming.  Pendant 40 ans il a amené des pionniers des deux côtés du lac.  Nous offrons le matin notre café Meteor, nos espressos et lattés, des pâtisseries fraiches et les sandwichs déjeunés.   Le midi nous offrons des plats réconfortants préparés avec des aliments locaux.  Nous avons une sélection de prêts à emporter dans nos frigos. about: Le Comité d’accueil international des Bois-Francs (CAIBF) est un organisme sans but lucratif, fondé en 1972, qui soutient les personnes immigrantes.
general information: Téléphone : 819 795-3814    Télécopieur : 819 795-4494     Courriel : info@caibf.ca   Site Internet: www.caibf.ca      Facebook, YouTube et Flickr : CAIBF          Secteur d'activité : Accueil, établissement et suivi des personnes immigrantes et réfugiées
mission: Favoriser l’intégration des personnes immigrantes à la terre d’accueil ainsi que le développement de leur autonomie;  Être une ressource d’aide, d’information e...t de référence pour les immigrants;  Encourager les rapports harmonieux et le dialogue entre la population locale et les nouveaux arrivants afin de contrer les attitudes racistes. See Moret de référence pour les immigrants;  Encourager les rapports harmonieux et le dialogue entre la population locale et les nouveaux arrivants afin de contrer les attitudes racistes.
company overview: Fondé en 1972 et incorporé en 1978, le Comité d’accueil international des Bois-Francs (CAIBF) est un organisme sans but lucratif qui offre son soutien pour l’ac...cueil, l’établissement, le suivi et l’intégration sociale des personnes immigrantes et réfugiées dans Victoriaville et sa région. Le CAIBF est mandaté et soutenu par le ministère de l’Immigration et des Communautés culturelles (MICC). mission: To bring the best Blues and only Blues music acts together for a 3 day festival of love, peace and music in Calabogie, Ontario
column44: Blues artists and ribbers from across Canada and the US will gather August 14, 15, 16  2015 at Calabogie Peaks Resort to celebrate the second annual Class Axe G...uitars - Calabogie Blues & Ribfest, in partnership with 101.9 DAWG FM.  More than just an occasion to get out for the weekend and listen to live blues bands from across Canada, Class Axe Guitars, 101.9 DAWG FM and Calabogie Peaks have integrated their blues fest with a rib fest – for a weekend long celebration of all things ribs and blues!    A portion of proceeds from the event will go to local and national charities including the Cystic Fibrosis Foundation, and Blues in Schools.   VISITORS CAN ENJOY...  - Canadian and US ribbers - live blues music  - a beer garden  - fun photo booth - a vendor’s area  - a kids’ zone with face painting and rides  - the 101.9 DAWG FM Blues Cruiser  - camping overnight  AND MUCH MORE!! See Moreuitars - Calabogie Blues & Ribfest, in partnership with 101.9 DAWG FM. A portion of proceeds from the event will go to local and national charities including the Cystic Fibrosis Foundation, and Blues in Schools. Address: 88 Canada Olympic Rd SW Suite 140 Calgary, Alberta
about: WinSport provides world-class sport facilities where Canadian athletes and the public can discover, develop and excel.
public transit: #408 from Brentwood LRT station.
company overview: A not-for-profit organization, WinSport owns and operates Canada Olympic Park in Calgary, the Bill Warren Training Centre at the Canmore Nordic Centre in Canmor...e Alberta, and the Beckie Scott High Performance Training Centre on Haig Glacier Alberta. WinSport also funds two-thirds of the operating budget for the Olympic Oval at the University of Calgary. Money spent at WinSport facilities supports not only Canadian high-performance athletes, but introduces thousands of Calgarians to mountain-based sports each year.   Formerly known as the Calgary Olympic Development Association (CODA), WinSport was founded in 1956 to bid on behalf of Calgary to host an Olympic Winter Games. CODA successfully won the bid from the International Olympic Committee on Sept. 30, 1981, for Calgary to become the host city for the XV Olympic Winter Games in 1988.   Following the Olympics in 1988 and benefitting from endowment funds left for the Games’ legacy, CODA has evolved into a new vision with the transition to WinSport. Through WinSport, the legacy of the 1988 Games is being maintained through allowing people of all ages to discover, develop and excel at sport. See Moree Alberta, and the Beckie Scott High Performance Training Centre on Haig Glacier Alberta. WinSport also funds two-thirds of the operating budget for the Olympic Oval at the University of Calgary. about: The Canadian Music Centre BC offers an extensive public lending library of Canadian music; a music print and bind service; a range of composition, educational and appreciation programs; as well as rentals of our Murray Adaskin Salon and CREATE boardroom.
mission: The Canadian Music Centre is the catalyst that connects you to the ever-changing world of Canadian musical creativity through performance, education and promotion.
company overview: The Canadian Music Centre is a national, non-profit, non-government organization dedicated to disseminating and promoting Canadian contemporary music in Canada ...and around the world.  There are five regional offices across Canada, including the Prairie Region located in Calgary, Alberta, the Quebec Region, located in Montreal, the Atlantic Region, located in Sackville, New Brunswick and the national office and regional office of Ontario which is located in Toronto.  A Canadian cultural treasure, the CMC provides access to a diverse and extensive repertoire of original scores by Canadian composers covering a vast range of musical styles and genres. These are available to the public by request.  Many of the CMC's Associate Composers are award winning, internationally acclaimed artists with works in television, film and major festivals worldwide.  The CMC BC library consists of over 15 000 scores and 5 500 recordings.  Alongside these are books, scores, composer supplies and specially-produced manuscript paper available for purchase. The office also holds a workshop space with in house printing and binding services available to both Associate Composers and non-associate composers. See Moreand around the world.  There are five regional offices across Canada, including the Prairie Region located in Calgary, Alberta, the Quebec Region, located in Montreal, the Atlantic Region, located in Sackville, New Brunswick and the national office and regional office of Ontario which is located in Toronto. The CMC BC library consists of over 15 000 scores and 5 500 recordings.  Alongside these are books, scores, composer supplies and specially-produced manuscript paper available for purchase. The office also holds a workshop space with in house printing and binding services available to both Associate Composers and non-associate composers.
column44: The Canadian Music Centre's Vancouver Creative Hub offers an extensive public lending library of Canadian music; an exclusive music print and bind service; a th...ought-through range of composition educational and appreciation programs; as well as providing creative services and facilities to leading performing arts organizations, orchestras, choirs, teachers, universities, music schools, ensembles, performing artists and conductors.  We also offer a subscription concert series in the new Murray Adaskin Salon. Both the Adaskin Salon and our upgraded CREATE Board Room are also available to rent for rehearsals, performances and meetings. Address: Canberra Theatre Centre, Civic Square/London Cct Canberra, Australian Capital Territory
about: We are Canberra's premiere performing arts venue, hosting theatre, dance, music and special events.
public transit: ACT Action Buses or Light Rail can be taken into the City Interchange to make your way to the Canberra Theatre Centre. (http://www.action.act.gov.au)Local taxis can also be taken to make your way to the Canberra Theatre Centre.
column44: Canberra Theatre Centre is Canberra's premier performing arts venue, providing world class performing arts and entertainment to the people of Canberra and surro...unding regions.  Canberra Theatre Centre includes the 1,244 seat Canberra Theatre, The Playhouse seating 618 and The Courtyard Studio, an intimate rehearsal and performance space that seats up to 90 patrons. The Link connects the Canberra Theatre and The Playhouse and includes exhibition and function areas. The Centre also has a comprehensive technical workshop, backstage and dressing room areas, and is fully equipped with up-to-date lighting and audio facilities.  Located centrally in Civic Square, Canberra Theatre Centre is the focal point for performing arts in Canberra and is often considered the heart of the city. The Canberra Theatre Centre was opened in 1965 and The Playhouse was rebuilt and opened again in 1998 with a gala concert.  Canberra Theatre Centre provides the city with the finest performing arts and the most diverse selection of entertainment from around the country including theatre, drama, dance, cabaret, circus, comedy, all genres of music, musicals, puppetry and physical theatre. Through the use of The Courtyard Studio it also provides a performance space for many local theatre companies and performers.  Canberra Theatre Centre gratefully acknowledges the support of the sponsors and funding bodies. See Moreunding regions. column44: Located in beautiful historic Port Hope, Ontario - the Capitol Theatre is an architectural gem.  Open year-round offering professional theatre, concerts, films ...and High Definition Events including the Metropolitan Opera & British National Theatre.  Artistic Director & General Manager: Antonio Sarmiento Business Manager:  Shannon Oliver Facilities Co-ordinator: Dana Kerr Box Office:  Cindy Fortner Communications: Elizabeth Edwards Finance: Beth Smith Technical Support: Philip Reed  An architectural gem, the Capitol Theatre was built in 1930 as one of the first theatres built for 'talking pictures'. about: Le Centre des arts de la scène du Grand Moncton / Greater Moncton Performing Arts Centre
company overview: En 1991, le Théâtre Capitol ainsi que l’Empress, un petit théâtre adjacent, ont été achetés par la Ville de Moncton et ont été dotés d’un conseil d’administrati...on. Le Capitol avait jadis été transformé en une salle de cinéma, mais les habitants de Moncton souhaitaient rendre à l’édifice sa gloire d’antan. La restauration de ce monument imposant du patrimoine de la Ville a débuté en février 1992. Lors de leur première visite au Capitol, les rénovateurs ont découvert, dissimulés sous quatre couches de peinture, des traces de nombreux dessins faits au pochoir, des feuilles dorées, et même des fresques ! Tout semblait indiquer que, à son apogée, le Capitol avait été décoré selon le style des Pantages et d’autres théâtres de vaudeville. Cette découverte a mené à la décision de restaurer le Capitol conformément à l’image qu’il avait en 1922, ce qui en fait un des huit théâtres du genre au Canada.   In 1991, the Capitol Theatre, together with the smaller, adjoining Empress Theatre, was purchased by the City of Moncton and assigned a Board of Directors. The Theatre had been converted many years before into a movie cinema, but Monctonians now wished to restore the building to its former glory. Restoration of this stately piece of Moncton heritage began in February 1992. The City enlisted consultants David and Patti Hannivan of Hannivan & Company Limited, Ontario, a firm with extensive experience in theatre restoration. On their first visit to the Capitol, the Hannivans probed beneath four coats of paint and discovered evidence of extensive stenciling, gold leafing, and even murals! Indications were that the Capitol had in its heyday, been decorated in the style of the Pantages and other Vaudeville theatres. This find influenced the decision to restore the Capitol to its original look of 1922, making it one of only eight such theatres in Canada. See Moreon. about: Le Carrefour Beausoleil  offre une variété d'outils nécessaires à son développement, tant sur le plan socio-culturel que récréatif.
column44: Bienvenue dans le monde culturel des francophones de la Miramichi. À chaque année, nous vous offrons une programmation annuelle mariant la variété, les valeurs ...sûres et les découvertes de l'Acadie et d'ailleurs. Nos coûts d'admission sont très abordables et nos installations modernes; le Théâtre Gilles Laplante et la Galerie ARTcadienne, sont prêts à vous accueillir depuis déjà 25 ans. Le centre Carrefour Beausoleil bouillonne de vitalité culturelle, tant au niveau du théâtre scolaire et communautaire, au niveau du développement des talents locaux que par la multitude de rencontres intimes avec vos artistes préférés. column44: CHIC ESCAPADE  Construit dans l'ancienne carrière aux abords du lac Leamy, sur un site naturel exceptionnel, le Casino du Lac-Leamy (anciennement le Casino de H...ull) a été inauguré le 24 mars 1996.  Au cours de l'exercice 2000-2001, la Société des casinos du Québec a mis en œuvre un vaste projet d'expansion de ce site, évalué à 210 millions de dollars, qui visait l'agrandissement du Casino, la construction d'un hôtel de 350 chambres (le Hilton Lac-Leamy), d'un centre de congrès et d'une salle de spectacle. L'hôtel Hilton Lac-Leamy et le Théâtre du Casino ont ouvert leurs portes à l'automne 2001.  En 2009, le Théâtre du Casino a subi des modifications permettant d'en faire une salle multifonctionnelle.  Le Casino compte près de 60 tables de jeu dont 12 tables de poker Texas Hold'em et plus de 1 800 machines à sous.  À 5 minutes du centre-ville d'Ottawa, le Casino du Lac-Leamy propose une expérience unique de divertissement. Laissez-vous prendre au jeu dans une ambiance conviviale et un décor distingué. Situé au coeur d'une oasis d'eau et de verdure comprenant un hôtel Hilton 5 étoiles, le casino est doté de tous les attributs d'un centre de villégiature. column44: Vivez le rythme exaltant de la ville de Montréal. Découvrez des décors somptueux et de nombreux divertissements : plus de 100 tables de jeu, 2 900 machines à so...us ainsi qu'une toute nouvelle offre de restauration.  ______________  Installé dans l'édifice qui abritait le pavillon de la France pendant l'Exposition universelle de 1967, le Casino de Montréal a été inauguré le 9 octobre 1993. Il comptait alors 65 tables de jeu et 1 200 machines à sous. Le succès est immédiat, l'achalandage quotidien atteignant 12 000 visiteurs en moyenne.  Le Casino de Montréal est agrandi une première fois, en 1994, et une deuxième fois, en 1996, dans l'édifice qui abritait l'ancien Pavillon du Québec.  Des travaux de modernisation ont débuté à l'automne 2009. Cet investissement de 305,7 millions de dollars au cours des quatre prochaines années permettra au Casino de maintenir sa position parmi ses concurrents du Nord-Est américain.  Classé parmi les plus grands casinos au monde, le Casino de Montréal offre cinq étages de jeux plus excitants les uns que les autres et figure parmi les attraits incontournables de Montréal.  Le Casino de Montréal compte :      une centaine de tables de jeu dont 18 tables de poker Texas Hold'em avec croupier, plus de 3 000 machines à sous et 1 table de poker Texas Hold'em électronique;     quatre restaurants.  Depuis 1997, il est ouvert jour et nuit et reçoit en moyenne 17 800 visiteurs par jour, soit plus de 6,5 millions de visiteurs par année. ______________  Located in the former Expo'67 French Pavilion (Pavillon de la France), the Casino de Montréal was inaugurated on October 9, 1993. At the time, it housed 65 gaming tables and 1,200 slot machines. The casino was an instant success, with average daily visitor numbers reaching the 12,000 mark.  The casino was expanded for the first time in 1994 and again in 1996, when it took over the former Québec Pavilion.  Major renovations began in the fall of 2009. This investment of $305.7 million over the next four years will allow the Casino to maintain its ranking in the competitive North American market.  Among the world's largest casinos, the Casino de Montréal provides five floors of gaming, each more exciting than the last, and is one of the city's star attractions.  The Casino de Montréal features:  a hundred of gaming tables, including 18 Texas Hold'em poker tables, more than 3,000 slot machines and 1 electronic Texas Hold'em poker table four restaurants.  Since 1997, the casino is open day and night, and currently welcomes some 17,800 visitors a day. about: Up-and-coming singer/songwriter. Performs in the folk, blues, alternative and singer/songwriter music genres.  Follow Cassidy on Twitter @CassidyZahar, and Instagram: _cassidystarr Paypal: https://paypal.me/cassidyzahar?locale.x=en_US
artists we also like: The Beatles, Sarah Vaughan, Mumford and Sons, The Lumineers, Eva Cassidy, Janis Joplin, Nirvana, Guns 'N Roses, Bryan Adams, Ed Sheeran, Carolyn Dawn Johnson, Dixie Chicks, Jason Mraz, John Denver, Dolly Parton
personal interests: Music, reading, dancing, and the arts.
biography: Twenty-one year old singer songwriter, Cassidy Zahar, originally from Smoky Lake Alberta, continues to wow crowds everywhere with her strong, distinct and uniq...ue voice that appeals to fans of all ages. Although she is rooted in classic country and folk, Cassidy loves performing all genres including Americana, old time rock ’n roll, R&B, blues and jazz. Cassidy is now living in Edmonton and is currently enrolled at Macewan University. She is entering her final year of her Bachelor of Music in Jazz and Contemporary Popular Music with a major in Vocal Performance. Cassidy is honing her skills and continues to expand her horizons in the Western Canadian music industry.         Cassidy has achieved several major highlights in her career so far. She performs regularly with corporate house band, ‘The Million Dollar Dreamers’ at Halley’s Club in the Starlight Casino of West Edmonton Mall. She is also often found performing in various Edmonton venues such as Cafe Blackbird, Mill Creek Cafe, The Station and The Rec Room. Recently Cassidy was featured in an all-women’s showcase, ‘Drop The Mic: Girls Tour,’ in March 2018 with her folk and blues band ‘Cassidy and the Sundance.’ Together they also opened for country band Doc Walker at Knoxville’s Tavern in February 2018 and were again featured there in June 2018 for the 'Country Showdown'. Cassidy opened for country singer Brett Kissel during his “Hometown Homecoming Concert” in June 2016 in St. Paul, Alberta and country singer Tim Hus on her 18th birthday in March of 2016.  Other highlights include being a part of the “ATB Road to the Main-Stage” program from 2014-16 and placing in the top five each year. She also took part in the “Global Country” program from 2012-15 where she flew to Nashville TN in 2013 to represent Canada in the 'North American Country Music Awards International’ competition, bringing home three trophies for Canada. Additionally, Cassidy was presented with the “Dianne Branson Rising Star Award” from the Alberta Men and Women of Country Music in 2013.        Giving back to her community has always been an integral part of Cassidy’s music and life. She can often be found sharing her talents with the seniors of her community, performing in lodges and nursing homes for special occasions such as Christmas events and birthday parties. It is through her music that Cassidy hopes the seniors in our communities will know that they are valued and appreciated. In May of 2019, Cassidy travelled to Cambodia were she and several fellow university students volunteered by teaching music to the children in rural Siem Reap.   Songwriting is a relatively newfound love and passion for Cassidy. It is only within her last three years in university that she has truly blossomed as a songwriter. All of Cassidy’s songs are fuelled by an honest, heartfelt passion and a sense of insistent truth. She is a fan of simplicity and makes it a priority to use her songs to tell stories. Cassidy hopes others who listen to her music will feel a connection to the lyrics and find their own meaning within her carefully crafted words and thoughtful progressions.          When not performing or writing music, Cassidy loves dedicating her time to teaching her music students. Reading is another one of her favourite hobbies, as is gardening and taking in live music shows! See Moreue voice that appeals to fans of all ages. Although she is rooted in classic country and folk, Cassidy loves performing all genres including Americana, old time rock ’n roll, R&B, blues and jazz. Cassidy is now living in Edmonton and is currently enrolled at Macewan University. She is entering her final year of her Bachelor of Music in Jazz and Contemporary Popular Music with a major in Vocal Performance. Cassidy is honing her skills and continues to expand her horizons in the Western Canadian music industry.         Cassidy has achieved several major highlights in her career so far. She performs regularly with corporate house band, ‘The Million Dollar Dreamers’ at Halley’s Club in the Starlight Casino of West Edmonton Mall. She is also often found performing in various Edmonton venues such as Cafe Blackbird, Mill Creek Cafe, The Station and The Rec Room. Recently Cassidy was featured in an all-women’s showcase, ‘Drop The Mic: Girls Tour,’ in March 2018 with her folk and blues band ‘Cassidy and the Sundance.’ Together they also opened for country band Doc Walker at Knoxville’s Tavern in February 2018 and were again featured there in June 2018 for the 'Country Showdown'. Cassidy opened for country singer Brett Kissel during his “Hometown Homecoming Concert” in June 2016 in St. Paul, Alberta and country singer Tim Hus on her 18th birthday in March of 2016.  Other highlights include being a part of the “ATB Road to the Main-Stage” program from 2014-16 and placing in the top five each year. She also took part in the “Global Country” program from 2012-15 where she flew to Nashville TN in 2013 to represent Canada in the 'North American Country Music Awards International’ competition, bringing home three trophies for Canada. Additionally, Cassidy was presented with the “Dianne Branson Rising Star Award” from the Alberta Men and Women of Country Music in 2013.        Giving back to her community has always been an integral part of Cassidy’s music and life. She can often be found sharing her talents with the seniors of her community, performing in lodges and nursing homes for special occasions such as Christmas events and birthday parties. It is through her music that Cassidy hopes the seniors in our communities will know that they are valued and appreciated. In May of 2019, Cassidy travelled to Cambodia were she and several fellow university students volunteered by teaching music to the children in rural Siem Reap.   Songwriting is a relatively newfound love and passion for Cassidy. It is only within her last three years in university that she has truly blossomed as a songwriter. All of Cassidy’s songs are fuelled by an honest, heartfelt passion and a sense of insistent truth. She is a fan of simplicity and makes it a priority to use her songs to tell stories. Cassidy hopes others who listen to her music will feel a connection to the lyrics and find their own meaning within her carefully crafted words and thoughtful progressions.          When not performing or writing music, Cassidy loves dedicating her time to teaching her music students. Reading is another one of her favourite hobbies, as is gardening and taking in live music shows!

about: Cape Breton Regional Municipality - Official Facebook Page
column44: CBRM Social Media: Guidelines for Use  The Cape Breton Regional Municipality’s (CBRM) social media channels have been created to provide information to resident...s about CBRM operations, programs, services and initiatives. Please note that the Facebook and Twitter sites are not monitored 24-7.  While CBRM will endeavour to respond to inquiries and questions directed to our Social Media accounts, we may request that the discussion be redirected to either our phone or email support channels. The reason(s) for this request would include, but is not limited to, privacy concerns (yours, a fellow resident(s), or employee(s) of the municipality), character limitations for messages and amount of detail required to resolve a situation.  User comments and messages posted to CBRM official social networking sites are considered transitory records and will not be kept as a permanent record by CBRM. By using CBRM Social Media, users acknowledge and consent that their comments or messages may become part of the public record and used in official CBRM documentation. It is at CBRM’s sole discretion as to which comments will be saved to form part of the municipality’s official business records.  It is in the nature of Social Media communications that accuracy and timeliness may not be guaranteed and may not be reliable; as such, users acknowledge that CBRM makes no such guarantees. Further, CBRM is not responsible for the authenticity or suitability of content posted to its Social Media by others.  CBRM will adhere to all applicable legislation regarding privacy and freedom of information. CBRM is subject to the Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy (FOIPOP) provisions of the Municipal Government Act of Nova Scotia and users should be aware that personal and other information contained in electronic correspondence (or printed versions thereof) which are directed to CBRM are subject to this Act and may be deemed releasable under this legislation, and that the anonymity or confidentiality of the sender and any information contained within the correspondence cannot be presumed or relied upon.  The comments, opinions and other materials posted on CBRM's social media sites are the sole responsibility of the individual submitting the postings. CBRM does not endorse, nor is it responsible for, any of the postings, comments, opinions or other submissions ("User Submissions") on these sites and expressly disclaims any and all liability in connection with User Submissions.  Images and comments posted by third parties do not necessarily represent the views of CBRM. CBRM cannot and does not guarantee users privacy on third party social networking websites, as users are subject to the terms and conditions of the specific application on that website. Users should review and agree to the third party terms and conditions prior to participating.  CBRM will not be responsible for any losses or damages suffered as a result of using third party Social Media sites. Those using Social Media participate at their own risk and for their own benefit, and in so doing accept that they have no right of action against the CBRM related to such use.  A link between CBRM’s Social Media sites and any other website does not imply an endorsement or sponsorship by CBRM of that website, or the creator of that website.  CBRM’s Social Media sites are provided on an "as is" and "as available" basis. The CBRM makes no representations or warranties of any kind, express or implied, as to the sites' operation or the information, content or materials included on these sites.   CBRM strongly encourages users of its social media sites to respect their fellow users.  CBRM cannot tolerate comments that are offensive to an individual or an organization, rude in tone, or abusive. Comments, discussion posts, wall posts and any other user-posted content that is deemed inappropriate by CBRM, in its sole discretion, will be removed from the page. CBRM also reserves the right to monitor and remove, edit or refuse comments that meet any of the following conditions:  •	contrary to the principles of the Canadian Charter of Rights and Freedoms •	racist, hateful, sexist, homophobic, slanderous, insulting, or life-threatening messages •	serious, unproven or inaccurate accusations against individuals or organizations •	aggressive, coarse, violent, obscene, or pornographic comments •	messages where the sender is not the author •	messages for advertising purposes •	messages written in a language other than English or French •	unintelligible or irrelevant messages, and •	any other message that the forum moderators feel will not add to the normal flow of discussion.  Notification Of Changes  CBRM may modify this policy from time to time. If that happens, the latest version of this privacy statement will be posted. mission: Le Centre culturel et communautaire Henri-Lemieux est un carrefour important de découvertes et d'expériences culturelles contribuant à l'amélioration de la qualité de vie de sa communauté et de toutes les personnes qui l'adoptent.

column44: Fondé en 1986, le Centre culturel et communautaire Henri-Lemieux s’est rapidement taillé une place de choix au cœur de la vie culturelle du grand Montréal.   En... plus d’abriter le Théâtre du Grand Sault, petite salle intime accueillant la crème des musiciens d’ici et d’ailleurs, et la Galerie Les Trois C, qui met en valeur le travail d’artistes professionnels en art visuel, le Centre offre à la population un programme varié de cours et d’ateliers touchant la remise en forme et le bien-être, les arts appliqués et l'art de vivre, la danse, les langues et l'informatique. about: Place à la culture, à la créativité et aux découvertes, le CCFM offre une variété d’activités culturelles pour tous les âges!
column44: Depuis 1974, le Centre joue le rôle de diffuseur important pour toutes les formes d’activités culturelles et artistiques de langue française.  Reconnu comme mai...son de la culture et carrefour de la vie culturelle en français au Manitoba, il met en œuvre une programmation en arts de la scène et en arts visuels ainsi qu’une programmation communautaire et éducative pour tous les résidents du Manitoba et d’ailleurs.  Situé au cœur de Saint-Boniface, le quartier français de Winnipeg, le CCFM offre une programmation annuelle qui contribue activement à la vitalité culturelle de la communauté franco-manitobaine. Le CCFM est l’organisme qui offre, promeut et parraine à l’intention de l’ensemble de la population du Manitoba des activités culturelles et artistiques se déroulant en français. See Moreson de la culture et carrefour de la vie culturelle en français au Manitoba, il met en œuvre une programmation en arts de la scène et en arts visuels ainsi qu’une programmation communautaire et éducative pour tous les résidents du Manitoba et d’ailleurs. mission: L’organisme à but non lucratif CD Spectacles a pour mission de diffuser des spectacles grand public et de répondre aux besoins culturels de la population qu’il ...dessert. Par ailleurs, il doit susciter l’innovation, chercher de nouveaux publics et ainsi permettre l’accès à des œuvres plus « difficiles » mais tout aussi essentielles. Seul diffuseur de la MRC de La Côte-de-Gaspé à œuvrer sur une période de 12 mois, l’organisme travaille étroitement avec le tissu social local. Rappelons que, dans le cadre de ses présentes actions structurantes, CD Spectacles effectue un exercice énergique de resserrement des liens auprès de la communauté culturelle de Gaspé. company overview: CD Spectacles, avec son 40 ans d’histoire en diffusion de spectacles, permet à la population du Grand Gaspé de vivre des expériences culturelles et ce, dans une... multitude de disciplines telles que la chanson, la musique, la danse, l’humour ou le théâtre. L’organisme initie, entre autres, des partenariats avec le milieu scolaire, se rapprochant ainsi de la clientèle des jeunes, actuels et futurs spectateurs/acteurs de sa programmation. Précisons que CD Spectacles produit des activités telles Les Jeunesses Musicales du Canada, Les Matinées Scolaires Hydro-Québec, Les Cracks du divan avec La Maison des jeunes L’intermède, le projet La Cité en collaboration avec l’École secondaire C.-E.-Pouliot et ses enseignants et des projets avec le département d’Arts et Lettres du Cégep de la Gaspésie et des Îles du Campus de Gaspé. Ainsi, CD Spectacles offre aux jeunes de vivre une expérience culturelle forte et signifiante dans leurs parcours scolaires. CD Spectacles avec son équipe professionnelle joue le rôle à la fois de diffuseur mais aussi celui de locomotive culturelle pour la région. about: Cecilian Chamber Series presents World Stage chamber music concerts for Regina and area audiences.
column44: The goal of the new Cecilian Chamber Series is to present great musical performances for Regina and area audiences.  This series presents an eclectic mix of out...standing artists in a showcase designed to attract concert-goers of all ages.  The Cecilian Chamber Series is made possible through the support of Dennis Weist Piano, Saskatchewan’s Hailun Piano dealer.   Concerts are held at Knox-Metropolitan United Church,  2340 Victoria Avenue, the home of the 7’2” Hailun semi-concert grand piano. See Morestanding artists in a showcase designed to attract concert-goers of all ages.  The Cecilian Chamber Series is made possible through the support of Dennis Weist Piano, Saskatchewan’s Hailun Piano dealer.   Concerts are held at Knox-Metropolitan United Church,  2340 Victoria Avenue, the home of the 7’2” Hailun semi-concert grand piano.

about: Le Cégep de Victoriaville est un établissement d’enseignement supérieur bien ancré dans son milieu. Offrant notamment trois programmes préuniversitaires et sept programmes techniques.
general information: Le Cégep de Victoriaville offre les programmes suivants :  - Gestion et technologies d'entreprise agricole - Techniques de comptabilité et de gestion... - Technologie de l'électronique industrielle - Techniques de l'informatique - Techniques d'éducation spécialisée - Techniques du meuble et d'ébénisterie (ce programme est offert à Victoriaville et à Montréal) - Soins infirmiers - Sciences de la nature (profils Sciences pures et appliquées et Sciences de la santé) - Sciences humaines (profils Individu, Monde et société et Administration)  - Arts, lettres et communication (profils Cinéma et littérature et Langues et interculturel) See More - Technologie de l'électronique industrielle - Techniques de l'informatique - Techniques d'éducation spécialisée - Techniques du meuble et d'ébénisterie (ce programme est offert à Victoriaville et à Montréal) - Soins infirmiers - Sciences de la nature (profils Sciences pures et appliquées et Sciences de la santé) - Sciences humaines (profils Individu, Monde et société et Administration)  - Arts, lettres et communication (profils Cinéma et littérature et Langues et interculturel)

Address: 2300 Lonsdale Avenue North Vancouver, British Columbia
about: The largest multi-purpose performing arts venue on Vancouver's North Shore. With 658 seats, state-of-the-art sound, lighting & projection systems, professional in-house technical staff; and a versatile lobby space with a licensed concession.
general information: Officially opening its doors in 1966, Centennial Theatre was built to commemorate the centennial celebrations of Canada. Since that time, Centennial Theatre has... been home to many community and professional organizations including North Shore Light Opera, Uncle Randy Productions, Lions Gate Sinfonia, many local schools and dance schools.  Centennial Theatre is a 705 seat municipally managed theatre and is owned by the City of North Vancouver, and operated by the North Vancouver Recreation Commission under a Joint Use By-Law with operating funds from both the City and the District of North Vancouver.  Centennial Theatre is continuing to expand its presenting season, as well as remaining a supportive rental venue for many community organizations. We are visited by between 100,000 and 120,000 patrons and performers each year.  Generations of North Shore families have been performers and audience members at Centennial Theatre, and we look forward to generations more. See More been home to many community and professional organizations including North Shore Light Opera, Uncle Randy Productions, Lions Gate Sinfonia, many local schools and dance schools. We are visited by between 100,000 and 120,000 patrons and performers each year.  Generations of North Shore families have been performers and audience members at Centennial Theatre, and we look forward to generations more.
public transit: #229 from Lonsdale Quay or #232 from Phibbs Exchange.

company overview: The Centaur Theatre was founded in 1969 and we are currently celebrating our 50th season.

Page Types: Live Music Venue | Performance Art Theatre
about: Centennial Concert Hall is Winnipeg's premier performing arts centre.  #CentennialConcertHall  https://centennialconcerthall.com/
general information: GUEST SERVICES BARS AND CONCESSIONS Located throughout the lobby and Piano Nobile areas.  At most performances the following items may be purchased (cash only) ...liquor, wine, beer, liqueurs, soft drinks, coffee, tea, cappuccino, assorted juices, ice cream and other food.  An ATM machine is located in the front lobby.  PIANO NOBILE The Piano Nobile is located on the west wall of the Centennial Concert Hall on the mezzanine level.  This area hosts a variety of activities including; receptions, pre-show chats and monthly art exhibits by Manitoba artists.  COAT CHECK We offer a coat check service to our guests, it is located behind the mural when you first arrive through the front doors.  RESTROOMS For your convenience, restrooms are located on the Orchestra Level (main lobby), First Balcony, Second Balcony and on the Lower Concourse Level.  Orchestra Level restrooms are wheelchair accessible.  A family washroom is located on 1st Balcony.  USHERING STAFF Can’t find your seat? Have a question? Our ushering staff is available at all performances to help answer your questions and point you in the right direction.  INTERCOM PHONES Connect you directly with the Guest Services office if you have a concern or require assistance.  The phones are located on the balcony levels of the Centennial Concert Hall.  BOX OFFICE The Centennial Concert Hall Box Office is open one hour prior to all performances for “Will Call” ticket pickup.    HOUSE POLICIES To make your experience a positive one, we have established House Etiquette. Your courtesy and cooperation with the following items helps to ensure comfort and enjoyment for all of our guests.  DOOR OPENING Our front doors open one hour prior to curtain time. Theatre seating is generally available one half hour prior to show time, or at the discretion of the Manager of House Services.  LATECOMERS For minimum disruption, late arrivals will be held in the lobbies until an appropriate break in the program (as determined by the show’s management or producers). To allow late-comers the opportunity to follow the program, closed-circuit colour monitors are positioned for viewing on the two main Orchestra Levels and Piano Nobile.  IN CONSIDERATION FOR OTHERS… To allow both you and the people around you to enjoy the show, please avoid talking and unwrapping cellophane-wrapped candies during quiet (ballet, opera, symphony) performances.  If visitors applied perfume or cologne with a lighter hand when visiting the Centennial Concert Hall, our guests with allergies to perfumed fragrances would be very grateful.  CAMERAS & RECORDING DEVICES Cameras, video cameras and audio recording devices are not permitted inside the theatre.   Cameras may be permitted during some performances at the promoter’s discretion.  BABIES AND SMALL CHILDREN Regardless of age, every guest requires an admission ticket. To ensure maximum enjoyment for all, we recommend that children be of age to sit quietly throughout a performance.  Babes-in-arms may be permitted at family or children’s programs.  ELECTRONIC DEVICES Please be courteous and silence cellular phones and other electronic devices before the performance begins.  SMOKING The Centennial Concert Hall is a smoke-free facility.  FIRST AID SERVICES A certified first aid provider is present at all performances.  If you require medical assistance, please contact an usher. Page Types: Church | Addiction Resources Center | Performance & Event Venue
about: In the heart of the City, a church with the City in its heart
public transit: We are downtown, right on the C-Train line
column44: On the outside, Central United Church is a quiet and elegant building standing on the corner of 7th avenue and 1st street SW in downtown Calgary. Once you open ...the doors you find out that it is so much more: a library, a rec-centre, a hospital, a family, a sanctuary, a shelter, a kitchen, an incubator of imagination.  A place of transformation and a space for fostering innovative ideas and birthing new ministries—-the possibilities are endless.  Central serves as a beacon in our urban landscape: illuminating surroundings with the light of God, helping travelers navigate difficult journeys and casting the light of hope and love to those around it.  Central is a place for pilgrims.  With open hearts and hands we provide space for recovery, for restored dignity, for exploring life and experiencing authentic change.  Central is a community of faith: a place of prayer, of sharing, of teaching and of listening.  A church community that believes we are not fans of Jesus…but followers.  A spiritual community that values the gospel of peace and reconciliation, trusts in the scriptures of our faith and anticipates the leading of the Spirit with energy and involvement.Central is ultimately a community of love.  Love that forgives quickly, love that exhibits compassion, courageous love that seeks the will of God, love that provides each person space to grow in their understanding of God in authenticity and grace.  Central is a real place.  Real people figuring out how and if God is at work in their lives.  Central is an imperfect place where everyone is welcome and invited to find where God is present and join in.  Central is here for life See Morethe doors you find out that it is so much more: a library, a rec-centre, a hospital, a family, a sanctuary, a shelter, a kitchen, an incubator of imagination. about: 327 av. Dudley, North Bay ON,  705-472-5547 www.centrecompagnons.ca
mission: Le centre Les Compagnons est un médium de développement et d'intervention culturelle et communautaire; il permet l'enrichissement de la vie française au sein de la municipalité de North Bay et des environs.
column44: Le Centre Les Compagnons des francs loisirs oeuvre pour la communauté francophone de la région du Nipissing depuis presque 50 ans.   Devenez membre, participez,... impliquez-vous!   C'est un médium de développement et d'intervention culturelle et communautaire; il permet le soutien et l'enrichissement de la vie francophone au sein de la municipalité de North Bay et des environs.   Fondé en 1964 par quatre Franco-Ontariens désireux de préserver leur patrimoine canadien-français, le Centre culturel Les Compagnons des francs loisirs est un organisme à but non lucratif qui regroupe les francophones de North Bay et des environs. Centennial Hall is centrally located in the heart of downtown London, with shopping and hotel facilities within walking distance. The atmosphere is relaxed and ...friendly, and our qualified staff are dedicated to making your function and experience a success.  Offering over 14,000 square feet Centennial Hall is the perfect venue for your next event! With either the upper level staged auditorium or the lower level banquet hall Centennial Hall is one of the most versatile venues found in London. Our upper level features a large bar area and foyer, and seats up to 1637 theatre-style, 2200 for General Admission and up to 700 for meals. Our lower level seats up to 700 for meetings or up to 600 for meals. It also features a large bar area and has a separate entrance to ensure privacy during your event.  Centennial Hall is located in the hub of downtown London surrounded by tourist attractions, hotels and restaurants, making it the perfect location for your next event!     History  Centennial Hall opened its doors June 21, 1967. Donald Jones Management Services has run the building since 1986 and have brought acts such as Rush, Kiss, The Ramones, Tragically Hip, N’Sync, and Roger Whittaker (who sold out 5 shows in a row)!  12 Views of Blackfriars Bridge By Ted Goodden 1982-1983 Purchased for The City of London by The Ontario Heritage Foundation See Morefriendly, and our qualified staff are dedicated to making your function and experience a success. column44: Le centre culturel de Notre-Dame-de-Grâce est composé de la bibliothèque Benny, d'une salle d’exposition et de la salle de spectacle Iro-Valaskakis-Tembeck. D’u...ne capacité de 200 places, elle a été conçue spécialement pour des prestations de danse et offre une programmation multidisciplinaire qui plaira à un public de tout âge. Nos activités sont gratuites. Pour vous procurer des laissez-passer, il suffit de vous rendre au comptoir d'accueil durant les heures d'ouverture à compter de deux semaines avant la date de l'événement. Ces laissez-passer sont exigés à l'entrée et sont limités à deux par personne pour les spectacles en soirée et à quatre pour les événements familiaux. Vous pouvez aussi vous en procurer via le site accesculture.com (des frais de 2$ par laissez-passer s'appliquent dans ce cas). about: Située à Sainte-Marie (25 minutes des ponts de Québec), le Centre Caztel réuni quatre installations distinctes, soit un aréna comprenant deux glaces, un gymnase, une salle multi-fonctionnelle ainsi qu'un restaurant sportif.
column44: Inauguré en 2010, le Centre Caztel de Sainte-Marie est l’endroit idéal pour y tenir des événements de tous genres.    Ce centre multifonctionnel dispose de deux... glaces, un gymnase double et de différentes salles de rencontre. Notre salle de réception Alphonse-Desjardins peut y accueillir jusqu’à 560 personnes en formule banquet.   Une panoplie d’événements y sont présentés chaque année et peuvent y être organisés et ce, dans les différents lieux.   Assemblée générale, salon d’exposition, gala, compétition sportive, spectacle d'envergure, événement corporatif, réception, mariage, tournoi sportif de tout genre y sont organisé annuellement.  Serti au cœur d’une région magnifique, se distinguant pour ses équipements de fine pointe et ses salles multifonctionnelles, le Centre Caztel pourra certainement répondre à vos besoins. Nous serons fiers de mettre à profit notre expertise pour que votre événement soit couronné de succès!  Communiquez dès maintenant avec l'une de nos adjointes à la coordination des événements qui prendre en charge votre événement du début à la fin. about: C'est What is Toronto's original craft beer restaurant. True local flavour since 1988.
public transit: From Union Station: 5 minute walk or take the 121 bus east to Church Street and walk one block north. From King Station: 5 minute walk or take the 504 King streetcar east to Church Street and walk one block south.
column44: Toronto's best choice in craft beer and comfort food with 42 craft brews on tap, fine whiskies from the world over, and a select all Ontario VQA wine list.  C'e...st What is located in the cellar of a historic 19th century building in the St. Lawrence Market area. The Old Town charm appeals to Bohemians and Bay St. bankers alike while the casual and relaxed atmosphere includes two comfy fireplace areas. Other diversions include board games, pool tables, and a TV area.  C'est What is also the home of an Internet radio station, whatsnext.ca, which streams indie-centric recorded music and all shows from the adjoining performance space. about: Le CEPEO accueille tous les élèves à la recherche d'une éducation de haute qualité en langue française dans 43 écoles élémentaires et secondaires.
general information: Bienvenue sur la page du CEPEO. Ici, nous pouvons partager librement nos initiatives et nos réussites afin que vous puissiez savoir ce qui se passe de bon au Co...nseil et dans nos écoles pour ainsi reconnaître que l'éducation publique de langue française, c’est un passeport sans limites pour un monde meilleur! Restez branché!  Desservant plus de 15 200 élèves francophones dans 43 écoles élémentaires et secondaires, réparties dans l'Est ontarien, représentant un territoire d'une superficie de 40 319 km carrés, le CEPEO accueille tous les élèves à la recherche d'une éducation de haute qualité en langue française. En plus d'accompagner nos élèves sur la voie de la réussite scolaire, nous offrons à ces derniers des activités éducatives et culturelles, plus stimulantes les unes que les autres, qui viendront enrichir leur passage à l'école, renforcer leur sentiment d'appartenance tout en les préparant à devenir de jeunes citoyens empathiques, engagés et bilingues. See Morenseil et dans nos écoles pour ainsi reconnaître que l'éducation publique de langue française, c’est un passeport sans limites pour un monde meilleur! Restez branché! En plus d'accompagner nos élèves sur la voie de la réussite scolaire, nous offrons à ces derniers des activités éducatives et culturelles, plus stimulantes les unes que les autres, qui viendront enrichir leur passage à l'école, renforcer leur sentiment d'appartenance tout en les préparant à devenir de jeunes citoyens empathiques, engagés et bilingues.

about: Le Centre Vidéotron est une salle omnisports située dans l'arrondissement Cité-Limoilou à Québec.
column44: Le Centre Vidéotron, l’aboutissement d’un rêve collectif Le 10 septembre 2012 commençaient les travaux de construction de l'amphithéâtre multifonctionnel de Qué...bec, appelé Centre Vidéotron.  Bâtiment au design épuré, à la fine pointe de la technologie, il est propriété de la Ville de Québec et localisé sur le site d'ExpoCité.  Doté d’une capacité de 18 259 places assises et de 20 396 places en formule concert, sa construction a été complétée en juin 2015 au coût final de 370 M$, soit 30 M$ de moins que prévu au départ.  Une équipe chevronnée appuyée par des experts indépendants a su respecter rigoureusement les budgets et les échéanciers pour la réalisation de ces travaux.  Ville de Québec See Morebec, appelé Centre Vidéotron.  Bâtiment au design épuré, à la fine pointe de la technologie, il est propriété de la Ville de Québec et localisé sur le site d'ExpoCité. about: The Instrumental Society of Calgary strives to present chamber music in a way that honours the original core values of chamber music in a modern way, providing an environment that cultivates musical talent and shares it with the community.
public transit: Calgary Transit
biography: Since 1979, the Instrumental Society of Calgary has worked to showcase local musicians, both professionals in the On Stage concerts, and emerging artists in the... pre-concert performances. By creating an environment for musicians within the Calgary area, we continue to provide members of the public community with access to these performances. The Instrumental Society of Calgary focuses on attracting a diverse audience and presenting quality performances to help inspire future generations of chamber music enthusiasts.  The vision of the Instrumental Society of Calgary have been shaped by many directors in past years, including Janice Waite and Gianetta Baril. Since taking over as Artistic Director in 2014, Rolf Bertsch has worked tirelessly to create a programme of musical excellence and engaging concerts for music enthusiasts across the city. See More pre-concert performances. By creating an environment for musicians within the Calgary area, we continue to provide members of the public community with access to these performances. The Instrumental Society of Calgary focuses on attracting a diverse audience and presenting quality performances to help inspire future generations of chamber music enthusiasts.  The vision of the Instrumental Society of Calgary have been shaped by many directors in past years, including Janice Waite and Gianetta Baril. Since taking over as Artistic Director in 2014, Rolf Bertsch has worked tirelessly to create a programme of musical excellence and engaging concerts for music enthusiasts across the city.
column44: Since 1979, the Instrumental Society of Calgary has showcased the best local musicians in Calgary. Our concert selection process is unique and interactive withi...n the musical community. We work with professional musicians in the Calgary area to carefully create a theme and concert programme for the upcoming season.  In order to craft a collection of concert pieces from highly regarded musicians in the Calgary area, we work with these local performers, getting feedback and creating an experience for the audience that is unlike any other.  Operating for 37 years, the Instrumental Society of Calgary continues to create an environment that is supportive of the amazing talent within the Calgary area and provide music-lovers from all walks of life with access to chamber music performances.  Engaging the next generation of concert goers is essential in creating a life long appreciation of music. We also value the importance of emerging musicians who are starting out and strive to include pre-concert performances to showcase those local up-and-coming chamber musicians as well. We also value the importance of emerging musicians who are starting out and strive to include pre-concert performances to showcase those local up-and-coming chamber musicians as well.

about: The Charlotte Street Arts Centre is a community-based facility for the arts, owned and operated by Fredericton Arts & Learning, Inc.
general information: In addition to operating the centre, Charlotte Street Arts Centre hires professional artists to lead skills-building workshops in a variety of arts disciplines,... in our ArtReach program. Since 2004, ArtReach has reached socially and economically disadvantaged children, youth at risk, families, seniors, ethnic minority groups, abused women, homeless men, mental health patients and those rehabilitating after incarceration. These are individuals who would not normally have access to arts education.  All ArtReach programs are offered free of charge to client groups. The FAL artist pool includes over fifty of Fredericton’s professional and emerging artists, who are fairly remunerated for their time. For more information on ArtReach, contact our Program Coordinator, Eva George at artreach@charlottestreetarts.ca See More in our ArtReach program. mission: The Charlotte Street Arts Centre is a focal point for creation, presentation and education in the arts. Fredericton Arts & Learning opens the doors of creative expression to all.
company overview: Charlotte Street Arts Centre (legal name: Fredericton Arts & Learning, Inc) was founded and incorporated in 2001 and became a registered charity in 2002. The pu...rpose for the establishment of the organization was to work to meet the community’s need for an arts centre and for more arts programming. FAL officially took ownership of the Charlotte Street School in 2004, renaming it the Charlotte Street Arts Centre. products: Facility rentals, exhibitions, permanent installations, arts education programming, artists-in-residence, external programming, scholarship and more.
column44: The Charlotte Street Arts Centre (CSAC) is an important space for arts and culture activities in downtown Fredericton. The Centre is located in the old Charlott...e Street School, an historical building dating back to 1884. CSAC provides spaces to artists and organizations in all disciplines, including visual, performing, musical, and literary as well as to a variety of cultural groups. The building features the Charlotte Glencross Gallery, a fully technically-equipped auditorium upstairs (available for rental for events), artist studios and a basement cafe & restaurant.  *At this current time our Arts Centre is under major construction making the building accessible to all! Creating this space the focal of the Arts and Culture.* Donation Page:https://give.charlottestreetarts.ca   twitter: @csartscentre instagram: @charlottestreetarts info@charlottestreetarts.ca  Office Hours: 9:30 AM - 1:30 PM See Moree Street School, an historical building dating back to 1884. about: A fun Gastropub  near Kits beach, Open for Lunch & Dinner daily Happy Hour & drink specials. Weekly live music and comedy on Wednesday,Karaoke on Friday Saturday and Sunday.
column44: Char·qui [chahr-kee] is the Spanish pronunciation of an indigenous Quecha word for cured meat and it is from where we get our word jerky. The use of charqui spr...ead throughout Latin America and the Caribbean and spawned a multitude of local dishes. In the Caribbean the sauces used for charqui were adapted for cooking on an open grill by adding pimento berries, also known as all spice. In our restaurant we have refined this sauce to use on our grilled food. We welcome you to enjoy the flavors of the fire and spices.  On Stage - Our Daily Music  Selection  Monday - Mingle Mondays. Tuesda - Chill Tuesday with Jacqueline Dawn. Wednesday - WOW (Ladies Night) 1/2 Price Bottles of Wine & 2 for 1 Appies. Thursday - Open Mic hosted by Caroline Allatt. Friday & Saturday - Artist showcase - call us or follow us on Facebook for further information. Sunday - Karaoke night. column44: FR (english just below): Le Lundi "Chick Pickin'" a été crée il y a presque 10 ans par Cecile Doo Kingue et le barman Gern F. avec l'idée de présenter le talent... des femmes venant de Montréal, Canada et d'un peu partout. La soirée a rencontré un grand succès; la programmation est souvent fixée quelque mois à l'avance, et en général le publique est nombreux et décontracté. La soirée est une vraie célébration du talent de Montréal et d'ailleurs. Les numéros présentés peuvent aller de la performance solo à des représentations de groupes, tous centrés sur la voix féminine, et l'atmosphère intime génère des performances qui sont uniques et sincère.  Votre hôstesse est Aly Marguerite et son groupe Old Time Honey. Dans les rues jusqu'au cirque, le style musical d'Aly est romantique et remplis des sons folk d'une temps oubliés, une mélange qui créer un son original qui est lourd de nostalgie.   ENG: Chick Pickin' Mondays was created almost 10years ago by Cecile Doo Kingue and Grumpy's barman Gern f. with the idea of show casing female talent from Montreal, Canada and parts far flung. The night has become a huge success the roster often being booked months in advance, the crowds are generally large and laid back. The evening is a true celebration of Montreal's musical talent as well as the rest of the worlds. Acts range from solo musicians to groups all with the Female voice as it's center, the intimate atmosphere generating performances that are unique and heart felt. Page Types: Public Service | Youth Organization | Charity Organization
about: Building skills, changing lives.  Christie Lake Kids offers recreational and skill development programs at no cost to economically disadvantaged children
general information: Instragram: ChristieLakeKids Twitter: ChristieLakeKids
mission: “Economically disadvantaged children compared to their middle-class Peers are far less likely to have the opportunity to participate In organized (coached) spor...ts or receive instruction in the arts. One is hard-pressed to think of any other domain in Canadian children’s lives where participation is so class-linked: middle class children have the opportunities for participation, poor children do not.  Lack of participation and accomplishment in these skill areas not only lowers life quality during childhood but decreases life chances in adulthood.”  Late Dr. Dan Offord, Executive Director of the Offord Centre for Child Studies and Christie Lake Camp Director for 47 years.  There is an epidemic of social exclusion in Ontario.  Too many young people have limited opportunities to achieve their full potential.  Economically disadvantaged children and youth face unprecedented barriers to participation in skill-building programs in recreation, camping, sports and the arts.  These barriers are being erected by many factors: chronic poverty, rising user fees, and lack of investment and cutbacks in arts and recreation resources to name a few.  Access to skill-building programs are a fundamental need for young people; essential to social, emotional and physical well being.  Numerous studies support this belief, showing that children and youth with access to programs like those offered by Christie Lake Kids have better school attendance, get better grades, reduced rates of anti-social behaviour and have improved social and interpersonal abilities. See Morets or receive instruction in the arts. One is hard-pressed to think of any other domain in Canadian children’s lives where participation is so class-linked: middle class children have the opportunities for participation, poor children do not. about: Great food, great music and friendly staff. Open for breakfast! (licensed)
public transit: Use the Blues Bus to get to and from events! Call us for details 604 826 4762
impressum: The Historic Dewdney Pub - Church of the Blues 8793 River Rd S, Dewdney, BC, Canada  V0M 1H0 (604) 826-4762
column44: The Historic Dewdney Pub is located along the banks of the Dewdney slough in the rural Dewdney/Deroche area of the Fraser Valley just off scenic Hwy. 7. The bui...lding started as a church in 1912; survived the 1948 Flood; became a residence much later; and was finally transformed into a pub.  A recent and ongoing renovation has kept the historic value of the building with vintage light fixtures and photos, fir wainscotting,   stained glass and memorabilia respectful of the fishing, logging and farming of the surrounding area. We feature live blues music every second Saturday night from 8:30pm untill 12:30pm and a Blues Jam every Sunday from 3:00pm until 7:00pm (sometimes later if the place is hoppin’).  Given the building’s heritage and our music, it has become known as the ‘church of the blues’. Join us for our regular ‘services’. We have real food, a great choice of refreshments, an ice cold beer/wine and liquor store, a friendly staff and………………..  we are rider friendly. column44: Located in beautiful Mission, British Columbia, Canada, The Clarke Foundation Theatre opened in 1996 with a gala celebration, a culmination of years of hard wor...k and fund raising.  Since that time it has been the cultural hub of the community of Mission with hundreds of presentations highlighting the enormous wealth of local as well as Canadian and international talent. The Clarke Theatre is owned and operated by Mission Public Schools and is a multi-purpose facility for civic and touring events.  The Clarke offers professional technical staff, competitive rates and an extremely dedicated group of volunteer ushers which makes for an excellent experience for any performing events. The Clarke also caters to meetings, award ceremonies, workshops and technical training. See Morek and fund raising. column44: Providing comfort food with a twist, Clay West offers traditional favorites made with a little extra inspiration. If you've been hungry in Bayer's Lake lately, ...you know it's easy to find a big box restaurant or fast food location. If you're craving something unique and different to satisfy your hunger it can be a challenge. Our mission here at Clay West Bar & Grill is to fill that gap in the market and the hunger in your belly.. .with delicious comfort food made from scratch by our talented chefs and served to you by the friendliest servers around. Locally owned and operated, Clay West Bar & Grill supports the buy local movement by stocking the kitchen with locally grown and produced ingredients whenever possible. We've got ten beers on tap, a different burger for every taste, some of the best chicken wings around, daily specials to keep it fresh, and delicious house made desserts to top it all off. about: Pub in the front, party in the back!
public transit: TTC: Christie Station
column44: The hallowed doors to Clinton's Tavern opened on a fateful snow-free November of 1937 as freshly minted George VI nickles, dimes and quarters were filling the p...ockets of the bar keeps. The main floor was your typical watering hole, but the upstairs help an exclusive "members only" club; a known favorite of Old Blue Eyes - yes, Frank Sinatra.  Always one step of the herd, Clintons opened up the bar to women in 1955. Imagine that, men would finally enjoy their brew with a classy dame by their side.  By 1985, the back was opened for live shows. A young Jeff Healy lived out a rock star hopeful's dream as Bob Dyan caught his show and took a shine to him. Their meeting at Clinton's sparked a long-term friendship with ultimately helped propel Healy's career to the next level.  The concert space has since become well known as a launch pad for a wide range of Canadian acts including Drake, Barenaked Ladies, Die Mannequin, Three Days Grace, Cowboy Junkies, The Cliks, Crystal castles and many more abroad and alike. And aside from the constant live music shows, weekly dj nights and special events, there's always something happening at 693 Bloor St. W.  Clintons has been delivering the best live music, trivia and poetry nights, weekly dance parties, drinks and home cookin' to Toronto for 74 years and isn't slowing down! We are a hidden gem tucked in the heart of the Christie Pitts so join us for beers with buds on our patio or front pub or dance the night away on one of the craziest dance floors in the city! about: A snug tavern serving inventive cocktails, street-style bites and unique draught beer with a rare ambience.
column44: Named for John Clough, 19th century Gastown's booze-addled lamplighter and jailer, the Clough Club melds classic style with tasteful modernity. Designer Craig S...tanghetta (Bao Bei, Meat and Bread) used as much of the 110-year old building's bones as possible, commissioning installations and creating decor that offset the old-fashioned feel of the original space.   The Clough Club’s craft cocktail list is dark-spirit forward, constructed by noted barmen Trevor Kallies and Joey Donnelly and served up by some of Vancouver’s finest cocktailers. Carefully selected beer and BC and local wines round out the menu, while the food is authentic tasty street fare drawing influence from around the globe. See Moretanghetta (Bao Bei, Meat and Bread) used as much of the 110-year old building's bones as possible, commissioning installations and creating decor that offset the old-fashioned feel of the original space.
