about: Club Soda × Spectacle | Session d'écoute | Lancement | Pop-up | Événement privé | Cocktail ||Véritable institution montréalaise toujours indépendante.
column44: Web : www.clubsoda.ca Twitter : www.twitter.com/ClubSodaMTL ... Présent depuis près de 35 ans au cœur de la vie culturelle et artistique montréalaise, le Club Soda, véritable institution montréalaise, est l’une des salles de spectacles les plus reconnues de la métropole, tant par la qualité de ses prestations que par la diversité de sa programmation.   Initialement ouvert en 1983 sur l’avenue du Parc, le Club Soda devient rapidement l’un des bastions du show-business, notamment grâce au fameux Lundis Ha! Ha! présentés par Ding et Dong.  En 1985, les producteurs Michel Sabourin et Rubin Fogel, accompagnés de Martin Després, reprennent les rennes du Club Soda et la salle devient rapidement un véritable creuset de l’industrie moderne du spectacle. De Ding et Dong à Daniel Lemire, de Rock et Belles Oreilles à Michel Courtemanche, de Marjo à Richard Séguin, de Daniel Bélanger à France D’Amour, de Térez Montcalm à Lhassa de Sela, de Robert Charlebois à Michel Pagliaro, rares sont les grands artistes d’aujourd’hui qui n’ont pas connu leurs premiers succès au Club Soda.   En 1999, l’institution de l’avenue du Parc ferme ses portes avant de refaire peau neuve à l’aube de l’an 2000 en plein cœur du centre-ville, sur le boulevard Saint-Laurent.   Pionnier au cœur du Quartier des Spectacles, le Club Soda est en mesure de réaliser sa mission dont il s’est investi il y a 30 ans : celle de permettre à de jeunes artistes et à de jeunes producteurs de tous genres artistiques de trouver au Club Soda une infrastructure abordable et de qualité qui leur permettra de se faire connaître du public montréalais. Lisa Leblanc, Coeur de Pirate, Karim Ouellet, Koriass, Yann Perreau, Radio Radio, Peter Peter, Kid Koala, Foxtrott, Socalled, pour n'en nommer que quelques-un(e)s, nous ont tous fait l'honneur de jouer sur la scène du Club Soda.  C'est aussi au Club Soda que se sont produits pour la première fois à Montréal, la plupart des grands artistes canadiens qui font aujourd'hui leur marque sur la scène internationale : James Blake, Frank Ocean, The Tragically Hip, Barenaked Ladies, Blue Rodeo, Amanda Marshall, Jann Arden, Holly Cole, David Usher et plusieurs autres. Également, plusieurs grands noms de la scène internationale y ont fait des présences remarquées : Oasis, PJ Harvey, Fine Young Cannibals, Ben Harper, Amy Winehouse, Rufus Wainwright, Counting Crows, Melissa Etheridge, Soundgarden, Chris Isaak, pour n'en nommer que quelques-uns.  Depuis son ouverture en 1982, le Club Soda a reçu quelque 10 500 représentations et plus de 4,7 million de spectateurs. Chaque année, en moyenne 250 représentations de différentes disciplines y sont données ce qui fait du Club Soda l'une des salles les plus occupées du Quartier des spectacles.  Grâce à une politique de programmation audacieuse orientée sur la nouveauté et l'originalité, le Club Soda a permis aux Montréalais de découvrir des milliers d'artistes québécois, canadiens ou étrangers. column44: Le Unity est situé en plein coeur du Village gai de Montréal. Avec ses 2 salles, son salon VIP et sa grande terrasse sur le toit, le Unity est reconnu pour être... un endroit où l'on s'amuse dans une ambiance conviviale, festive et respectueuse. Le Unity est un endroit qui plaît à une clientèle variée et diversifiée qui aime faire la fête dans une atmosphère détendue et sans prétention. Soucieuse de la qualité des événements qu'elle vous offre, l'équipe du Unity vous propose des soirées à la hauteur de sa réputation. Sur ses 3 étages, le Unity vous offre 2 styles de musique différents chaque soir, des spectacles, de l’animation, des drags, du beau monde et bien plus encore.  //////////////////////////////////////////////////////  Unity is located in the heart of the gay village of Montreal. With 2 rooms, a VIP lounge and large terrace on the roof, Unity is recognized to be a place where we have fun in a friendly, festive and respectful environment.  Unity is a place that appeals to a varied and diverse clientele that likes to party in a relaxed and unpretentious club. Concerned about the quality of its events, the Unity team offers parties that live up to its reputation. On its 3 floors, Unity offers 2 different styles of music every night, entertainment, animation, and drags, a gorgeous crowd and much more. about: The Cobourg Highland Games is held at Victoria Park by the Cobourg Highland Games Society. This event takes place on the 20th of June 2020 and will mark the 57th annual games.
mission: The mandate of the Cobourg Highland Games Society is to promote, encourage and support the cultivation and preservation of Scots culture through related community events and to ensure that neither borders, nor seas, nor time itself denies us of our proud Highland Heritage.
products: Scottish & Celtic food, merchandise and great music and dancing

biography: Coldsnap is an annual winter music festival, beating the late-January/early-February blues away by bringing you rock, folk, hip-hop, country and, well, blues.
column44: Coldsnap is a volunteer-run, passion-driven winter music festival that promises to pull you out of deep freeze. What better way to beat the winter blues than wi...th the real live blues, as well as the best indie, emerging and established country, hip hop, folk and rock performers storming the stages and streets of PG. Coldsnap is an annual celebration of great tunes and live performances; it raises the cultural bar and packs local venues downtown all under the foot stomping cry of ‘music comes first!’ See Moreth the real live blues, as well as the best indie, emerging and established country, hip hop, folk and rock performers storming the stages and streets of PG. Act Name: The College of Piping and Celtic Performing Arts of Canada
Page Types: Nonprofit Organization | Performance Art Theatre | Dance Studio
Address: 619 Water Street East Summerside, Prince Edward Island
about: We offer year-round instruction in : Highland Bagpiping, Scottish-style Snare Drumming, Fiddling, Highland Dancing, Step Dancing Hip Hop, Ballet, Jazz, Acro as well as Acting, Art Musical Theatre and Improv.
mission: Inspiring excellence in Celtic performing arts through quality educational programming.
company overview: Celtic culture comes alive at The College of Piping & Celtic Performing Arts of Canada! Based in Summerside, Prince Edward Island, and affiliated with The Colle...ge of Piping in Glasgow, The College has developed a world-class reputation as an international school of excellence in Highland bagpiping, Scottish-style drumming, Highland dancing and Island step dancing. With a mandate to preserve and promote the Celtic heritage of Canada’s most Celtic province, Prince Edward Island, The College ignites passion in the hearts and minds of students and visitors alike!  Since its inception in 1990, students from all over the world have come to learn traditional Celtic arts, passed down from generation to generation. As the only year-round institution of its kind in North America, The College attracts students from across Canada and as far away as New Zealand, Australia, Kuwait, Japan, Singapore, Germany, the United States of America and, yes, even Scotland! Under the direction of College faculty, individuals and pipe bands have been consistent winners in local, national and international competitions. Instructors at The College have all been selected for their outstanding abilities as both educators and performers.  100% Authentic, Heartfelt Celtic! about: An Edmonton based non-profit dedicated to the advocacy and promotion of emerging artists.
mission: We create opportunities for artists of all disciplines, and bring distinct audience experiences to the Edmonton community.
company overview: Founded in 2009, Common Ground Arts Society is a non-profit arts organization focused on providing opportunities for Edmonton artists. Our annual flagship event... is the Found Festival, a four day interdisciplinary arts festival presenting site-specific new works throughout Edmonton's historic Old Strathcona neighbourhood. This exciting festival offers performances in non-traditional spaces – theatre in an alley, dance among park trees, a rock show in a swimming pool.   We produce events to represent talent from a wide variety of genres, including dance, theatre, music, film, creative writing, visual arts and more.  Learn more about what we are up to at our website www.commongroundarts.ca See More is the Found Festival, a four day interdisciplinary arts festival presenting site-specific new works throughout Edmonton's historic Old Strathcona neighbourhood. This exciting festival offers performances in non-traditional spaces – theatre in an alley, dance among park trees, a rock show in a swimming pool.   We produce events to represent talent from a wide variety of genres, including dance, theatre, music, film, creative writing, visual arts and more.  Learn more about what we are up to at our website www.commongroundarts.ca
products: Found Festival  FoundRaiser
column44: Our VISION:  To empower and inspire emerging Edmonton artists.  ... Our CORE VALUES:  •	CREATIVITY: To promote originality in the content and presentation of work  •	COLLABORATION: To work efficiently amongst ourselves, with artists, and with  the Edmonton community   •	SUSTAINABILITY:  To develop the society fiscally and organizationally and to host environmentally conscious events    •	PROFESSIONALISM: To have high standards of working conduct for both our management team as well as our collaborators                                                           Re-accuring Events  FOUND FESTIVAL  “The newest arts festival in town will take you on an exploratory tour through the nooks and crannies of Edmonton’s [Old Strathcona] – with a tailor-made show at every stop. ... In Found, you’ll find yourself in locations you’d never expect: a garage, an alley, a bar patio, a memorial chapel... following dancers from one to the next.” 	- Liz Nichols, Edmonton Journal  LEARN ABOUT UPCOMING FOUND FESTIVAL at www.commongroundarts.ca/foundfestival .    Follow us @CommonGroundArt  Download our FREE 2014 Festival App for your Smart Phone. Search "Found Festival" and Enjoy!   The Found Festival is a site-specific smorgasbord exhibiting explosive, and dynamic new works in a variety of unconventional spaces. In 2012, we featured over 40 artists, and brought in audiences from all over the city to experience the first-ever-event of its kind in Edmonton.     June 29- July 1, 2012 - The Inaugural Found Festival! 8 Performances over 3 days. The first festival of its kind in Edmonton!    FoundRaiser  2012 - At Wunderbar we hosted the Foundraiser. A musical mashup of great local talent curated by Craig Martel  2013 - at Avenue Theatre we hosted the Edmonton Show ReFound. Over 50 artists from all genres in Edmonton graced the Avenue stage for a one night extravaganza.  2014 - We transformed the Pique Dance Centre into a Visual Art Gallery and showcased previews of 2014 Found Festival projects.                                                        Past Events    1. THE EDMONTON SHOW  A multidisciplinary cabaret style show at Avenue Theatre.    2. SPILL!  A free day of art making at Avenue Theatre, featuring a new art gallery open to the public.  3. PLAYGROUNDS  New works written and performed by high school students                                                                     NEWS  September 3, 2014 - Annual General Meeting - Newly elected Board of Directors expanded to 8(largest number yet!) and co-founder of Common Ground, Patrick Lundeen is the newly elected Executive Director for 2014/2015 season.  June 26 - 29 - Found Festival 2014 takes over Old Strathcona. Largest audience turn out yet!   May 2 - The FoundRaiser is back at the Pique Dance Centre  3rd Annual Found Festival - Scheduled for June 26-29. Taking place at various locations in Old Strathcona.   June 27-30 - Found Festival 2013 in the Old Strathcona district ( various locations). Show information and schedule available on website (www.commongroundarts.ca)  April 11, 2013 - The Edmonton Show ReFOUND - Avenue Theatre at 7pm. A multi-disciplinary emerging artist celebration and fundraiser for the 2013 Found Festival.  February, 2013 - Hosted a site-specific creation workshop led by Mark Hopkins and Charles Netto, co-artistic directors of Swallow-A-Bicycle Theatre from Calgary. The workshop was made possible by Theatre Alberta and the Alberta Foundation for the Arts.  Nov 4, 2012: Call for Submissions for Found Festival 2013!  June 29-July 1, 2012: The inaugural Found Festival took place in the Old Strathcona District.  Featuring 40+ artists in 9 different venues.  Sunday May 6, 2012:Wunderbar celebrated their 2nd birthday and had the proceeds go towards CGAS's Found Festival.  The beginning of a beautiful partnership.  Keep your eyes peeled for more Wunderbar "foundling" events to come.  Under 2 months to Found Festival.  Friday, March 9, 2012: After undergoing a major personnel shift, in terms of our management team as well as many of our Board Members, we are hard at work to lay the groundwork for our next SUPERSECRET major event, happening June 29-July 1, 2012. See More Our CORE VALUES:  •	CREATIVITY: To promote originality in the content and presentation of work  •	COLLABORATION: To work efficiently amongst ourselves, with artists, and with  the Edmonton community   •	SUSTAINABILITY:  To develop the society fiscally and organizationally and to host environmentally conscious events    •	PROFESSIONALISM: To have high standards of working conduct for both our management team as well as our collaborators                                                           Re-accuring Events  FOUND FESTIVAL  “The newest arts festival in town will take you on an exploratory tour through the nooks and crannies of Edmonton’s [Old Strathcona] – with a tailor-made show at every stop. ... In Found, you’ll find yourself in locations you’d never expect: a garage, an alley, a bar patio, a memorial chapel... following dancers from one to the next.” 	- Liz Nichols, Edmonton Journal  LEARN ABOUT UPCOMING FOUND FESTIVAL at www.commongroundarts.ca/foundfestival .    Follow us @CommonGroundArt  Download our FREE 2014 Festival App for your Smart Phone. Search "Found Festival" and Enjoy!   The Found Festival is a site-specific smorgasbord exhibiting explosive, and dynamic new works in a variety of unconventional spaces. In 2012, we featured over 40 artists, and brought in audiences from all over the city to experience the first-ever-event of its kind in Edmonton.     June 29- July 1, 2012 - The Inaugural Found Festival! 8 Performances over 3 days. The first festival of its kind in Edmonton!    FoundRaiser  2012 - At Wunderbar we hosted the Foundraiser. A musical mashup of great local talent curated by Craig Martel  2013 - at Avenue Theatre we hosted the Edmonton Show ReFound. Over 50 artists from all genres in Edmonton graced the Avenue stage for a one night extravaganza.  2014 - We transformed the Pique Dance Centre into a Visual Art Gallery and showcased previews of 2014 Found Festival projects.                                                        Past Events    1. THE EDMONTON SHOW  A multidisciplinary cabaret style show at Avenue Theatre.    2. SPILL!  A free day of art making at Avenue Theatre, featuring a new art gallery open to the public.  3. PLAYGROUNDS  New works written and performed by high school students                                                                     NEWS  September 3, 2014 - Annual General Meeting - Newly elected Board of Directors expanded to 8(largest number yet!) and co-founder of Common Ground, Patrick Lundeen is the newly elected Executive Director for 2014/2015 season.  June 26 - 29 - Found Festival 2014 takes over Old Strathcona. Largest audience turn out yet!   May 2 - The FoundRaiser is back at the Pique Dance Centre  3rd Annual Found Festival - Scheduled for June 26-29. Taking place at various locations in Old Strathcona.   June 27-30 - Found Festival 2013 in the Old Strathcona district ( various locations). Show information and schedule available on website (www.commongroundarts.ca)  April 11, 2013 - The Edmonton Show ReFOUND - Avenue Theatre at 7pm. A multi-disciplinary emerging artist celebration and fundraiser for the 2013 Found Festival.  February, 2013 - Hosted a site-specific creation workshop led by Mark Hopkins and Charles Netto, co-artistic directors of Swallow-A-Bicycle Theatre from Calgary. The workshop was made possible by Theatre Alberta and the Alberta Foundation for the Arts.  Nov 4, 2012: Call for Submissions for Found Festival 2013!  June 29-July 1, 2012: The inaugural Found Festival took place in the Old Strathcona District.  Featuring 40+ artists in 9 different venues.  Sunday May 6, 2012:Wunderbar celebrated their 2nd birthday and had the proceeds go towards CGAS's Found Festival.  The beginning of a beautiful partnership.  Keep your eyes peeled for more Wunderbar "foundling" events to come.  Under 2 months to Found Festival.  Friday, March 9, 2012: After undergoing a major personnel shift, in terms of our management team as well as many of our Board Members, we are hard at work to lay the groundwork for our next SUPERSECRET major event, happening June 29-July 1, 2012.

Concert Series held at the Merritt Park Amphitheater presented by Welland Downtown BIA, North End Welland BIA and the City of Welland. Concerts are as follows: ... The concerts begin at 7pm on the dates listed!! The opening act plays from approximately 7pm to 7:45, the main acts will take the stage at 8pm and play for approximately 90 minutes. The concerts are free admission. Food vendors will be on site beginning at 4pm. A licensed beer/wine area is on site with drink ticket sales beginning at 6pm!  Wednesday, June 26th - Opening Act: Unified Planet, followed by Full Moon Fever (Tom Petty Tribute)  Monday, July 1st (Canada Day) - Canada Day is an all day affair! Beginning at 2PM there will be free access to various water activities, face painting, a rock climbing wall, and more! There are three bands scheduled to rock the Merrit Park Ampitheatre, beginning with Winter of 69 at 5:30pm. At 6:30pm The Associates take the stage, and then the Caverners (Beatle’s tribute) bring it home from 8-930pm!  Friday, July 5th - Opening act: Big School at 7pm, followed by Welland born and raised Revive the Rose!  Saturday, July 6th - This one is special! Our only Saturday concert of the year is one for the kids! The Ben Show takes the stage at approximately 2pm. Dan the Music Man is the main act. Bring your kids down for a fun afternoon! All of our usual food vendors will be on site, with the addition of Niagara Face Painting and the Welland Library!  Friday, July 26th - Cory Cruise takes the stage at 7pm, followed by Epic Eagles (Eagles tribute) at approximately 8pm!  Friday, August 9th - Chelsea Crites takes the stage at 7pm, followed by Chicken Fried (Zac Brown Band tribute) at approximately 8pm!  Friday, August 16th - Katey Gatta takes the stage at 7pm, followed by Material Girls at approximately 8pm!  Friday, August 23rd - FRANCOPHONE NIGHT!! The French community is a huge part of Welland and we wanted to make sure we showed you some love!! The Jean Vanier Band takes the stage at 7pm, followed by Les Rats d’Swompe at 8pm!!  Friday, August 30th - THIS ONE WILL BE HUGE!! To wrap up on 2019 concerts on the Canal Series, Cameron Lee takes the stage at 7pm followed by the ALWAYS ENTERTAINING Pink Floyd Niagara! about: Au service de la communauté acadienne, francophone et francophile de Halifax depuis 1991 !  French community center since 1991
mission: Le Conseil communautaire du Grand-Havre a pour mission de promouvoir le développement global de la communauté francophone de la municipalité régionale de Halifax.
column44: Le Conseil communautaire du Grand-Havre œuvre dans la région métropolitaine de Halifax depuis 1991. En plus d’agir comme porte-parole de la communauté francopho...ne de la municipalité régionale de Halifax, d’établir des partenariats, de diffuser de l’information, le Conseil développe année après année, des programmes et des services à la communauté francophone.  The CCGH works towards the overall development of the Francophones and the Francophile community of the Halifax Regional Municipality since 1991. In addition of acting as a representative of the francophone community of the Halifax Regional Municipality, to build partnerships and share information, the CCGH develops year after year, programs and services for the Francophone and Francophile community. about: Saskatoon's premier medium sized concert and special event venue.
column44: The Coors Event Centre is a premier medium sized event centre, comprised of two attached landmark buildings rich with Saskatoon history, totalling 20,000 sq ft.... We are located in South Downtown within walking distance of many hotels, a shopping mall, artisan shops, an auto parkade, the spectacular river landing, and the Meewasin trail.  The O'Brians Event Centre, formerly The Odeon, has been under new management and ownership since late 2011. The new owners are dedicated to vastly improving the guest experience of the events centre. Big changes are already underway, including a new sound system, improved layount and design, and much more to come with over half of a million dollars in renovations already in progress.  The venue can hold up to 1000 people for any given event.  The projected concert/show bookings look to exceed one hundred shows per year. Our event centre is dedicated to bringing in big names like Snoop Dogg, Nelly Furtado, Nitty Gritty Dirt Band, Black Label Society, Corb Lund, Xavier Rudd, Mother Mother, MGMT, Fun, with many more big names to come! column44: CORSICA STUDIOS is an independent arts organisation that sets up and develops creative spaces in areas of London.  Over the last six years we have become a much...-loved and respected club, live music and arts destination for discerning clubbers and music lovers. We are home to many of the capital’s finest events, parties and club nights and constantly represent the best in left-field and underground music and talent.  Our reputation has been built by establishing creative platforms for the arts in areas of regeneration deliberately utilising buildings that were standing empty and unused and placing a wide range of media activities within alternative spaces.  Corsica Studios is a not-for-profit Company Limited by Guarantee and has both strong artistic and social aims. Through our partnerships, work with local organisations and training programmes we are active within the local community and are committed to realising our belief that art has an important role to play within the regeneration process. company overview: The County Pop Music Festival is presented by Zunior.com, along with the Sandbanks Music Festival. Founded in 2004 to support Canadian independent music, learn more about Zunior here www.zunior.com.
column44: County Pop 2020 is music, family and food event in Prince Edward County at the Crystal Palace in downtown Picton on Saturday, May 2, 2020. This is our fifth yea...r!    Our 2020 headliner is the Juno-nominated Devin Cuddy Band! This Canadian singer-songwriter has released two acclaimed full length albums, and one EP.  As the son of one of Canada’s most beloved singer/songwriters, Blue Rodeo’s Jim Cuddy, country rock has been the soundtrack to Devin’s entire life—he was born the same week Blue Rodeo began recording its 1987 debut album, Outskirts.  Learn more about County Pop: www.countypop.com.  Limited advance tickets are $30 + HST. At the gate, tickets will be $35 + HST  Main Stage Lineup - Bands start at 3:30 pm and finish by 8:30 pm!  1. Unlike many restaurants, that have a specific cultural or culinary theme, Cravings offers many choices, making it easy to satisfy all the cravings at the table. From crisp salads, to rich Italian plates, to tangy Pan-Asian stirfries and finally the grill–with both upscale and casual offerings–gastronomical bliss is attainable at Cravings. about: The Crown and Beaver Pub is 'Raising the Bar' with great, creative cuisine from Chef Colin McClean and an outstanding kitchen team. Top notch service with a smile and an awesome draught beer lineup. Your neighborhood pub in Ferris.

column44: The Crown and Beaver Pub is a special place where guests can socialize in a comfortable and inviting environment, while enjoying a selection of fine, freshly pr...epared foods, and an extensive selection of draught and bottled beer, spirits, and wine.        We are 'Raising the Bar' in North Bay by giving our guests a unique experience which can't be offered by large chain brands. The Pub is warm and inviting, with an atmosphere focused on conversation and camaraderie; the kind of place where you don't have to raise your voice to be heard over the music, whether you're sitting inside or on our patio. Our menu combines British classics with local favourites, so there is something for everyone.  The Crown and Beaver is a proud supporter of local musical talent, and we have live music every weekend at the Pub.  A full, up to date lineup can be found in the Music section of the website. Address: Streetcar Crowsnest, 345 Carlaw Avenue Toronto, Ontario
about: Crow's Theatre is vibrant live theatre at the corner of Dundas & Carlaw in Toronto's Leslieville neighbourhood.
mission: Crow’s mission is to ignite passionate and enduring engagement between audiences and theatre artists through the creation, production and promotion of new theatre that examines and illuminates the pivotal narratives of our times.
company overview: We seed projects and collaborations with artists and companies that are engaged in the examination of our culture’s pivotal narratives in ways that are direct a...nd complex, entertaining and challenging; a process that happily leads us to constantly reconsider, reimagine and redefine the possibilities of the theatre and the world that we make.  Crow’s commits to an artistic process that is long-term, provides an appropriate gestation period, and multiple moments of audience engagement during its development; so that each work has the opportunity to be informed by and grow, based on its resonance with the public.        We actively seek out expertise outside of the theatre milieu in order to identify or understand stories that are of vital and pressing concern for our audience and artists. See Morend complex, entertaining and challenging; a process that happily leads us to constantly reconsider, reimagine and redefine the possibilities of the theatre and the world that we make. about: CruiseyT is .best known as Vancouver’s Original Pride Cruises, for hosted throughout the Summer. Celebrating 28 years of LGBTQ events in 2019.
company overview: CruiseyT Celebrates 27 years and is known for Vancouver’s Original Pride Cruises. CruiseyT is known across the continent for hosting the ultimate gay club alter...native parties. Their iconic Pride Cruises are a must-attend events. It's a great way to explore the scenic harbours the Pacific coast has to offer, and make new friends from around the world.  Last year we hosted over 1500 guests in Vancouver's majestic harbour during Vancouver Pride weekend alone. You’ll want to get your tickets early as these parties are known too sell out each year! CruiseyT's operation raises funds for local charities and organizations within the LGBTQ community. Since the inception of CruiseyT in 1991 founded by Randy Newburg, a total of $650,000 has been donated to worthy causes and direct service agencies. We thank you for all your generous support over the years to make this possible.  Our events are not only Pride Cruises but Vancouver’s Next Drag Superstar, and events in the Comox Valley during Pride and throughout the year.  Many past events that happen in Vancouver, Winnipeg, Whistler and several other cities have been created and produced by the producer’s of CruiseyT.  Sign up for our newsletter to stay informed as to what we’re doing next. See Morenative parties. Their iconic Pride Cruises are a must-attend events. mission: cSPACE King Edward is an arts hub, innovative venue and coworking space for Calgary to experiment, explore and spark change. We provide the conditions that dive...rse communities of creatives need to remain vital, engaged and innovative while generating dividends for Calgarians across the city: - Shared Space – affordable, flexible and inspiring spaces that are responsive to the evolving needs of new practices, missions and enterprises while delivering unique gathering places for all Calgarians - Vibrant Community – diverse and meaningful opportunities to engage with peers and collaborators, amplified through greater connectivity to surrounding neighbourhoods - Entrepreneur Support – specialized and responsive workshops, services and peer-to-peer mentorship focused on nurturing creative entrepreneurship, building confidence in artists, designers and makers to generate innovative cultural products and experiences for Calgary and the world. column44: The deCoste Performing Arts Centre opened in 1982 with a fantastic performance by Rita MacNeil.  Since then we have featured thousands of great performers from ...East Coast favourites to international headliners: Great Big Sea, Buffy Sainte Marie, k.d. lang, Natalie MacMaster, Matt Anderson and many more.   Today the deCoste presents over 100 shows and events throughout the year.  Our popular Festival of Summer Sounds during July and August each year features daily performances from Tuesdays to Thursdays as well as some weekends.  We host entertaining productions by our local community theatre group, celebrate sold out recitals by local ballet schools and present musicians and bands working in and across genres from rock 'n' roll to folk, from classical to bluegrass.  The deCoste also hosts live television and radio broadcasts--from local charity telethons to CBC radio tapings. about: The Annapolis Valley's largest music festival Twitter @DeepRootsM
company overview: Set in Wolfville, Nova Scotia, the Deep Roots Music Festival is an annual September event enjoyed by music lovers of all ages. With this picturesque university ...town and its beautiful natural surroundings as the backdrop, the Canadian Deep Roots Music Festival brings together some of the finest folk and roots singers, songwriters and musicians in the world for a weekend of concerts, dancing and celebration. Deep Roots also offers free workshops and outdoor shows as well as the yearly “Fresh Beats Rhythm Parade”.  For more information visit www.deeprootsmusic.ca or call (902) 542-ROOT (7668). biography: Native American Brutal Death Metal originating from Morley, Alberta.  Forming a blend of enormously punishing guitar riffs, rhythmic thundering of the drums, th...e pounding rumble of the bass, and the deep roaring vocals. Behold the bloodthirstiness of DETHGOD!  Formed in 2012, formally know as AFTERDEATH. In 2013, The band had changed its name to DETHGOD. Beginning at first as death metal with both melodic and brutal tone. Then developing more technical as the members grew as musicians. The music style has since progressed and evolved into a more darker sound to suit the band's genre. They are currently a three-piece band as of 2018. See Moree pounding rumble of the bass, and the deep roaring vocals. Behold the bloodthirstiness of DETHGOD! mission: Develop Nova Scotia (previously Waterfront Development) is the crown corporation responsible for leading sustainable development of high potential property and ...infrastructure across Nova Scotia – all with the view to drive inclusive economic growth in our province.  As Waterfront Development, our mandate was to redevelop and revitalize lands surrounding Halifax Harbour and other lands designated by our shareholder – which led to our involvement in Lunenburg. While our commitment and love of our place at the water’s edge remains steadfast, now, as Develop Nova Scotia, our mission is to support the creation of sustainable places right across Nova Scotia  that attract and inspire people and investment. column44: PH8 is a house concert venue. Stephen and Lee host 6 to 10 house concerts a year. Every one of them is an intimate, engaging and fun-filled event.  We've hosted... full bands and soloists.  We've hosted artists from the neighbourhood and artists from across Canada and the US.  Each House Concert is a Pay What You Can event, and we suggest $20 per person.  We've got a great group of PH8 regulars (both audience and musicians) and we always welcome newbies!  It's a very friendly crowd and an unforgettable experience.  See you soon! about: [Resto - Bar - Spectacle] Cocktails, bourbon, menu réconfortant, viandes fumées, cuisine du marché, Blues et concerts variés!
Saskatoon's Premier Gay Bar!
column44: Diva's Nightclub is Saskatoon's Premier Gay Bar offering an inviting space for dance lovers of any kind. Housed in the historic Avenue Building (est. 1912) Diva...'s is a staple in Saskatoon's queer community, is recognized as Saskatoon's premier dance club and has operated continuously for the past 20 years from its current location.  Diva's friendly staff invite you to enjoy a hand-crafted cocktail and explore the recently remodeled interior that features elements of the historic space which came before it. With original iron railings adorning the staircase and mezzanine that overlook the main levels dance floor, Diva's updated décor and state-of-the-art lighting and sound are sure to excite and inspire.  Diva's second level features a brand new lounge / venue room called The Annex, which is sectioned off from the excitement of the main bar, offering a quieter area to enjoy cocktails and a more laid back vibe. The room features original hardwood flooring from 1912 while blending in sleek new fixtures, décor, and furniture. The Annex will host many special events, live bands, poetry readings, private parties, and many other community events.  For information on booking The Annex please use our online booking form at http://www.divasnightclub.com  Diva's caters to Saskatoon's queer community featuring many one of a kind special events, the hottest parties and the top dance DJs in Saskatoon. We'll be here waiting for you to discover the best Saskatoon's nightlife has to offer. company overview: The Dominion Hotel and Pub is an independently owned family business in the beautiful riverside town of Minden, Ontario. The buildings are historic but modern. Extreme care has been taken to preserve feelings for the past.
products: Since opening in 1865 the Dominion Hotel has been the 'go-to' spot for good food, relaxed service, great entertainment and comfortable accommodations.

column44: Welcome To The Drake! ... Great Food, Great Fun. Welcome to the Drake! Canmore’s only venue for live music and a favorite for dining, sports, or just enjoying happy hour with friends on the patio. Our Canadian pub menu offers a variety of appetizing favorites, complimented with a wide selection of local Alberta craft beers & patio cocktails.  The Drake is truly the local's favourite watering hole! As one of our regular customers put it we are the "CHEERS" of Canmore. With every one from construction workers to lawyers gathering together for the legendary Happy Hour Mon - Fri 4-7pm. Stop in and catch the game on one of our 15 screens including our HD big screen projector, or enjoy a show with some of Canmore's top musical talents.  The Drake is the place to start and finish another Rocky Mountain adventure. From humble beginnings, the Drake has grown to include, 26 guest rooms, a family friendly restaurant, a premier live music venue, a nightclub and private function space catering for groups large and small. Whatever the trip, the Drake has your needs covered.  Voted best pub in the Canadian Rockies by Skier Magazine. One of Canada's top 120 pubs by the Pub Lovers Guide. column44: Located in the heart of Orillia, Ontario the Dark Room Studio & Gallery is a 1500 sqft Art Gallery, Photography Studio, Darkroom and Creative Workshop space. Th...e Gallery displays the work of established, mid-career and emerging regional artists. The photography studio is available for rent with or without lighting and many different backdrops to choose from. Our Creative Workshop series focuses on Photography (Shooting & Editing), Video Production (Shooting & Editing) as well as Media Management. We also have a community Darkroom available to rent by the hour, or by monthly membership.   The Dark Room Studio & Gallery is curated by Tyler Knight, a photographer/videographer, who is native to Orillia. Tyler has been in the Orillia art community for 13 years and has a great reach with local artists. See Moree Gallery displays the work of established, mid-career and emerging regional artists. about: One of Melbourne's finest small venues, hosting live, original music Wednesday through Sunday, Trivia on Tuesday's and Melbourne's finest Guinness every day.
column44: The Drunken Poet is a cozy, authentic Irish pub, situated just near the Victoria Markets, at 65 Peel St, West Melbourne.  Out of more than 1,500 pubs from 41 co...untries, The Drunken Poet was voted into the 10 Best Irish Pubs In The World (Outside Ireland) by The Irish Times... the only venue in Australia to make the list!  As our reviews will tell you, The Drunken Poet is a real locals' pub: cute, cozy and friendly. That's what makes it authentically Irish - it's not a twee or clichéd theme-pub... we have portraits of poets from Ireland and around the world on our walls, we serve great Guinness, and we have one of the finest selections of Irish whiskey in Australia.   We do free live music six nights a week, and feature Tribute Tuesdays, Wine Whiskey Women on Wednesdays, Open Mic Nights every second Thursday, and Irish Music Sessions on Fridays.   For band bookings please email drunkenpoetmusic@gmail.com  For general enquiries please email siobhandooleypoet@gmail.com  Open Mic Nights: sign ups start at 7pm, no booking required - just come on in and put your name on the list! mission: The Downtown Kitchener BIA exists to be a collective vice that fosters collaboration within our business area and acts as a catalyst for prosperous growth in our community.
company overview: The Downtown Kitchener (BIA) is a not for profit organization guided by a volunteer Board of Directors established for the main purpose of revitalizing the Cent...ral Business District of the City of Kitchener.  We are designated as a Business Improvement Area (BIA) through the Ontario Municipal Act and a City of Kitchener by-law enacted in 1977.  The Downtown Kitchener BIA is one of the more active BIA's in the province of Ontario and has initiated and participated in many new revitalization initiatives.  The role of a BIA has changed over the years since its creation in the Municipal Act and the Downtown Kitchener BIA has been a leader in developing some of those changes. about: May the sound of happy music, and the lilt of Irish laughter fill your heart with gladness.

column44: "Dubh Linn” translates from Black Pool, the dark pool of w ater that lies beneath the heart of Dublin. Located near St. James Gate Brewery — the home of Guinnes...s since 1759 — these dark waters are said to be the inspiration behind Arthur Guinness’s perfect pint.  The first Dubh Linn Gate Irish Pub was designed and crafted in Ireland in 1997, then transported piece by piece across the pond to its new mountain home in Whistler, British Columbia.  Then on August 20, 2015, we opened this fine Vancouver establishment. Yes, Guinness may have been born in Ireland, but its Irish spirit is alive and well at Dubh Linn Gate in South East False Creek.  Here, just like our Whistler location, you’ll find plenty of charming people eager to meet you, some spirited live music, 24 draught taps pouring deliciously fresh 20oz Imperial pints, and authentic Irish fare to fill the belly and soothe the soul. It’s a lovely day for a Guinness after all. We invite you to join us, settle in, tip a pint of Guinness and enjoy a taste of Ireland. biography: Duncan Showroom - 131 Station Street...street level music venue where it is all about the music some history: the Duncan Garage Showroom  open in Sept. 2003 and... was situated upstairs in the historic Duncan Garage building located at 330 Duncan Street, Duncan, BC. It offered an all ages multimedia experience in an intimate and memorable setting.  Longevity John, the Showrooms benevolent dictator still has an  insatiable passion for music and performance that  fuels the pro arts attitude that permeates the   Showroom. A visit to a Duncan Showroom Production will not only entertain, it will leave you understanding how important the arts are to a healthy community. From local teen bands to internationally recognized recording artists the Duncan Garage Showroom ( now Duncan Showroom Productions and working out of the new Duncan Showroom -131 Station Street -downstairs) offers an astounding array of performers and performances. So come on down, buy some tickets and support our effort to promote the arts in the Cowichan Valley. Page Types: Lounge | Dance & Night Club | Bar & Grill
about: This "retro style" nightspot offers a fun, friendly and mature atmosphere with some of the best LIVE ENTERTAINMENT and DJs anywhere in Durham.
column44: As you enter The Edge Lounge, you instantly get a warm feeling from the overall vibe. Whether it's the personable and efficient staff, the fun & friendly client...ele or just the overall package, this "retro style" lounge is a keeper! The Edge Lounge is particularly known for its "mature" nightlife but we don't actually set an age minimum.    One of the best part about Fridays & Saturdays at The EDGE is the Entertainment. Every FRIDAY and SATURDAY The EDGE features some of the best local talent in the circuit today. If Live Music really isn't your thing, the Edge also provides one of the best DJs in the GTA. DJ RAY spins the tunes (between band sets) EVERY Friday & Saturday! The Edge is also known locally for its special event THURSDAYS featuring some of the greatest live tribute acts and various theme parties.   Part of what makes The Edge so successful and popular is the amount of parties, events and fundraisers that we host. If you are planning on booking an event in the near future The Edge Lounge would be an excellent choice. Whether it's a Birthday Party, Anniversary, Corporate Event, Stag/Stagette or Sports Fundraiser, The Edge can take care of everything for you including Food, Service & Entertainment!  Although The Edge Lounge is mostly known for its amazing nightlife, some may be surprised to find out that the menu is second to none. It's actually quite difficult to find a particular menu item that doesn't taste great! But don't take our word for it, come experience the Edge Lounge for yourself...See you soon! about: Restaurant-microbrasserie-bar et piste de danse!
column44: Au pied du Mont Brome à Bromont, Le Hyperlodge est un pub de montagne où l’on se rejoint  pour prendre une bonne bière West Shefford blonde, rousse ou noire bra...ssée sur place. C’est ensuite un resto ambiance animé, où l’on est bien installé dans un décor chalet-chic, avec un menu microbrasserie où l'on cuisine avec notre bière, puis des vins et cocktails qu’il fait bon de savourer en groupe et en couple! Le souper terminé, on donne rendez-vous aux amis au bar, on profite du feu extérieur pour le digestif ou on se précipite sur la piste de danse pour le reste de la nuit!  Fermeture des cuisines à 23h! Page Types: Golf Course & Country Club | Hotel Resort | Restaurant
about: Eganridge
general information: Set atop an expansive ridge, our heritage estate overlooks scenic Sturgeon Lake in the heart of the Trent-Severn Waterway. Towering pines shade an historic, squ...are-timbered manor house. Loon calls echo in the morning air. Lakefront sunsets bring a warm glow to the dining room. Through careful design we blend heritage romance with contemporary luxury. Our premier spa, scenic golf course and fine dining ensure a memorable visit.  Dunsford House is at the heart of the Eganridge estate. Carved from virgin pine forests on the shores of Sturgeon Lake, this gracious log manor home blends Canadian heritage with contemporary luxury. Named for the prominent English family who settled here in 1837, Dunsford House remains one of the region's finest square-timbered structures. Massive hand-hewn logs speak of the home's early 19th-century heritage.  On the manicured grounds overlooking the lake, sit five luxuriously furnished one and two bedroom cottages. Rich in history and elegant in appointment, Dunsford House and the cottages rekindle the warmth and grace of an age long past. Enjoy the spectacular view from our spacious Terrace Rooms. Glass doors slide open to a private patio or balcony where you can watch islands emerge from the morning mist or listen to a loon's haunting call.   George Friedmann brings decades of experience in hospitality to this remarkable property and is guided by his commitment to rekindle the warmth and elegance of an age past while providing the luxuries expected in the finest accommodation.  We welcome you to sublime pampering at The Spa at Eganridge, a serene environment complete with hydrotherapy baths, Swiss showers and an extensive menu of body and skin care services.  Eganridge's secluded setting eliminates distractions, so corporate events and business retreats become productive and pleasant. Corporate golf tournaments are a house specialty. We have excellent menus and facilities for business meetings. Treetops, our conference facility, seats up to 140 people.   Your wedding dreams come true thanks to our photogenic waterfront setting, professional wedding planners and hostess. Our wedding menus and elegant reception room overlooking Sturgeon Lake make every reception special.  The Eganridge golf course has one of the most scenic settings in the province, and most tees and holes have views of the lake. Housed in the estate's adze-hewn post-and-beam barn is a fully stocked golf and tennis shop.   The pine-paneled dining room and screened-in deck offer panoramic views of the most splendid scenery in the Kawarthas. An acclaimed menu features regional ingredients presented in the classic French tradition. Our vintage wine selection is unparalleled in the region. Experienced, friendly staff will turn every meal into a memorable occasion. Dress is casual; ambience is gracious.  We welcome you to the charm and elegance of Eganridge Inn & Spa. about: A Victorian warehouse in Kings Cross with a variety of spaces indoors and outdoors along with a 24-hour licence.  Age: 19+ (Valid Photo ID required)
public transit: 390 bus stop opposite the club Closest Tube: King's Cross form the south... Caledonian Road & Barnsbury or Camden Road from the north  Free EGG shuttle bus from York Way, opposite the American Car Wash See More Caledonian Road & Barnsbury or Camden Road from the north  Free EGG shuttle bus from York Way, opposite the American Car Wash
column44: THE HISTORY OF EGG LONDON The Kings Cross we knew 17 years ago is a very different place from the up and coming, regenerated hub it is today. Over a decade ago,... Laurence Malice purchased a Victorian warehouse which was surrounded by virtually derelict wasteland, directly opposite one of the London’s worst housing estates looming just a stone’s throw away from the venue’s front door. We look back at the evolution of Egg LDN… After developing his legendary Trade brand from the scratch, the purchase of what was soon to be Egg LDN back in 1997 was the next project for Malice. With an aim to host legal parties that continued well into the early hours of the morning with an emphasis on the wellbeing of club goers (in addition to a strong booking policy), it became clear that London was lacking an indoor, fully legitimate space for those who wanted to carry on partying after 3am. It’s hard to believe that such draconian license laws were in place compared to the London we know today. Armed with a loyal crew comprised of Trade staff and a solid dose of determination, the previously disused warehouse was christened ‘Egg LDN’ to signify rebirth and a new chapter in both Malice’s life and London nightlife. Malice focused on a music policy which began to showcase emerging and long-running talent from the global electro and techno scene, with the likes of Joy Orbison, Chase and Status, Justice, Miss Kittin, Steve Bicknell and Jeff Mills cropping up in the Main Room during the early years.  Despite the niche booking policy, it wasn’t all plain sailing. Due to the location of the club opposite a notoriously unruly estate, revellers were wary to spend their weekends in an area frequented by a few undoubtedly questionable characters. However, slowly but surely, Egg’s 24-hour license and multiple outdoor spaces attracted a loyal crowd who went on to spread the word about a new spot which hosted a plethora of house, techno and electro names from all over the world. As a result, it wasn’t long before Egg’s long-running sessions became legendary throughout the capital. Powering through the years of turbulent changes which could have knocked the club sideways, a slew of remarkable shifts on the electronic scene began to take hold. The introduction of the smoking ban in 2006, and the disappearance of iconic clubs between 2006 and 2013 - which included prominent spots such as The Key, Bagleys, The Church and The Cross - and a huge rehaul of Kings Cross were pinnacle events in the timeline of Egg LDN history, yet the combination of strong-willed team and an uncompromising roster of talent kept the club alive. Evolving with the changes of our time, the club itself is currently undergoing a major refurbishment, with a brand new Main Room, sound system and more all to be revealed later on this year. With such positive architectural adjustments already lined up this year amongst other surprises, it’s safe to say we’ll be around for another while longer. Despite the niche booking policy, it wasn’t all plain sailing. Due to the location of the club opposite a notoriously unruly estate, revellers were wary to spend their weekends in an area frequented by a few undoubtedly questionable characters. However, slowly but surely, Egg’s 24-hour license and multiple outdoor spaces attracted a loyal crowd who went on to spread the word about a new spot which hosted a plethora of house, techno and electro names from all over the world. As a result, it wasn’t long before Egg’s long-running sessions became legendary throughout the capital. Powering through the years of turbulent changes which could have knocked the club sideways, a slew of remarkable shifts on the electronic scene began to take hold. The introduction of the smoking ban in 2006, and the disappearance of iconic clubs between 2006 and 2013 - which included prominent spots such as The Key, Bagleys, The Church and The Cross - and a huge rehaul of Kings Cross were pinnacle events in the timeline of Egg LDN history, yet the combination of strong-willed team and an uncompromising roster of talent kept the club alive. Evolving with the changes of our time, the club itself is currently undergoing a major refurbishment, with a brand new Main Room, sound system and more all to be revealed later on this year. With such positive architectural adjustments already lined up this year amongst other surprises, it’s safe to say we’ll be around for another while longer.

Address: 1 Town Hall Parade London, United Kingdom
about: Electric Brixton
column44: Electric Brixton opened its doors in September 2011, it brought back the life that was previously known as The Fridge and before that, The Ace.  The most notice...able difference is the million pound facelift it's been given, where possible back to its original interior features with some twists for the 21st century.  Electric Brixton boasts an amazing stage with unsurpassed sightlines making it the perfect venue for large scale club events, live music, television recording, private parties and special arts events. Across both floors the venue has a capacity of 1,700 for club events and 1,500 for live shows. It is the only mid-range music venue in Brixton which is home to an area with a long-established vibrant music scene, standing alongside many other live music pubs and clubs. Keeping Brixton at its heart Electric Brixton is equally at home hosting avant-garde arts events as it is hosting straight up clubs, a new centrally located independent venue perfect for South London. about: Electric Love Music Festival - Dance & Be Free!!!
column44: Five well-seasoned, hand-picked production companies have united their years of experience and undying love for music to create this festival.  For them, electr...onic music is more than a genre, it’s an insatiable passion and a lifestyle.   This action packed, one-night festival will be sure to enlighten all of the senses. Nestled in the heart of Mt. Cheam, Electric Love offers festival-goers a lush space to dance and be free in, boasting stunning mountain and waterfall backdrops as well as the river’s edge.  Up and coming local talent and world renowned DJ’s coupled with amazing sound will be sure to delight the ear drums and lift the spirit.   Electric Love Music Festival is dedicated to social, cultural and ecological innovation through creative process. We facilitate forward and critical thinking cultural experiences that emphasize the intersection of sound, design and technology in artistic forms.  Future events will include involvement with international campaigns of awareness, consciousness and sustainability.   All are welcome at Electric Love Music Festival.  Affordable prices and a welcoming and open environment make all feel at home.  Please join us at Electric Love Music Festival, for one magical summer night of musical expression that will leave you with a deeper awareness of the depths of your soul!   / / / / / / / / / /   What is ISN’T ALLOWED on the ELF community page: -No swearing  -No personal attacks will be tolerated  -No posting about anything religious or political   Breaking the rules will result in temporary or permanent banning. about: Fondée en 2001 par l’artiste interdisciplinaire D. Kimm, Les Filles électriques est une compagnie de création qui présente du théâtre d’images, des performances, des cabarets, des courts métrages et des installations poétiques.
mission: Les Filles électriques est une compagnie vouée à la création d’événements interdisciplinaires intégrant la poésie, la performance, le théâtre, la musique et les... arts médiatiques. Elle produit et diffuse des spectacles, des disques et des courts métrages ainsi que le Festival Voix d’Amériques, dédié à création et à la prise de parole. See More arts médiatiques. about: Ottawa, ON - ELE Festival 2016 is an event that is hosted by the Student Federation of the University of Ottawa to promote and showcase local musicians in Ottawa.
mission: E.L.E Fest aims to showcase the talent of Ottawa and inspire future generations to musical greatness through innovative, one of a kind events.
column44: This is the official page for Ottawa's Newest Music Festival - E.L.E Fest. In case you haven't heard the saying, E.L.E stands for everybody love everybody. That...'s the kind of festival we strive to be. We promote many different styles and genres of music and we encourage artists to broaden their horizons by working together in collaborative performances. Music brings people together like nothing else can; audience and performers. In short, we're trying to put the love back in the music.   From what we've seen, the Ottawa music scene fosters more than enough talent to make this festival a success. We have great venues, and extremely talented musicians. Let's make this city ELE-lectric.   Each year in mid to late September, University Square, a beautiful new site at the University of Ottawa, will play host to E.L.E Festival 2016. The festivities will begin at 1:00 pm and end promptly at 11:00 pm. Venue capacity is upwards of 3000 people. The stage is large (30ft x 30ft) and is covered by a large tent, so the festival will proceed rain or shine. See More's the kind of festival we strive to be. We promote many different styles and genres of music and we encourage artists to broaden their horizons by working together in collaborative performances. Act Name: Elgin and Winter Garden Theatre Centre
Page Types: Performance Art Theatre | Movie Theater | Landmark & Historical Place
about: Official page of the Elgin and Winter Garden Theatre Centre  – a National Historic Site and the world’s last operating double-decker theatre.
column44: In 1913, prominent New York architect Thomas W. Lamb designed this remarkable theatre complex, which was constructed on Yonge Street in downtown Toronto over an... eight-month period. The complex featured two large theatres, stacked one above the other, and was the Canadian flagship for Marcus Loew’s growing chain of vaudeville houses. Fewer than a dozen double-decker theatres were built worldwide and Loew’s was the only one ever built in Canada. Although vaudeville was extremely popular at the time, movies were the coming mass entertainment. By 1930, the Elgin had been wired for sound and the live acts discontinued. The Winter Garden, which had been closed in 1928, was abandoned. The Elgin had operated continuously until 1981 and had undergone several periods of renovation before gradually being allowed to slide into disrepair. In 1981, the Ontario Heritage Trust purchased the building, thus securing its future. Recognizing the historical and architectural importance of the complex, the Trust embarked on a plan to carry out the largest theatre restoration ever undertaken in Canada. The fully restored Elgin and Winter Garden Theatre Centre re-opened on December 15, 1989. Today the Elgin and Winter Garden Theatre Centre is a National Historic Site and is host to many live performances including concerts, musicals, operas and stand-up comics.  It is also a venue for TIFF film galas and home to Ross Petty Productions and Opera Atelier.   ---  Terms of Use/Posting Guidelines  This page is administered by the Elgin and Winter Garden Theatre Centre. about: Elijah’s Promise harnesses the power of food to break the cycle of poverty, alleviate hunger and change lives.  www.elijahspromise.org
mission: Elijah’s Promise harnesses the power of food to break the cycle of poverty, alleviate hunger and change lives.
company overview: Since 1989, Elijah’s Promise has used food as a tool to alleviate hunger, empower lives and invite justice for the most vulnerable members of our Central New Je...rsey community. We operate a soup kitchen, culinary arts school, catering business and café, and connect low-income individuals and families with social and health services. With the support of volunteers, donors and community partners, we serve more than 100,000 meals per year and train previously unskilled workers for careers in the food services industry.  SOUP KITCHEN 18 Neilson St. New Brunswick Lunch 11:00 a.m.-12:15 p.m. and Dinner 6:00 p.m.-7:00 p.m served Mon-Fri and one meal served daily Sat and Sun 11-1 p.m TO VOLUNTEER please go to: www.elijahspromise.org and register under the "volunteer" section on the home page.  PROMISE  CULINARY SCHOOL The Promise  Culinary Arts Program is a short-term, intesnsive culinary arts triaining program that prepares participants for employment in the food service industry. This is done through classes in basic culinary arts, communication, and life and job readiness skills that empower students to advance to the next level. Students receive hands on and practical work experience in the kitchen, both on-site, and in contracted food service. Promise Jobs equips people with the training tools they need to succeed.  Class Schedule:  -Day Classes (19 weeks)  Mon-Fri 10:00 a.m.-5:00 p.m. -Night Classes (22 weeks) Mon-Thurs 5:30 p.m.-10:30 p.m.  PROMISE CULINARY BAKING AND PASTRY PROGRAM The Promise Culinary  Baking and Pastry Program is a state-certified program that allows its' participants to get an in depth look into culinary arts, thru baking and pastry lectures and labs, team building and communications activities, and life skill/ job skill workshops. Our program is designed to get our graduates employment in the baking and pastry field. A program of this length allows you to be well prepared for any job opportunity within the baking and pastry field. Class Schedule: -Day Classes (24 weeks) Mon-Fri 7:30 a.m.-2:30 p.m. Class size is limited (12 students per class)  To enroll in the Promise Culinary Arts Program or the Promise Culinary Baking and Pastry Program you must be: -18 years or older -6th grade reading and math -Alcohol and Drug Free ~Complete an Application ~Schedule and interview with staff ~Special programs are in place for those who are unemployed, low-income, or recently down-sized. Please Contact: (732) 545-9002 Ext. 114 See Morersey community. about: A protected heritage building, this charming little venue presents professional Canadian musicians, digital cinema, touring shows, summer camps and community theatre. Oh, and we do weddings, too.
column44: This enduring facility can seat just over 300 people at cinematic, musical, dramatic and other cultural, corporate and community events.  Our licensed lounge an...d lobby concession serve up treats for all ages.  Built in 1912 and beautifully restored in the 1980s, the place is steeped in history and continues its run into the 21st century.  Depending on the event, tickets can be purchased online, over the phone, at the door or at our administration office, two doors east of the theatre.  Concession, intermission bar and admission for regular screenings in the cinema are cash only.  Rental inquiries may be directed to the administration office. about: L'Espace Mandeville est d'abord et avant tout un lieu de rassemblement pour les artistes de tous les horizons.
mission: L'Espace Mandeville se donne pour mission de faire rayonner la culture de Drummondville sous toutes ses formes.   Que se soit en présentant des événements de qu...alité.Tant en présentant des artistes établi ou en donnant l'opportunité aux artistes de la relève de se produire dans un milieu stimulant et professionnel à un prix abordable.  Que ce soit en chant, en humour, en danse ou en cinéma, l'Espace Mandeville se veut une fenêtre pour les arts et la culture et s'engage à faire rayonner celles-ci en encourageant et impliquant les artistes de la relève locale, de tous les horizons, au coeur de sa programmation.  L'Espace Mandeville se veut un lieu de rassemblement pour tous. Que ce soit pour organiser une fête, pour un local de répétition, une salle de conférence, un lieu d'enseignement ou tout autre projet nécessitant un grand espace.   Les profits réalisés par les activités de L'Espace Mandeville servent à soutenir la mission d'organisme de La Piaule Centre du Québec inc. about: www.theeverleigh.ca www.facebook.com/EverleighToronto www.instagram.com/everleighTO
column44: Not quite a nightclub and not just a bar or lounge, The Everleigh is a fresh take on Canadian nightlife interpreted through nostalgia, art, music, cocktails and... culture and is the seventh venture from (C)apture Group, helmed by Toronto hospitality trendsetters Zark Fatah and Ralf Madi.  The Everleigh caters to evolved King West faithfuls by fusing old and new world concepts across two rooms to create a mature yet fun social experience while still offering next-generation club-goers a solid place to dance. The Everleigh will also act as a showcase for local and international artists and photographers. The space includes original artwork by American street artist Alec Monopoly.  With The Everleigh, (C)apture Group celebrates and re-interprets Canadiana, marrying iconic vintage ideas with street-edge design while adding a sexy opulent flair reminiscent of Chicago’s Everleigh Brothel in the early 1900s.  Century-old antiques and bespoke art installations pepper the space. Creative integration of the discontinued copper penny infuses shine and texture throughout the venue; while Muskoka-themed washrooms offer a new take on an old world canoe.  A flock of geese across the ceiling is a key focal point in the lounge representing the migration and evolution of King West in Toronto.   Creative mixology is the foundation for The Everleigh's dynamic bar experience. The drink menu appeals to even the most discerning tastes and includes a colourful and delicious cocktail selection curated by award-winning mixologist Nishan Nepulaonga (Blowfish Restaurant).   The dance floor, VIP tables and bottle service packages cater to those looking for a big night out. Music will feature both local DJs as well as international guests. Catering and customized services are available for private events. general information: Caretaker of Old Market Square and the Cube Stage. Looking to book an event? Give us at call at 204-942-6716.
mission: To champion the unique character of the Exchange District and create a safe, clean and thriving environment.
products: Historic Guided Walking Tours
awards: 2012 Winnipeg Tourism Award of Distinction - Marketing Campaign under $2500: Real to Reel Guided Walking Tour
column44: The Exchange District National Historic Site is one of Winnipeg's most colourful and cosmopolitan neighbourhoods. This 20-square-block district showcases North ...America's most extensive collection of terra-cotta and cut stone architecture. This remarkable district dates back to when Winnipeg transformed from a modest pioneer settlement to Western Canada's largest metropolitan centre.   Today, the Exchange District is known as the Cultural Mecca of Winnipeg. It is home to a diverse mix of commercial, cultural, educational, recreational and residential developments. The area is known for its arts community and wide range of entertainment and specialty shops and services. See MoreAmerica's most extensive collection of terra-cotta and cut stone architecture. This remarkable district dates back to when Winnipeg transformed from a modest pioneer settlement to Western Canada's largest metropolitan centre.   Today, the Exchange District is known as the Cultural Mecca of Winnipeg. It is home to a diverse mix of commercial, cultural, educational, recreational and residential developments. column44: The Fernie Hotel and Pubs offers a casual enviroment for both the locals and tourists. it truly is the Fernie Neighbourhood Pub. Dating back to the 1909, the Fe...rnie Hotel and Pub is the most historical pub in town. If your in the mood for some homestyle pub food, and a welcoming casual enviroment this is the place to go. With 9 HD flat screen tv's, a great sound system for both Friday night D.J.'s and Saturday night bands, the Fernie always has something going on.  We are now happy to announce we are a Kid friendly establishment 11am-9pm everyday. Address: 3 148 Ave de la Cathedrale Rimouski, Quebec
about: Le plus bel événement jazz dans l'Est du Canada, à la Fête du travail chaque année. Depuis 1986.
biography: Le plus sympathique des festivals de jazz attire pendant la fin de semaine de la Fête du travail les amateurs de jazz et profanes épris de musique et de fête se... côtoyant sur fond de mer et de montagnes. Ses racines solidement ancrées et son éclosion toujours spectaculaire en font un événement culturel et touristique phare dans l’Est du Québec depuis plus de vingt-cinq ans déjà.  Pour devenir « le plus grand des petits festivals d’Amérique du Nord », il suffisait de miser sur la bonne recette… et de laisser faire la magie! La règle de base dans notre cuisine : n’utiliser que des ingrédients de qualité exceptionnelle, pimenter d’innovation, puis lier avec beaucoup de passion. See More côtoyant sur fond de mer et de montagnes. column44: Pour sa 26e Édition, se déroulant du 31 août au 4 septembre prochain, le Festi Jazz International de Rimouski déroule le tapis rouge pour BRAN VAN 3000, Dave Do...uglas & Keystone, Bet.E, Le JMC Project, The Lost Fingers, DJ Poirier, Opossaum, DJ MINI, Park X Trio, Michel Donato, François Bourassa, Frank Lozano, Pierre Tanguay, Jean-Pierre Zanella Quartet, PINK Turtle et bien d'autres... Durant ce même week-end, vous aurez l'occasion de voir à l'oeuvre, dans différents cafés, restos et bars de la ville, ainsi qu'au marché public, plusieurs artistes de chez nous et d'ailleurs tel que: Vibra-Fun, Emie R Roussel Trio, Tony Jet'n Dave Trio Jazz, Rachel Therrien Quintet, Osmündazz, Philippe Bernier Quartet, Cassius Quartet, Mood Session, Jérôme Beaulieu Trio,  Maânouche Swing Trio, Steve Hill, Coyote, Rythmus, Holos, ainsi que les Combos du programme Pop/Jazz du Cégep de Rimouski. Assistez également a l’après-spectacle Spécial DJ au Rhinobarlounge samedi le 3 septembre à minuit. influences: Les musiciens qui nous ont visités depuis 1986 nous ont laissés ce petit quelque chose de jazzé qui nous anime encore. Nous rendons hommage à tous ces artisans du Festi Jazz.

biography: Un des événements les plus prestigieux en Amérique du Nord dans le domaine de la musique classique, le Festival s’assure la participation de solistes de grand r...enom de la scène nationale et internationale, de même que de grands orchestres canadiens et étrangers. Les concerts et récitals ont lieu à l’Amphithéâtre de Lanaudière, situé à Joliette, ainsi que dans plusieurs églises de la région de Lanaudière, et attirent chaque année plus de 55 000 festivaliers sur une période de 5 semaines. about: Festival Hall is an intimate performance and event space in historic Inglewood. The Hall is also the new home of the Calgary Folk Music Festival office.
column44: Festival Hall is an intimate performance and event space in historic Inglewood. The Hall is also the new home of the Calgary Folk Music Festival office. We are ...very excited to be able to present the diverse indie, roots, traditional, and world music the festival is known for, all year round. The Calgary Folk Music Festival curates arts and culture events throughout the year in the hall, including film, food, theatre, poetry and workshops. Our 1600+ volunteer army uses the Hall as a meeting space as well, while our legendary annual festival of course remains on Prince's Island Park. See Morevery excited to be able to present the diverse indie, roots, traditional, and world music the festival is known for, all year round. The Calgary Folk Music Festival curates arts and culture events throughout the year in the hall, including film, food, theatre, poetry and workshops. about: Producer of Fashion & Design events in Canada and overseas.   Post in French & English
public transit: Métro Place-des-Arts
column44: Le Festival Mode & Design célèbre la créativité et la culture grâce à un événement d’envergure à ciel ouvert en plein cœur du centre-ville de Montréal. Ce rende...z-vous unique au monde offre une expérience décloisonnée des univers de la mode et du design en proposant une programmation des plus variées.   Chaque année, de nombreux designers canadiens de renom, détaillants, créateurs émergents et icônes internationales de mode y partagent leur art et leur vision avec le grand public. Parmi d’autres activités, les festivaliers ont l’opportunité d’assister à des défilés de mode, des séances de création en direct, des représentations de design et des performances musicales. Le Festival Mode & Design trace également un parcours urbain d’expositions inédites, d’installations originales et d’expériences inusitées où tous peuvent circuler librement.   Avec 50 spectacles, près de 300 participants et 550 000 visiteurs attendus, le Festival Mode & Design est une plateforme prédominante des tendances mode, design, musique, beauté et shopping.   //  The Fashion & Design Festival celebrates creativity and culture through a major outdoor event in the heart of downtown Montreal. This one-of-a-kind occasion provides an inside look at the world of fashion and design through a diversified program of activities.  Every year, many well-known Canadian designers, retailers, up-and-coming creators and international fashion icons will share their art and vision with the public. The activities include fashion shows, live creative sessions, design showcasing and musical performances. The Fashion & Design Festival’s presence will also be felt around the city with novel exhibits, original installations and unique experiences open to all.  With 50 shows, as much as 300 participants and 550,000 visitors expected, the Fashion & Design Festival is a leading platform for fashion, design, music, beauty and shopping trends. about: Festival Place is a vibrant multi-use center for the arts, and business and is a point of convergence for the cultural visions, ideas and energies of the community. We are owned and operated by Strathcona County, in Sherwood Park. More info on website.
column44: Festival Place is a vibrant multi-use center for the arts, community and business and is a point of convergence for the cultural visions, ideas and energies of ...the community. We are an entertainment destination at the heart of Centre in the Park, a new community development in Sherwood Park, Alberta.  Since opening in May 1994, Festival Place has welcomed amateur and professional artists to its theatre stage, and has hosted many community activities and events. We are committed to providing diversity and excellence in our programming. Each year we offer over 100 professional performances by leading local, regional, national and international artists. Festival Place is also home to a number of community and regional arts organizations, including our own Festival Players and Festival Players for Youth.  There are currently over 65 volunteers offering their valued services at Festival Place. Volunteer opportunities are varied, including greeter, coat check attendant, usher, merchandiser, and technical support. If you are interested in becoming a volunteer at Festival Place, please contact us. Volunteered time and talent is appreciated and plays a very important role in the success of Festival Place. about: Du 14 au 16 juin 2019 sur la rue Saint-Jean. Visitez le fetedelamusiquedequebec.com pour tous les détails.
column44: La Fête de la Musique est née en France le 21 juin 1982. En moins de quinze ans, la Fête de la Musique sera célébrée sur les cinq continents, dans plus de 100 p...ays et 400 villes. Il y en a maintenant une à Québec depuis 2008! La Fête de la Musique de Qc est organisée grâce à la coopération de plusieurs organismes et regroupements d’artistes qui s’associent pour créer cet événement unique mettant en valeur la scène musicale locale émergente. Cette fête est ouverte à TOUS et offre en plus de sa programmation régulière, des espaces « JAM » ouverts au public! See Moreays et 400 villes. Il y en a maintenant une à Québec depuis 2008! column44: Festivals Kelowna is a non-profit society that produces free outdoor programs and events.   Our VISION - Connecting our community through festivals and events....  We produce Parks Alive!, the Kelowna Buskers Program, the Celebrate Canada Day – Kelowna festivities, and New York New Year's Eve family celebration. We also present Buskers on Bernard in mid-August, a showcase of our Kelowna Buskers Program.  In 2015 we introduced 2 new cool programs including Pianos in the Parks, a public pianos initiative, and Arts on the Avenue, a visual arts festival.  We proudly work with the City of Kelowna, our major funder and a key supporter of community-focused, accessible, cultural festivals and events to animate our parks and public spaces. about: Fiddlehead's Bar and Grill.
culinary team: Head Chef: JJ Stewart please call 613-267-4346 jj@fiddleheadsbarandgrill.com
column44: Located in one of Perth's oldest heritage stone buildings overlooking the Tay River, Fiddleheads offers a unique environment with a variety of spaces to choose ...from, each with a very different atmosphere. Our 40 foot copper and cherry-wood bar features over 20 varieties of domestic, imported and craft brewed beer and cider on tap and serves as a hub of activity for locals and visitors alike. A giant patio surrounds the bar area and offers unparalleled views of the river meandering through Stewart Park.  You will feel like you are in a New Orleans courtyard as you listen to the gentle sound of the water fountain in The Atrium surrounded by boutique stores, tropical palm trees and wrought iron balconies all basking in the sunlight from a 40 foot high glass ceiling.  The fine-dining area features an open kitchen concept nestled among exposed brick columns where you can view our award-winning chefs lovingly creating unique daily menu offerings and innovative specials.  We are proud to be considered the cornerstone of the region’s culinary and bar scene and our attentive and friendly staff strive daily to ensure you receive an unparalleled experience!   To learn more drop by or give us a call. See Morefrom, each with a very different atmosphere. about: Camden's legendary award-winning live music venue
column44: The Fiddler's Elbow is located within a short walk of Chalk Farm tube station, on the border of Camden and Kentish Town in north-west London. The local area is ...particularly well known for its vibrant night life, wealth of alternative shops, famous pubs & bars, and legendary live music circuit  Travelling by tube: Chalk Farm tube station is served by the Northern line (Edgware branch) and is just a couple of minutes walk from the Fiddler's Elbow. Alternative tube stations within walking distance include Camden High Street (Northern line, 10 minutes walk) and Kentish Town (Northern line, 10 minutes walk).  Travelling by bus: Chalk Farm Road / Camden High Street is well served by buses from Euston in the south, Hampstead and Islington in the north, and Baker Street & Marylebone in the west. The Number 24 bus stop (Hampstead Heath - Pimlico via Trafalgar Square) is situated right outside the venue. column44: The Fillmore Charlotte is housed in a historic textile mill, and is themed in the tradition of the legendary Fillmore in San Francisco. The Original Fillmore ha...s distinguished itself as a favorite among artists and fans alike because of the unique qualities of the theatre's ambience, feel and traditions. The Fillmore Charlotte features the iconic music venue's trademark decor, including red oak hardwood floors, red painted interior, vintage posters of legendary live music performances magnificent chandeliers throughout, state-of-the-art lighting and sound, as well as, stadium style tiers that create great sight lines from anywhere in the venue, a VIP area and more. The venue opened its doors in June of 2009. See Mores distinguished itself as a favorite among artists and fans alike because of the unique qualities of the theatre's ambience, feel and traditions.
