about: Latin Food Market - Grocery & Kitchen! Food Products from Mexico to Brazil!  North & South Edmonton
column44: Paraiso Tropical Ltd.  Paraiso Tropical (English meaning - Tropical Paradise) is a family owned and operated company. Founded in 1991, it was the first business... established in western Canada created to provide imported food products from South & Central America.  With 2 locations, our goal is to provide the Edmonton and surrounding area with imported goods from the Caribbean, Central & South America. We sell both at the retail and wholesale level which ranges in everything from food products, candies, drinks, snacks, cookware, health and beauty, handcrafts and other gifts.  Our goal here at Paraiso Tropical is to provide our customers with a unique shopping experience reminiscent of Latin America! Whether you're a  customer shopping for your traditional home-cooked meals or simply looking to try something new and unique, our friendly staff speak Spanish and English and are available to help find what you're looking for. You can also count on trying our traditional hot dishes from our take menu available everyday!  We hope you take the opportunity to visit us, experience and enjoy the taste of Latin America! See More established in western Canada created to provide imported food products from South & Central America. general manager: Lisa Fortin / La Compagnie Larivée Cabot Champagne
biography: Inaugurée en septembre 2004 par La Tribu, La Tulipe est située dans le magnifique bâtiment patrimonial du Théâtre Dominion sur la rue Papineau.  Depuis, les mur...s ont vibré au son de la musique de Jane Birkin, Albert Hammond Jr., The Black Keys, Cali, Chilly Gonzales, Franz Ferdinand, Hugh Masekela, Isabelle Boulay, Jon Spencer Blues Explosion, K-OS, LCD Soundsystem, le chanteur M, Martha Wainwright, Melissa Auf Der Mar, Patrick Watson, Phoenix, Renan Luce, Simple Plan, Stars, Sufjan Stevens, Suzanne Vega, Tom Cochrane, Tricky, Vieux Farka Touré...et bien plus!  Construit en 1913, Le Dominion présente jusqu'au début des années soixante du théâtre et du cinéma. Racheté en 1966 par le comédien Gilles Latulippe, la salle est rebaptisée Le Théâtre des Variétés. Le spectacle d'ouverture est donné le 23 septembre 1967 par Olivier Guimond et Rose Ouellette. Monsieur Latulippe animera ce théâtre pendant plus de 30 ans. Le Théâtre des Variétés deviendra le lieu du burlesque et de la comédie à Montréal.  Avec La Tulipe, La Tribu compte poursuivre la diffusion de concerts rock et de chanson francophone, de jazz et variétés, forte de l'expérience acquise avec Le Cabaret Music-Hall. See Mores ont vibré au son de la musique de Jane Birkin, Albert Hammond Jr., The Black Keys, Cali, Chilly Gonzales, Franz Ferdinand, Hugh Masekela, Isabelle Boulay, Jon Spencer Blues Explosion, K-OS, LCD Soundsystem, le chanteur M, Martha Wainwright, Melissa Auf Der Mar, Patrick Watson, Phoenix, Renan Luce, Simple Plan, Stars, Sufjan Stevens, Suzanne Vega, Tom Cochrane, Tricky, Vieux Farka Touré...et bien plus! about: Cirque, terre et humain sont réunis à la TOHU! Une salle de spectacle circulaire unique, expositions et événements spéciaux. La TOHU est un organisme à but non lucratif.

mission: La TOHU, au cœur de la cité des arts du cirque, se veut le lieu par excellence de diffusion, de création, d’expérimentation et de convergence entre culture, env...ironnement et engagement communautaire en Amérique du nord. La TOHU apporte sa contribution à l’accession de Montréal au rang de capitale internationale des arts du cirque, tout en se positionnant comme la référence en matière de développement durable par la culture. See Moreironnement et engagement communautaire en Amérique du nord. column44: Située au cœur de la Cité des arts du cirque, la TOHU est un lieu de diffusion, de création, d’expérimentation et de convergence entre culture, environnement et... engagement communautaire. Elle est devenue, depuis sa création, en 2004 une référence en matière de développement durable par la culture.  La TOHU contribue à faire de Montréal une capitale internationale des arts du cirque. Elle participe de plus à l’essor incroyable du cirque québécois en proposant une programmation qui le met au premier plan, avec une salle de spectacle et un festival lui étant dédié. about: Notre mission est la diffusion et la promotion des arts sur le territoire de la MRC du Rocher Percé en période estivale. Par nos activités, nous souhaitons partager et contribuer à la vitalité de notre patrimoine gaspésien.
company overview: La Vieille Usine de l'Anse-à-Beaufils est un lieu tout à fait unique. Entre ses murs se côtoient le Café-Bistro, la Salle de spectacle et la Galerie d'art – bou...tique. Toutes les activités qu'on y propose permettent des échanges et des partages de notre identité gaspésienne et québécoise! Au Café-Bistro, le menu se compose de recettes de chez nous. Il va sans dire que nous mettons un point d'honneur à utiliser les produits du terroir gaspésien. À la Galerie d' art - boutique, ce sont les œuvres de plus de 100 artistes et artisans gaspésiens de souche ou d'adoption qui y sont présentées. Chaque jour, des ateliers de création sont offerts permettant aux petits comme aux plus grands de se familiariser avec une technique créatrice dans une atmosphère ludique invitant aux échanges entre les participants, peu importe leur lieu d'origine. À la Salle de spectacle, des concerts professionnels d'artistes régionaux, nationaux et, parfois même, internationaux se partagent l'affiche. Le Café-Bistro offre aussi gracieusement à sa clientèle des spectacles de la relève. D'une part, cette activité permet aux jeunes artistes de présenter leurs compositions devant public et, d'autre part, elle permet au public de découvrir des talents à suivre de près. See Moretique. Le Barrage - Brasseurs est LA brasserie artisanale de Longueuil. On y sert des bières maison et d'ailleurs dans une ambiance décontractée.
public transit: Autobus 8, 88 ou 28, ou par la gare de train de Saint-Hubert
column44: Le Barrage - Brasseurs  Établi en 2017, Le Barrage, c'est le rêve commun de trois partenaires d'affaires, associés depuis 2014 et qui sont fiers d'annoncer aujo...urd'hui d'avoir ouvert la première brasserie artisanale spécifiquement longueuilloise à percer le marché de la rive-sud de Montréal.  Situé au sein du Marché Public de Longueuil (4200 de la Savane, Longueuil), Le Barrage est un brouepub pouvant présentement acceuillir 60 personnes assises.  Pourquoi un Barrage?  Un barrage est typiquement un endroit où a lieu la transformation de l’eau en énergie. L’eau étant le principal ingrédient de la production de la bière, il va de soi pour nous de chercher à refléter ceci sur notre identité en tant que brasseurs.   Ainsi : Entre l’eau et la bière... Le Barrage!  Et ce Barrage, quelle eau transforme-t'il?  Le fleuve St-Laurent est un symbole puissant. Depuis plus de 400 ans, ce grand cours d’eau a été le vecteur principal de l’exploration et du développement de notre coin de pays. C'est le Saint-Laurent qui est la source d'eau potable de Longueuil. Ce fleuve est le théâtre de notre commerce, de nos déplacements et de nos loisirs. Il transporte et abreuve. Il fait partie intégrante de notre folklore. C’est donc par la transformation en bière de ses eaux que le vénérable St-Laurent nous transforme à son tour, et nous transporte. See Moreurd'hui d'avoir ouvert la première brasserie artisanale spécifiquement longueuilloise à percer le marché de la rive-sud de Montréal. Act Name: Le Centre culturel francophone de Vancouver
Page Types: Arts & Entertainment | Cultural Center | Performance Art
about: Le Centre présente des manifestations et des spectacles de qualité professionnelle, offrant à la population du Grand Vancouver une accessibilité aux produits artistiques de langue ou de la culture francophone dans le secteur des arts.
column44: Incorporé en 1975, Le Centre culturel francophone de Vancouver a pour mandat, tel que le stipulent les objets faisant partie de ses statuts et règlements: de fa...ire partager et de faire rayonner la culture francophone à Vancouver en présentant des spectacles en langue française et des expositions d’artistes francophones et francophiles, ainsi que des services et des programmes éducatifs en langue française ;de promouvoir la participation de l’ensemble de la population aux activités du Centre ;d’acquérir et d’administrer les biens immobiliers nécessaires aux activités du Centre. Ainsi, Le Centre présente des manifestations et des spectacles de qualité professionnelle, offrant à la population de Vancouver une accessibilité aux produits artistiques de langue ou de la culture francophone dans les secteurs des arts visuels, des arts médiatiques et des arts de la scène. En plus, Le Centre offre une panoplie de services éducatifs à toute personne qui s’intéresse aux activités du Centre, qu’elle parle français ou non.  Tout service, programme ou activité du Centre doit appuyer directement ou indirectement les buts du Centre soit par son contenu, soit par son mode de diffusion. about: MISSION Rassembleur de culture francophone, le Centre culturel Les trois p’tits points contribue au rayonnement et à la vitalité de sa communauté en offrant une programmation artistique annuelle.
mission: Le rôle du Centre consiste à raffermir le sentiment de fierté et d’appartenance à la communauté francophone par la valorisation de la culture sous toutes ses fo...rmes en proposant à sa clientèle diverses activités culturelles, sociales et artistiques en français.  Pour faciliter l’accomplissement de sa mission, le Centre privilégie les partenariats avec les acteurs de sa région. about: Casual neighbourhood eclectic restaurant since 2006
column44: Leslie Jones says... Enjoy our Winter Special! Wednesdays to Saturdays from 5:00pm to 6:00pm, all pizzas are $7 with the purchase of a beverage! ... Leslie Jones is a Leslieville hotspot where you find quality food in a cozy atmosphere. Chef George Wensley welcomes you into his home away from home where you will find an ever changing menu of the best local fare and his favourite vinyl spinning on the hi-fi. This is the type of place that quickly finds a spot on your list of favourite restaurants due in no small part to the wonderful staff, reasonably priced menu and why NOW magazine named them one of the top 10 restaurants in 2006.  A focus on using the best locally sourced ingredients results in raves for dishes such as the Jerk Pulled Pork with Fresh Mango Salsa and Chili mayo, Roasted Duck with Fennel in a Fresh Herb pastry and a taste of yesterday with a traditional Carrot Cake.  The charm of the neighbourhood's many artists and vintage shops is carried on at Leslie Jones. A rotating gallery of artists decorate the walls of the small space showing off the talent of our home-grown artists. The lush patio out back is a welcome get-away from the hustle and bustle of Queen St and a lovely spot to enjoy a beautiful Toronto summer night. Sa salle et sa terrasse sont idéales pour des soupers entre amis, des mariages, des dîners d'affaires... le tout servi par un personnel chaleureux.   Son menu innovant s'enracine dans le Québec. Ses menus du jour traversent les cultures et les continents pour offrir des repas diversifiés et de qualité. Chaque appétit trouvera de quoi se satisfaire. Au Zaricot, la musique a toujours prévalue. Blues, rock, folk, trad, musique émergente, électro, rap, etc.
general information: Billets en vente au http://www.lezaricot.com/
public transit: http://www.citvr.ca
column44: Mai 2003. Le Zaricot ouvre ses portes pour la première fois, dans l’incompréhension générale. Qu’est-ce que ce nouveau venu dans les rues de Saint-Hyacinthe? Qu...i en est le mystérieux fondateur? Quel est ce décor atypique rappelant le Far Ouest? Mais surtout, qu’est-ce que ce nom, le Z-a-r-i-c-o-t?  En fait, le «zarico» est un genre musical francophone dérivé de la musique acadienne apparu en Lousiane au début du 19e siècle. Le terme «zarico» vient donc de la perception anglo-saxonne d’une chanson, et d’une expression, populaire acadienne : «Les haricots sont pas salés» qui servait à imager leur pauvreté.  La vocation, le décor, et désormais le logo, découle de cette anecdote.  C’est donc fort de cette culture musicale populaire que le Zaricot prend forme, avec un «t» en plus. Se déclarant café-acoustique au départ, il devient très vite une scène convoitée où la musique prend toute la place, que les fils soient branchés à des amplis ou pas.  Puis, au fil des années, sa scène s’agrandit, tout comme sa réputation et aujourd’hui, 10 ans plus tard, c’est un incontournable dans le paysage musical québécois. See Morei en est le mystérieux fondateur? Quel est ce décor atypique rappelant le Far Ouest? Mais surtout, qu’est-ce que ce nom, le Z-a-r-i-c-o-t? column44: For an interactive tour please visit:  https://goo.gl/maps/oExcSNFZ9dD2 ... More Pictures at: http://www.liveonelgin.com/pages/pictures  LIVE! on Elgin is an all ages/licensed venue.  For booking and general inquires, please contact jon@liveonelgin.com  For theatre bookings and rental inquires, please contact lawrence@liveonelgin.com   LIVE! on Elgin is the culmination of two years of discussions, debates, questionnaires, and polls all focused on the future of live theatre and music in Ottawa. A simple discussion about types of venues in use elsewhere led us to believe that there was something missing in the Ottawa market and we set out to create a venue that would fill that gap. Combining Lawrence’s experience in theatre and business with Jon’s experience and connections in the local music scene, and the passion that both of us share for local talent we think we have created the perfect space for you, audiences and performers alike.   A space that can be used by musicians, actors, and performers of all kinds. A place where people can gather for a night of entertainment without breaking the bank. A place to focus on and promote local talent, where local artists can hone their craft and earn a few bucks without having to leave town. A place where small theatre companies can mount productions without risk of losing their shirts. A place for local filmmakers to screen their projects.  A place for local artists of all stripes to call home. We hope to present to you the best that our city has to offer in live entertainment and invite you to enjoy, to celebrate, and to be proud of our local talent.  https://www.facebook.com/liveonelgin  https://twitter.com/liveonelgin  http://instagram.com/liveonelgin See More More Pictures at: http://www.liveonelgin.com/pages/pictures  LIVE! on Elgin is an all ages/licensed venue. about: The best place in Cornwall Ontario for inexpensive home cooked meals, ice cold beer and amazing live entertainment. Not to mention the patio!!!
culinary team: Sharon Farley Dan Martineau Tim McLean
column44: September 18, 1997, was an important day in the lives of Sharon Farley and her mother Olive (now deceased). That's the day Lola's... Pub and Grub - located at 616 Pitt St. - opened for business. The transformation from dry cleaner to bar and restaurant was completed in record time thanks to the help of many close friends. 18 year s later, Lola's has become a staple in the lives of many, and a prime destination for those wanting a quick, inexpensive home-cooked meal, an ice cold beer, a heart-to-heart chat or to hear some of the best live music this town has to offer. Lola's restaurant (the Grub part) is open from noon to 9:00 pm Monday to Saturday, with either owner Sharon Farley, Dan Martineau or Tim McLean behind the scenes doing all the cooking. Everything coming out of that kitchen is homemade and absolutely delicious. Customer favourites include Perch Rolls - served ever y Friday $6.99 for one, $11.99 for two with a side of your choice. (Incidentally, you will NOT find a better price in town!) Another excellent choice is the Meatloaf ? stuffed with cheese curds, fried onions & bacon, covered in a delicious gravy and served with mash or fries and your choice of veg. Sharon's soups are famous and loved by all. Again, always made from scratch, and trust me one bowl is a meal in itself! There is also the popular Wrap Burger : all the fixin's wrapped in a large tortilla shell and finished on the grill. Or, if you're feeling up to a challenge, go after the Lola Burger ? there are not many who can get through this beast! Pop in any Wednesday for Wings. Star ting at 4:00 pm, $8.99 gets you a pound of wings, however you like 'em, and a large draft (Bud or Keith's Red). Like a cold drink, but on a budget? Cheap day is ever y Tuesday where your beer and bar rail are both one dollar off all day long!  Last but not least, Lola's has become a hot spot for live entertainment. Most Saturday nights, and occasionally on Friday? you can stop by Lola's and hear a wide variety of musical genres from bands that travel from as far away as Halifax NS and Vancouver BC, to the best local talent Cornwall has to offer. Past performers include The Paul Deslauriers Band (fact: the first time Paul played Cornwall in 20 year's was at Lola's!), The JD Edwards Band, The Graham Greer Trio, Union Duke, The Standstills, Trench Town Oddities, Winston Mar ley, Gypsy, The Rod Squad, The Red Rails, The Marc Muir Trio and many, many more. If you haven't been to Lola's lately ? or ever ? you don't know what you are missing. Open 11:00 am - 2:00 am seven days a week, 365 days a year (Christmas Day and New Years Day we open at 7pm, because hey, everyone needs a little down time). Make Lola's your next stop for lunch and say hello to Linda while you are at it. THIS AIN'T NO DISCO!! See More Pub and Grub - located at 616 Pitt St. - opened for business. column44: Built in 1888 as The Albert Hotel, it was one of the grand hotels built in Brunswick during the land boom of the 1880’s. The early patrons were mostly workers f...rom the Butler’s Brickyard up on Albion Street and the hotel continues to be the workers pub. Renamed The Lomond Hotel in the 1930’s, it has been run by The Neagle Family for over 30 years. They’ve brought their country heart to a city pub and it remains one of Melbourne’s last family owned and operated hotels. about: Celebrating London's music history! Open Saturdays noon to 5pm, or by appointment.
awards: https://fclma.ca/inductees/
column44: FCLMA LONDON MUSIC HALL OF FAME Home to a famed London jewellery shop for decades, a Dundas Street location in downtown London is now set to showcase the gems o...f London and area music. The London Music Hall Fame honours outstanding London musicians – and accomplishments in our music industry. Each year since 2003, more names have been added as inductees. Inductions to the Hall of Fame are overseen by the FCLMA Board of Directors & FCLMA HOF steering committee and celebrated at the JRLMA's annual gala.  The Hall of Fame has its gala opening on Nov. 12, 2016, in the Manuel family's London Music Hall complex. The FCLMA steering committee continues to oversee the Hall's progress as it becomes a Forest City destination in the former Nash Jewellers downtown site.  The committee is grateful to Mike & Vicki Manuel and the Manuel family for providing a home and support!   We are also grateful to Museum London, the London Public Library's Ivey Family London Room and Western's McIntosh Gallery for loaning the Hall material and providing expertise in the opening months.  More Hall of Fame details may found at www.fclma.ca  The FCLMA works to recognize the annual achievements of London and surrounding area musicians. Promote and preserve the history of London and surrounding area music & musicians. Promote music education and provide support for musicians in London and surrounding area. Produce annual awards celebrations & FCLMA London Music Week See Moref London and area music. about: A Parisian style wine bar making spectacular wine approachable. Relaxed atmosphere to enjoy wine, local cured meats and cheeses.
column44: As a traditional Parisian wine bar, we strive to make quality wine approachable while creating a relaxed and hospitable atmosphere for our guests. A perfect pla...ce to unwind with friends, celebrate life’s milestones, or simply enjoy a glass after a long day of work. All of our wines are carefully selected by our Sommelier to maintain variety and to ensure that we serve only the highest quality products from around the world. We want our guests to enjoy exceptional wines that are often little known but always produced with the love and passion that has been passed down through generations of winemaking.  To accompany our wines, we offer a wide range of cured meats including prosciutto, smoked sausages, and various smoked salamis as well as a diverse selection of only the best cheeses from local producers who are dedicated to their craft. All of our charcuterie boards are served with fresh fruit, pickled items, fresh bread, and locally made jams. For dessert, we offer a variety of chocolate products that were created exclusively for us by the best chocolatier in London!  Join us for a glass at 420 Talbot Street! Act Name: Jeanne & Peter Lougheed Performing Arts Centre
about: The home to performing arts in Camrose, we showcase world-class artists for our citizens while also providing leadership and expertise to local events, all of which contribute to the cultural fabric of our community. "See it live. Camrose Live."
column44: Built within a collaborative framework  Jeanne & Peter Lougheed Performing Arts Centre is a unique performing arts venue located on the beautiful, historic Univ...ersity of Alberta’s’ Augustana Campus in the heart of the province.  The facility was built through the collaborative efforts of the City of Camrose and the University of Alberta. It was conceived of as a performance space to celebrate our cultural achievements and provide access to the performing arts for the community.  Built with the community in mind.  The overall design for the building included a great deal of attention not only to what the community was envisioning for the space but also towards sustainability for the future. The theatre is home to the largest integrated photovoltaic array,(solar panels), which blanket the entire 70’fly-tower, including the North face, and is the first theatre in North America to use entirely LED lighting, including the stage lights, on the interior and exterior of the building. For details about other green features of the building, click here.  Built to accommodate performances and events; big or small  The Cargill Theatre seats 580 on two sloped floors, yet retains an intimacy which will provide audiences with a closer connection to the artist and provide the artist an opportunity to connect on a deeper level with the audience. The sound, lighting and projection systems are state of the art and will provide every visitor, in every seat a memorable live performance experience  The Mayer Family Community Hall provides alternative space for many different kinds of events. The hall, which also boasts a sprung floor, can be configured to accommodate between 135 and 200 people seated, either at tables or theatre style. It can be used for smaller scale performances, receptions, conferences, or rehearsals. This is a space which can be rented and configured to suit any need!  Built for the future  The theatre is a proud declaration of who the city is today and who they want to be moving into the future. column44: L'Ouvre-Boîte est un outil pour ouvrir des boîtes... Et aussi un OBNL à vocation culturelle !  Une quinzaine de membres fondateurs ont travaillé avec enthousias...me et détermination à la naissance de cet OUVRE-BOÎTE pas comme les autres.  Notre mission est celle-ci : offrir un espace culturel alternatif de diffusion de la Côte-Nord. L’OUVRE-BOÎTE Culturel vise à promouvoir les arts et la culture, soutenir les initiatives d’artistes locaux, favoriser l’émergence de nouveaux talents dans la population Manicoise et participer au rayonnement culturel de la région.  Notre vision : Être un incubateur d’alternatives inspirant à la créativité et favorisant la prise en charge du développement culturel régional par le milieu, les individus et les jeunes en particulier.  Nos publics :  - Les jeunes du secondaire et du Cégep - Les jeunes partis aux études et de retour en région - Les artistes et consommateurs de produits culturels - La population de la MRC Manicouagan - Les organisations à vocation culturelle et artistique - Les partenaires  Nos valeurs :  - L’engagement collectif envers la prise en charge du développement culturel régional - La solidarité - L’ouverture d’esprit - La liberté d’expression - Le développement durable et la consommation responsable - La compréhension interculturelle  Par nos activités de diffusion, nous visons l’atteinte des objectifs suivants :  1. Améliorer la qualité de vie, des jeunes en particulier, de manière responsable et durable, en travaillant en partenariatavec les entités déjà existantes et les entrepreneurs de la région. 2. Favoriser le retour des jeunes dans la région, et le maintien de ceux qui y sont établis. 3. Contribuer au rayonnement de la région par son dynamisme culturel et la promotion de ses artistes. 4. Accompagner les artistes dans leurs démarches de professionnalisation.  Voici quelques exemples d'activités : - performances multimédias, - vernissages d’exposition photo, peinture, sculpture, - projections de courts métrages amateurs, - projections de longs métrages difficilement accessibles, - spectacles de musique, théâtre, danse, chant. - lancements de projets,  Enfin, nous tenons à spécifier que nos intentions et notre mission sont claires : travailler en partenariat avec les organismes et entreprises œuvrant déjà à l’épanouissement de la culture dans la région, pour diversifier l’offre et conquérir de nouveaux publics.  Si vous avez envie de participer, contactez nous ici ou au louvreboiteculturel@gmail.com See Moreme et détermination à la naissance de cet OUVRE-BOÎTE pas comme les autres. about: Maelstrom Winery is a small boutique winery, which provides high quality wine from grapes grown in Huron County. A beautiful place to enjoy fantastic views of the vineyard while sampling our selection of unique and flavourful wines.
column44: Maelstrom winery began in 2009 when the Landsborough family planted a test plot of vines to see if they would survive Huron County’s cold climate. To their deli...ght the vines not only survived but thrived and so in 2010 they planted 2 more acres of vines. The vineyard now has over 8 acres of grape vines - Vitis vinifera and hybrid varietals. The winery is nestled in the crook of land between the south Maitland river and the Bayfield river. This inner region of the County boasts a very diverse topography with hills and valleys that rise and fall and which drain water and cooler damaging temperatures down to their river bed. To the north of Maelstrom is the Hullett Provincial Wildlife area - a 2200 hectare terrain of open water, marsh and swamp which creates an exceptionally bio-diverse ecosystem. These 2 water systems and the accompanying vast ecosystem provide for a very healthy and vibrant terroir. The vineyard itself was chosen because of its good natural drainage and combination of sandy and clay loam soils - ideally suited to growing premium quality grapes and producing structured red wines like Marquette, Baco Noir and Cabernet Franc. The white wines produced at Maelstrom also demonstrate a unique expression of terroir - both Chardonnay and Frontenac Blanc exhibit more acidity which has proven to produce more tropical fruit flavours and more enhanced aroma than in less cold areas. The region is proving to be very good for both red and white wines. See Moreght the vines not only survived but thrived and so in 2010 they planted 2 more acres of vines. The vineyard now has over 8 acres of grape vines - Vitis vinifera and hybrid varietals. The winery is nestled in the crook of land between the south Maitland river and the Bayfield river. This inner region of the County boasts a very diverse topography with hills and valleys that rise and fall and which drain water and cooler damaging temperatures down to their river bed. To the north of Maelstrom is the Hullett Provincial Wildlife area - a 2200 hectare terrain of open water, marsh and swamp which creates an exceptionally bio-diverse ecosystem. These 2 water systems and the accompanying vast ecosystem provide for a very healthy and vibrant terroir. The vineyard itself was chosen because of its good natural drainage and combination of sandy and clay loam soils - ideally suited to growing premium quality grapes and producing structured red wines like Marquette, Baco Noir and Cabernet Franc. The white wines produced at Maelstrom also demonstrate a unique expression of terroir - both Chardonnay and Frontenac Blanc exhibit more acidity which has proven to produce more tropical fruit flavours and more enhanced aroma than in less cold areas. The region is proving to be very good for both red and white wines.

about: Maguires
column44: ".....Where people meet and friends are made....."   MAGUIRES - Irish Pub is located right in the heart of Brampton at the intersection of Queen Street and Hans...en Road - just east of Kennedy Road. MAGUIRES was opened in October 2005.  We pride ourselves in providing our customers - young and old with excellent service and a fun AND friendly atmosphere!   We host a variety of special occasions and functions including, birthday parties, stags, staggettes, wedding and baby showers, weddings, golf tournaments, bus trips and sporting events are just to mention a few.   The atmosphere at MAGUIRES is fun and friendly. A place to enjoy the company of friends new or old, or to meet new acquaintances. Weekends are lively day or night. Enjoy the buzz after work at the bar, a friendly game of darts with friends, a refreshing cocktail after a tough day out on the golf course, or possibly just relax and chill out on our amazing patio. Whatever your pleasure may be- we have something to offer you. I would like to mention the welcome addition of our JUKEBOX. The jukebox has made any given night or day a MAGUIRES a personal and individual one - a huge success with capability of acquiring over 20,000 songs.   Service......Where do we start? Our staff is awesome. They will tend to your every need in order to ensure your experience at MAGUIRES is a memorable one.  I am fortunate to say that most of our staff has been with us right from the beginning and they have truly been a huge influence in the success of the pub today.  We are sure you will enjoy your first experience at MAGUIRES and we look forward to having you back for many more!   DRAUGHT MENU:  MAGUIRES is proud to pour the BEST Guinness in town. We know because we are told by those that drink it with experience, so come in and have a pint.   We also serve a variety of Molson products on tap such as Canadian, Coors Light, Rickard's Red, MGD, Newcastle Brown and Creamore springs.  Also served on tap is Stella Artois and Alexander Keith's all Labatt products   Also available $8.00 mini jugs   BOTTLED BEER:  MAGUIRES serves a variety of domestic and imported bottled beer such as Canadian, Coors Light, Miller Genuine Draft,Miller Chill, Budweiser,Bud Light, Blue,Labatt 50,Black Label and Corona, not to mention Non-Alcoholic beer.   TALL CANS:  Canadian ,Coors Ligh, Grolsch,Heinken, Killkenny, Boddingtons, Rolling Rock,Magners and Strongbow Cider   MONDAY TO FRIDAY SPECIAL  $4.50 ALL PINTS,BAR RAIL.WINE, BOTTLES AND CANS    OTHER SPECIALS @ MAGUIRES:  Mondays:$14.00 Domestic Jugs   Tuesdays: Domestic Bottles$3.75 and Import Cans $5.00  Wednesday: $4.00 Shooters- $5.00 Shots  Thursday : $ 5.00 Guinness  Friday $5.00 wine and coolers  Saturday: $4.00 domestic tall cans   2-4-1 apps during all leaf games!!!! general information: Implantée au rez-de-chaussée du centre Jean-Marie-Gauvreau (911, rue Jean-Talon Est), la maison de la culture rassemble sous un même toit une salle de spectacle... de qualité professionnelle de 260 places, une salle de médiation culturelle, une spacieuse salle d’exposition et un grand foyer pour l’accueil des citoyens. La mémoire de Claude Léveillée y est également immortalisée dans un espace hommage relatant l’oeuvre de ce grand artiste de la chanson québécoise, natif de Villeray. about: Depuis son inauguration en 1967, la Maison des arts Desjardins Drummondville a pour mission le développement culturel local et régional, dans les domaines des arts de la scène et des arts visuels.
column44: HEURES D'OUVERTURE EN TEMPS DE COVID  La billetterie est ouverte EN TÉLÉTRAVAIL, du lundi au vendredi, de 10h à 17h. Fermée les week-ends. ...  SVP ne vous présentez pas à la billetterie, la Maison des arts est fermée pendant la période de pause demandée par les gouvernements.   Nous reviendrons à nos heures d'ouverture habituelles lorsque nous aurons obtenu le feu vert de la santé publique. Merci de votre compréhension.   Heures d'ouverture complète de la billetterie:  Lundi au samedi de 11h30 à 17h30  Les soirs de spectacle jusqu’à 21h  Fermée le dimanche sauf exceptions : -          de 11h30 à 16h : lors de spectacles l’après-midi ou lors de préventes -          2 heures avant le spectacle lors des représentations en soirée   La Maison des arts Desjardins Drummondville, un espace ouvert sur son monde  Voici enfin cette toute nouvelle Maison des arts Desjardins Drummondville dont vous rêviez depuis si longtemps!   Depuis 1996 que vous en rêviez, de cette nouvelle Maison de la culture. La voici enfin! De l’édifice érigé en 1966, on n’a gardé que la coquille de la scène et de la salle principale; le reste, vous le voyez grandir au cœur de la ville depuis l’an 2010.  Réalisée grâce à des investissements de quelque 22 millions de dollars, ce lieu aura exigé la présence d’une centaine de travailleurs sur le chantier, des scénographes, des urbanistes, des paysagistes, des architectes… Aujourd’hui cette Maison des arts est également une réalité grâce au travail acharné d’une équipe administrative qui a mis les bouchées doubles pour vous offrir une saison de spectacles 2010-2011, au cœur d’un lieu temporaire spécialement aménagé dans l’ancienne l’Église Saint-Jean-Baptiste, tout ça en collaborant au projet majeur de rénovation!  Voici ce lieu moderne, épuré, ouvert sur sa communauté fin prêt à vous accueillir.  La magie opère dès votre arrivée Dès votre arrivée à la Maison des arts Desjardins Drummondville, vous serez accueillis  par une monumentale sculpture signée Pierre Tessier. Intitulée Momentum, cette œuvre s’illuminera pour vous inviter à entrer dans l'édifice.  Vos premiers pas dans la Maison des arts Desjardins se feront dans ’Espace Soprema, le foyer principal de la salle. Vous pourrez y boire un verre durant les entractes, rencontrer les artistes lors d’événements organisés à cette fin, et même vous exprimer via quatre bornes interactives faciles d’accès.  Que le spectacle commence! Dans sa grande salle multifonctionnelle, la Salle Léo-Paul Therrien, vivez des moments magiques en compagnie de vos artistes favoris ou découvrez des artistes émergents au Studio Assuraction Pepin assurance.   Prendre l'air sur la nouvelle terrasse Ouverte sur le foyer du balcon, la Terrasse Soprema est un espace vert sur le toit. Vous y verrez des végétaux, des œuvres d’art et un impressionnant mur d’eau, le tout dans un éclairage enveloppant. Seul diffuseur au Québec à posséder une telle terrasse, la Maison des arts Desjardins Drummondville vous y accueillera trois saisons par année, que ce soit dans son espace bistro ou dans son coin lounge.  Amateur d’art visuel? La toute nouvelle Galerie d’art Desjardins accueillera des expositions d’envergure et poursuivra ses activités d’animation.  La Maison du rayonnement culturel Dans le Studio Assuraction Pepin assurance, tout comme dans les six locaux multifonctionnels de la Maison des arts Desjardins Drummondville, les organismes culturels ont un lieu d’exception pour poursuivre leur mission. Dans ces locaux insonorisés, les organismes peuvent offrir simultanément cours, ateliers, pratiques et spectacles, tout ça en plus de bénéficier d’un espace de choix pour leur locaux administratifs.   La Maison des arts Desjardins Drummondville est un projet collectif, cohérent, en harmonie avec son milieu, votre milieu. Nous vous y attendons et nous vous souhaitons la bienvenue chez vous, à la Maison. See More  SVP ne vous présentez pas à la billetterie, la Maison des arts est fermée pendant la période de pause demandée par les gouvernements. Act Name: La Maison de la Culture de Waterloo
Page Types: Live Music Venue | Event Planner | Nonprofit Organization
Address: 441 rue de la Cour Waterloo, Quebec
about: La plus grandiose des petites salles ! Lieu de diffusion et monument historique, la destination par excellence pour vos sorties en région !  450-539-4764
impressum: Conformément aux directives émises par le gouvernement du Québec, la Maison de la culture de Waterloo se voit dans l’obligation de cesser temporairement l’ensem...ble de ses activités jusqu’au 12 avril inclusivement.  Les spectacles de notre programmation affectés par cette mesure seront reportés. Nous travaillons présentement en étroite collaboration avec les agences et les producteurs afin de trouver les meilleures options. Les dates de report vous seront communiquées dès que possible. Nous demandons aux détenteurs de billets de bien les conserver, ceux-ci seront honorés lors de la nouvelle représentation. Advenant l’impossibilité de vous présenter à cette nouvelle date, notre politique prévois une période de remboursement. Toutefois, aucun remboursement ne sera autorisé avant l’annonce de la date de report du spectacle en question.  Ces mesures affectent également toutes activités en lien avec notre service de location de salle. Notre équipe prendra contact directement avec les clients concernés au cours des prochains jours afin d’évaluer les différentes options possibles. Merci de votre patience, nous faisons tout ce qui est en notre pouvoir pour communiquer avec vous dans les meilleurs délais.  Nous vous invitons à rester à l’affût de nos communications sur nos différentes plateformes. Notamment sur notre page Facebook, notre site www.mcwaterloo.com et notre infolettre.  Pour terminer, une pensée toute spéciale pour tous nos collègues de l’industrie, les artistes, les agents, les producteurs, les techniciens, les employés de salle de spectacles mais également à tous nos concitoyens qui sont durement affectés par cette situation sans précédent.  Voici la liste des événements ouverts au public affectés par cette annonce : ||18 et 19 mars : Les Labos de l’École nationale de la chanson / ANNULÉ ; ||21 mars : Michel Robichaud (1ère partie : Marc-André Marois) / REPORTÉ, date à venir ; ||22 mars : V See Moreble de ses activités jusqu’au 12 avril inclusivement. mission: La mission de La Maison de la culture de Waterloo est de promouvoir les arts de la scène et les arts visuels en créant une ouverture à toutes formes de connaiss...ances et d'expériences culturelles.  De par sa mission et son implication sociale dans la communauté, la Maison de la culture de Waterloo donne l'opportunité à plusieurs personnes de tous les horizons sociaux et économiques d'assister à des spectacles et des événements.  De plus, par ses bénévoles et ses divers partenariats, la Maison de la culture de Waterloo crée un tissu d'appartenance au milieu et fait participer les divers intervenants dans les processus de création et d'organisation. company overview: Avec une programmation à la fois riche et audacieuse, la Maison de la Culture de Waterloo est sans contredit un des lieux incontournables en région. column44: Il existe, dans le Centre-Ville de Gatineau (Secteur Hull), un endroit ou se trouve de la bonne musique, une belle foule et une ambiance envoutante!  Mardis Gra...s offre à ses invités le choix de 3 atmosphères différents sous un même toit. Le Pub Bayou, un endroit plus intime et décontracté, offre une grande sélection de bières en fût et ouvre ses portes en début d'après-midi. Le Lounge Voodoo offre à ses invités une expérience unique et inégalée et peut aussi servir de salle VIP ou Lounge  pour vos événements privés. Mardi Gras, le coeur de l'endroit, convient à tous! Peu importe le style de soirée ou divertissement que vous recherchez, soyez assurés que vous trouverez l'atmosphère parfait pour vous et vos amis au Mardi Gras!  Located in downtown Gatineau (Hull sector) is a spot where great music, beautiful people and an amazing vibe can always be enjoyed.   Mardi Gras offers guests the choice between 3 different venues under one roof.  The Bayou Pub can be described as an intimate, casual pub atmosphere with a fine selection of beers on tap opening early in the afternoon. The Voodoo Lounge offers guests a unique experience and an unparalleled view of the club doubling as a VIP/Private Lounge for rent.  MardiGras the heart of the Venue caters to all guests from all over.  From live bands, to live DJs, there is something for everyone.    No matter what sort of party experience you're looking for, you're sure to find something perfect for you and your friends inside MARDI GRAS. about: For six decades Mariposa has been presenting world class creators and performers of folk, roots, blues, gospel, acoustic and world music traditions in a beautiful, family-friendly setting.

products: ABOUT THE MARIPOSA LOGO  The Mariposa logo isn't just any logo. It was designed, then later resdesigned, by two of Canada's best known folk icons. The original ...design was done by Ian Tyson who headlined the first Mariposa Folk Festival in 1961 as a duo with Sylvia Fricker, who later became his wife.  Later, a young musician by the name of Murray McLauchlan started hanging around the festival and updated the logo to the current version that remains in use today. Just like the festival, Mariposa's logo is by, of and for the musicians. See Moredesign was done by Ian Tyson who headlined the first Mariposa Folk Festival in 1961 as a duo with Sylvia Fricker, who later became his wife.  Later, a young musician by the name of Murray McLauchlan started hanging around the festival and updated the logo to the current version that remains in use today. general information: History:   In 1997, local residents Hal Hill and his wife Chris came up with the idea of holding a jazz festival in Markham.  Hal is a well-known jazz authority..., broadcaster, concert producer and the author of Jazz Canadiana. about: We are a not for profit charitable organization which operates the Market Hall as a busy, vital cultural centre in Peterborough Ontario.
general information: Market Hall has an accessible theatre space in the heart of downtown Peterborough. With 226 fixed seats, room to add tables or rows of chairs, and a stage exten...sion, we can customize the space to accommodate your event and patrons. Since the 2010 renovation the Hall offers a larger lobby, new elevator, bar lounge, theatre lighting, great sound system, large screen and projectors, portable wings, moving curtain, dressing rooms, green room and catering kitchen.  The Hall has hosted symphonies, modern dance, theatre, concerts, conferences, wedding receptions, buffet dinners, meetings,  panels, drama camps, dances, rehearsals, auctions and wine tastings.  In-house technicians, box office and front of house are included in your rental. Lighting and sound designers, stage managers and other specialized staff can be made available in-house for a fee. Act Name: Mark Zelinski Photographic Design and From The Heart Publishing
about: Governor Generals Medal-winning photographer Mark Zelinski gifted 8,000 photo books (forewords by HRH Philip, J. Trudeau) to global children's charities.
impressum: impressum?
mission: To create photography and books that contribute to healing, harmony, understanding and peace.
products: Commercial Photography, Event Photography, Travel Photography, Wedding Photography, Photography Book Publishing, Video Production, Documentary Films, International Photo Tours
awards: Governor General's Medal Pentax of Canada Award Canada Trust Scholarship
column44: www.MarkZelinski.com Trained as an artist and a designer at OCAD, Mark Zelinski has enjoyed a diverse career as a professional photographer since 1977, and is a...lso a publisher, writer, painter, filmmaker and winner of the Canadian Governor General’s Medal. Mark has published seven internationally acclaimed photography books, which include forewords by Prince Philip, Prince Andrew, King Constantine, The Honourable Lincoln Alexander and Justin Trudeau. In 2010 Zelinski launched “Books That Heal” - donating 7,000 copies of his books to 100 charities worldwide to aid rescued victims of human trafficking, child abuse prevention, homeless youth, addiction counselling, crime prevention and literacy.  Zelinski’s lifelong appreciation of the magnificent Niagara Escarpment has inspired Zelinski to create “Heart Of Turtle Island: The Great Escarpment”, a hardcover book of landscape, wildlife and cultural photography from Niagara Falls to Manitoulin Island. Through Mark’s images, and through the personal accounts of conservationists, scientists, and residents of the diverse aboriginal and settler communities that thrive along its rugged, curving path, readers will have the opportunity experience a multi-layered perspective of the living escarpment.  Scheduled for release in 2016, “Heart Of Turtle Island: The Great Escarpment” will address compelling social and environmental issues and reveal some of the most unique and fragile gems of The Escarpment.  For advance orders of “Heart Of Turtle Island: The Great Escarpment” see http://www.markzelinski.com/books.html See Morelso a publisher, writer, painter, filmmaker and winner of the Canadian Governor General’s Medal. about: The Marquee Ballroom is known as one of the premier venues on Canada's east coast--large capacity, excellent sight lines and a nice house PA!
column44: The Marquee Ballroom-- Booking Info!  The Marquee is a 700+ person room.... If you're interested in playing The Marquee please send us your info.  CONTACT: Jeff Pineau jeff@theseahorsetavern.ca  The Marquee Ballroom is available as a rental facility for a wide variety of purposes such as private functions, fundraisers, theatre, fashion shows, concerts, film shoots, and more.  ABOUT THE MARQUEE BALLROOM The Marquee is located at 2037 Gottingen St in beautiful Halifax, Nova Scotia.  In the spring of 2013, the venue opened as The Marquee Ballroom. Our goal is to showcase quality National, International, and East Coast music and to be a facility available for use by the arts community as well as local promoters, non-profit organizations, and private groups.   Some of the acts that played the Marquee over the years include Daniel Lanois, Billy Bragg, Guided By Voices, Jim Cuddy, Arcade Fire, The Tom Tom Club, Bloc Party, Ron Sexsmith and many others. The club also aided the careers of such local acts as Joel Plaskett, The Trews, Matt Mays and Wintersleep, to name just a few. The Marquee Club closed in 2009 and for several years the Paragon Theatre occupied the Gottingen Street space, continuing to provide Halifax with high-quality shows.  https://twitter.com/Marqueeballroom *The Marquee Ballroom is a "licensed" establishment --19+(ID Required) See More If you're interested in playing The Marquee please send us your info.  CONTACT: Jeff Pineau jeff@theseahorsetavern.ca  The Marquee Ballroom is available as a rental facility for a wide variety of purposes such as private functions, fundraisers, theatre, fashion shows, concerts, film shoots, and more.  ABOUT THE MARQUEE BALLROOM The Marquee is located at 2037 Gottingen St in beautiful Halifax, Nova Scotia.  In the spring of 2013, the venue opened as The Marquee Ballroom. Our goal is to showcase quality National, International, and East Coast music and to be a facility available for use by the arts community as well as local promoters, non-profit organizations, and private groups.   Some of the acts that played the Marquee over the years include Daniel Lanois, Billy Bragg, Guided By Voices, Jim Cuddy, Arcade Fire, The Tom Tom Club, Bloc Party, Ron Sexsmith and many others. The club also aided the careers of such local acts as Joel Plaskett, The Trews, Matt Mays and Wintersleep, to name just a few. The Marquee Club closed in 2009 and for several years the Paragon Theatre occupied the Gottingen Street space, continuing to provide Halifax with high-quality shows.  https://twitter.com/Marqueeballroom *The Marquee Ballroom is a "licensed" establishment --19+(ID Required)

column44: Massey Theatre opened in 1949 as British Columbia's largest theatre. Today, Massey Theatre proudly hosts professional orchestras like the Vancouver Symphony, st...ars like singing sensation Jewel, and stunning productions like Hello Dolly! by the Renowned Royal City Musical Theatre. The Massey Theatre boasts production workshops, a full-size stage, an audience chamber of 1260 seats and a visual arts gallery. Governed as a registered non-profit Society by an independent board of directors, Massey Theatre is neither a civic nor a school facility but a free-standing organization which works to support the performing arts throughout the Metro Vancouver Region.   Massey Theatre is a safe space for LBGT+ people and allies where we promote the notions of love, mutual consent, empathy and understanding. Homophobia, transphobia, sexism, any type of bigotry or violent conduct will not be tolerated. Don't hesitate to approach us if anything should alert your concern. company overview: The Max Cameron Theatre, now in its fourth year of operation, is located in Powell River, British Columbia. The facility was built by School District #47 as par...t of an expansion to the local high school that included a digital media center, acoustically-engineered choral room, film and video recording studio, and a dance and drama studio.   ‘The Max’ is a flexible performance facility designed for use in many different configurations by both school and community groups. It has quickly become one of the busiest venues in the community, housing major events for the Powell River Academy of Music, West Coast Jazz and Blues Society,  Far Off Broadway Theatre Company, and Powell River Film Society. As one of four venues for International Choral Kathaumixw in the summer of 2010, the Max Cameron Theatre stage played host to choirs from around the world.  In addition to the many events taking place on stage each year, ‘The Max’ offers many on-screen events as well. The yearly Banff Mountain Film Festival World tour is a guaranteed sell-out and the Cineplex Odeon HDTV live broadcasts from the Metropolitan Opera have gathered large crowds each season. ‘Live at the Met’ on the big screen has made world-class opera accessible to the people of Powell River. about: Le M Bar, c’est toi, moi, le Français de Montpellier, le Chilien fraichement débarqué, ton cousin de Toronto pis le voisin d’en face.
public transit: Station de Métro - Berri-UQAM
column44: Le M Bar, c’est toi, moi, le Français de Montpellier, le Chilien fraichement débarqué, ton cousin de Toronto pis le voisin d’en face.  Le M Bar, c’est le lieu i...déal pour siroter une bière vraiment pas chère pendant le Happy Hour (7 jours sur 7), danser en écoutant un groupe live les vendredis soirs (et bien d’autres soirs), chanter à tue-tête ses refrains préférés les lundis Karaoké (pour un shot gratos), et se bidonner aux soirées humoristiques du dimanche (#lol).  C’est au M Bar que tu trouveras ta bière à 4$ la majorité du temps, d’une table de billard et de babyfoot, en plus d’une bonne ambiance multiculturelle à n’importe quelle heure parce que #décalage.  M Bar: Où local et international ne font qu’un.   _________________________________________  The M Bar is you, and me, and the Irish from Dublin, and the Australian from the other side of the planet, it’s also your cousin from Quebec. It’s your next door neighbor.  The M Bar is the BEST place to drink a really cheap beer during Happy hour (every single day), to dance to our live music every Friday (and many other nights), to sing along to your guiltiest pleasures on Karaoke Mondays (for a free shot - yes), and to laugh out loud to our very laughable Comedy Shows each Sunday (#lol).  At the M Bar, you’ll sip 4$ beers most of the time, you’ll play pool and babyfoot, and you’ll probably enjoy a super pleasant multicultural vibe any hour of the day because #jetlagsarereal.  M Bar: Where travellers and locals unite! about: YOUR PLACE FOR LIVE ENTERTAINMENT IN McBRIDE
general information: The Roundhouse Theatre is located in McBride Secondary School, 1300 Second Avenue, McBride. The Theatre is fully equipped with state of the art light and sound ...equipment that is cooperatively maintained by the school and the society. The stage area is 20 x 40 and provides excellent views for audience members from the tiered house with capacity for 180. The stage is also equipped with a full cyclorama enabling digital scenery and backdrops for concerts and performances. The McBride Secondary School Drama program trains students in set design, lighting and sound to assist in presentations and performances. Although the Roundhouse Theatre Society's main venue is the Theatre, it also has access to a number of other venues for performances including the new McBride Community and Convention Centre with full stage and seating capacity for 350 (dinner seating). about: Welcome to the Premiere Arts & Cultural Centre in Southern Georgian Bay!
general information: Free Parking!  Come visit our Art Gallery (no cost). Hold your next family, corporate or social event at beautiful, historic Meaford Hall.    Phone: 1-877-538-0463 or 519-538-0463 Email:  ticket@meaford.ca
column44: Welcome to the Premiere Arts & Cultural Centre in Southern Georgian Bay.  Beautifully restored and renovated, the Meaford Hall Arts & Cultural Centre doors are ...open in historic downtown Meaford. Meaford Hall is a stone’s throw from Georgian Bay and adjacent to all amenities in an area well-known for its year-round attractions. For over a century, Meaford Hall has echoed with music, drama, and debate, serving as the political, social and cultural heart of Meaford. As a four season venue, Meaford Hall plays host to a wide variety of live entertainment, gallery exhibitions, films, events, meetings and social gatherings both corporate and community driven.  As an integral part of Southern Georgian Bay’s recreational playground, Meaford Hall attracts year-round audiences from Owen Sound, Thornbury, Blue Mountain, Collingwood and surrounding areas, and reaches further afield to include a wide variety of Ontarians and visitors to the province. about: Ottawa's Music Mecca!
column44: A 21st Century Soul Club: The Mercury Lounge has been a Mecca for the arts in Canada's capital city of Ottawa, since its inception in November 1996. Its program...ming purports a musical vision steeped in the traditions  of jazz, nu-jazz, house & live music! Through its dynamic programming,   the Mercury Lounge has successfully connected the dots, uniting jazz with contemporary electronic break beat culture. Within its walls the very philosophy of jazz, that of change, abounds. It serves not only as a club, and live venue, but also for poetry readings, dance performances and art gallery. About our Resident DJ - Saturdays - #lifeboogie Trevor Walker Has been DJing since 1989 providing Ottawa with top notch tunes from Afro, Latin, Jazz, Reggae, Disco, Funk, Soul, Hip Hop, House and Broken Beats. Can be found dropping tunes at Mercury Lounge every Saturday for the past 19 years, the "Tropikalo" monthly at the "Happy Goat" as well as numerous guest spots in and around the Ottawa area, Montreal, Toronto and beyond. Currently hosting a one hour slot on CKCU FM 93.1 called "Friday Drive", every Friday from 5-6 pm, live streaming here: www.ckcufm.com Check it out! You can also check out some of Trevor's production work on his Mixcloud: www.mixcloud.com/trevor-walker4/ See Moreming purports a musical vision steeped in the traditions  of jazz, nu-jazz, house & live music! Through its dynamic programming,   the Mercury Lounge has successfully connected the dots, uniting jazz with contemporary electronic break beat culture. Within its walls the very philosophy of jazz, that of change, abounds. It serves not only as a club, and live venue, but also for poetry readings, dance performances and art gallery. About our Resident DJ - Saturdays - #lifeboogie Trevor Walker Has been DJing since 1989 providing Ottawa with top notch tunes from Afro, Latin, Jazz, Reggae, Disco, Funk, Soul, Hip Hop, House and Broken Beats. Can be found dropping tunes at Mercury Lounge every Saturday for the past 19 years, the "Tropikalo" monthly at the "Happy Goat" as well as numerous guest spots in and around the Ottawa area, Montreal, Toronto and beyond. Currently hosting a one hour slot on CKCU FM 93.1 called "Friday Drive", every Friday from 5-6 pm, live streaming here: www.ckcufm.com Check it out! You can also check out some of Trevor's production work on his Mixcloud: www.mixcloud.com/trevor-walker4/

about: Events and information about MIPAC, Windsor, Nova Scotia's original entertainment venue.
column44: Mermaid Theatre of Nova Scotia purchased the vacant Imperial Theatre at 106 Gerrish Street in 2003, right next door to the facility we had occupied since 1987. ...   Since then, a number of improvements have been undertaken to the facility with assistance from local, provincial, and federal funding.  The renewed Mermaid Imperial Performing Arts Centre began offering an annual Entertainment Series starting in 2007.   MIPAC has played host to a number of distinguished artists from across Canada.  Celebrated artists like Bruce Cockburn, George Canyon, Matt Andersen, Joe Sealy, Joel Plaskett, and Jill Barber have all performed on our stage.    The theatre is used for many purposes, including rehearsals for Mermaid’s own flagship productions; it is rented by a variety of community groups for events both public and private; it has been used for movie location filming; and Mermaid has begun using the theatre for school-time matinee performances for the benefit of area students and preschoolers, bringing world-class theatre to children from all around the Annapolis Valley. about: Music from around the corner and around the country. 2 featured acts followed by an open stage.
column44: The M Factor Music series was built soundly out of a love of live music and a commitment to supporting Indie artists and unsigned acts. This series, as well as ...its predecessor, ONSTAGE, has provided an opportunity to hundreds of new and established performers from all parts of the globe to share their gifts in an intimate and interactive atmosphere.  M Factor has also provided the opportunity for new artists and new performers to hone their skills and test their material.  In 2017, the series continues to bring the best of local, international and national music to you. This fall, M Factor invites you to be part of it all, with an open stage set invitation to showcase your music, your talent!  Please come out and support your artists and your series.   Elana   Hosted by Elana Harte (www.elanaharte.com) every second Wednesday with 2 featured artists followed by an open stage from Indie bands and singer/songwriters. Admission is always free.  Come by for a laugh, meet some new and old friends, pick up a shaker and join in, have a great time and enjoy some fabulous food and drink.  M FACTOR provides an intimate experience for audiences to connect with the best singer/songwriters, performers and composers from all over the world. All genres are welcome as long as the material is min FIFTY PERCENT ORIGINAL. .  *if you are interested in performing send us your link and info to elana@elanaharte.com  Past performers include: Sarah Smith, Jenny Allen, Mad Anthony, Emily Spillier, Candice Chantrell, Andrew Victoria, Dani Jean, Melissa Bel, Anna Sudac, Trish Kerr, Yma Ronsi, Joe Hash, Kim Jarrett, Simplee Reece, Dawn and Marra, Kim Koren, Courage My Love, Janet Whiteway, Elaine Dark, River City Junction, Sarah Calvert (Que Sarah), Jumple, Marianne Mazur, Mike Costantino, Lucio Agostini, Jennifer Brewer, Kinexxa Cross, Lindsay Coleman, Eyes Wide, Eden Culture, Lisa Michelle, Kaila Picard, Stephanie Bosch, Tonella, and many more... about: M Montreal: Apartment, Hostel & Bar
awards: Best Hostel Worldwide 2019
column44: · The M Montreal Hostel is definitely the place to stay if you want to fully enjoy Montreal. We are surrounded by the most popular neighborhoods like Old Montre...al (10 min walk), the Latin Quarter (5 min walk) or the Festival District (10 min walk).  · With a creative concept freshly remodeled, our establishment has a total capacity 490 beds. The hostel itself offers multiple different options - from our comfy dormitories to our spacious private apartments - we can assure you that you will find the accommodation that suits you perfectly!  We also created our very own bunk beds! Designed by us and built in Montreal, they offer comfort and privacy with different features like outlets, light, personal hangers, a curtain, a private locker etc...  Spend some time on our rooftop terrace and enjoy the view of downtown while relaxing in one of our two swimming SPAS.  We also welcome you at our M Bar between 3PM and 3AM with different activities each night of the week!  · Our 2.0 hostel comes with many of different services to make your stay more comfortable and enjoyable.  Here is a little list to give you an overview: - Rooftop Swimming SPAS - The M Bar with daily activities like Karaoke night / Live Music / Comedy Night etc... - Free WIFI everywhere in the hostel - 24/7 Reception - Free Breakfast - Tourist information - Free coffee an tea 24/7 - Working Area - Public computers - Laundry room - Luggage room - Female dorms  · The M Montreal has a total of 34 apartments, 280 dormitories (with a capacity from 4 to 16 persons) and we also have 5 female dorms. M.I.A. offers an inclusive space for alternative & avant strains of electronic dance music - whether rooted in R&B, Hip Hop or House - all presented in a well-h...eeled futuristic setting. Wanting to celebrate the nuances that come from truly connecting with one another, M.I.A. encourages guests to experience the future of dance music with Vancouver’s influential locals & artistic scenes today at M.I.A.  Guests tunnel into the historic Gastown based space from 350 Water Street to be greeted by a lush room boasting a mix of futuristic yet timeworn details; M.I.A. carries notes of dark, burnt wood and rich tones of purple and read while abstract L.E.D. installations across the ceiling create pulse-like light patterns connecting all corners of the room. The intimate dance floor and compact DJ booth are ringed by plush communal seating while winding past the main bar will bring guests to a a private back room Sake Bar and Gallery space showcasing local and international artists monthly  Committed to keeping the the best clarify and quality in sound, the club uses Function One as it’s preferred sound system & is capable of hosting private to branded events, intimate live music and curated visual art productions that uniquely connect and engage with the community See Moreeeled futuristic setting. about: NOW DELIVERING RIGHT TO YOUR DOORSTEP.  WEDNESDAY THROUGH SATURDAY.  CLOSED GOOD FRIDAY, DELIVERING EASTER SUNDAY. Enjoy superb continental  cuisine in the relaxing atmosphere of a stone fireplace or a view overlooking the Thames River.
public transit: Bus stop on York Street directly across from the restaurant.
culinary team: Denis Clavette, Red Seal Executive Chef at Michael's on the Thames since 1998.   An integral part of the culinary team since.  Jessica Core, Sous Chef and Kitchen Manager at Michael's since 2014.
products: DELIVERING TUESDAY THROUGH SATURDAY SELECTED FOOD AND WINE.  CLOSED GOOD FRIDAY.  DELIVERING EASTER SUNDAY. Only restaurant in London offering Table side Caesar Salad.  Also offer a selection of tableside entrees and desserts.   Come and enjoy the experience!
awards: LFP Best Romantic Restaurant 2019, 2018, 2017, 2016, 2015, 2014 TripAdvisor Award of Excellence 2019, 2018, 2017, 2016, 2015 LFP Best Fine Dining Restaurant 2018, RU 2017, RU 2016
column44: Michael’s cuisine samples from the best the world has to offer, while using local ingredients whenever possible. And nowhere else in London can you experience t...ableside cooking like this. Fantastic Caesar Salad, phenomenal Chateaubriand, and flaming Drunken Monkey are but a few of the delicious meals prepared right before your eyes at Michael’s. Classic dishes such as French Onion Soup and Escargot are offered side by side with local Jackson’s Wharf Lake Erie Pickerel and Filet Mignon or Canadian Sea Scallops Carbonara, or select from one of their exceptional cuts of beef. Vegetarian, vegan, as well as gluten free options, are available upon request. Finish your meal with a specialty coffee and an offering from the daily Dessert Plate, most of them gluten free. No matter what you choose, rest assured that it will be a meal, and an experience, to remember. See Moreableside cooking like this. mission: Brasser des bières de première qualité pour satisfaire la soif des amateurs de bières spéciales et savoureuses.  To brew premium beers aimed at beer lovers seeking for tasty, flavorful beers.
company overview: Microbrasserie québecoise située à Baie-Saint-Paul, dans Charlevoix.  Craft brewer located in the wonderful region of Charlevoix in the province of Quebec.
products: Blanche de Charlevoix Flacatoune Dominus Vobiscum Double... Dominus Vobiscum Triple Saison de Charlevoix  Sainte-Réserve Lupulus Sainte-Réserve Hibernus Brut Sour French Kiss Vache Folle Imperial Milk Stout Vache Folle ESB Session IPA Belgian IPA Bootlegger La Grand Fonds KLÄSS All together See More Dominus Vobiscum Triple Saison de Charlevoix  Sainte-Réserve Lupulus Sainte-Réserve Hibernus Brut Sour French Kiss Vache Folle Imperial Milk Stout Vache Folle ESB Session IPA Belgian IPA Bootlegger La Grand Fonds KLÄSS All together
column44: C'est au coeur de Baie-Saint-Paul, que sont brassées les bières d'inspiration belge "Dominus Vobiscum" Blanche, Ambrée, Double et Triple, ainsi que les bières "...Vache Folle" ESB et Milk Stout.  Depuis maintenant 1998, les brasseurs charlevoisiens, ne cessent de laisser libre cours à leur imagination afin de satisfaire les amateurs les plus exigeants de bières spéciales. Depuis janvier 2009, les opérations ont été transférées dans de nouvelles installations plus modernes et plus efficaces permettant d’augmenter la capacité de production afin de mieux répondre à la demande.  Les produits de la MicroBrasserie sont disponibles dans les meilleurs restaurants, auberges et épiceries de la région de Charlevoix, ainsi que dans certains points de vente à travers le Québec.  Une Boutique est aménagée à même l'usine de production où il est possible de se procurer tous les produits brassicoles de la MicroBrasserie Charlevoix ainsi que plusieurs articles promotionnels. about: La Microbrasserie À la Fût, une coopérative de travail établie à St-Tite, vous offre des bières artisanales brassées sur place et un resto-pub chaleureux et unique, digne des plus grands saloons westerns!
general information: Bières en service https://www.alafut.qc.ca/bieres-en-services/ ... Menu bouffe https://www.alafut.qc.ca/menu/a-lentree/  Où acheter nos bières https://www.alafut.qc.ca/points-de-vente/ See More Menu bouffe https://www.alafut.qc.ca/menu/a-lentree/  Où acheter nos bières https://www.alafut.qc.ca/points-de-vente/
column44: **PUB QUIZ - DE RETOUR LE 8 JANVIER 2018** Tous les lundis soirs de l'automne et de l'hiver, notre resto-pub ouvre ses portes dès 17h pour les participants du P...ub Quiz! Formez votre équipe de 2 à 4 personnes et venez participer, à 19h. Session d'hiver : du 8 janvier au 16 avril 2018. Menu simplifié - mais délicieux! - composé d'entrées et de quelques assiettes tirées du menu régulier, offert de 17h à 20h. Beaucoup, beaucoup de plaisir en perspective!  Établie dans le 1er magasin général du village western de Saint-Tite, la Microbrasserie À la Fût vous convie à une expérience de dégustation bières et bouffe. Brassées sur place avec de l’orge local et biologique, les bières artisanales sauront vous faire découvrir différents styles d’origine au goût du terroir mauricien.   À la Fût brasse bien sûr des bières régulières, telles que ses populaires British ou Mékinoise, mais aussi des cuvées houblonnées, sures, saisonnières, d’inspiration belge et vieillies en fût de chêne.   D’ailleurs, la coopérative de travail s’est méritée le titre de Bière de l’année au Canada en plus de remporter 5 médailles aux Canadian Brewing Awards 2012 et elle a remporté les Grands Prix du tourisme régionaux en 2009, 2011 et 2013. En 2015, nos nectars ont remporté pas moins de cinq prix au Canadian Brewing Awards, dont deux médailles d’or!    Pour agrémenter votre expérience, la cuisine du Resto-Pub | Saloon saura vous faire saliver avec ses produits de la Mauricie. Venez, entre autres, découvrir notre réputé Truite’n’chips, le tartare de truite, le steak mariné à Veillette, la poutine piquante ou sauce à la bière British, les burgers de boeuf Wyagu bio ou végétarien, le poke bol végane et la crème brûlée à la bière. Belle carte de vins, spiritueux et un menu pour enfants sont aussi offerts.   De plus, la Brûlerie Mékinoise a son torréfacteur sur place, pour le plaisir des amateurs de bons cafés, thés ou tisanes. Aussi sachets pour emporter.  Finalement, n’oubliez pas de rapporter de la bière en canettes ou en bouteilles de 750 ml à la maison! See Moreub Quiz! about: Depuis 1979, le MIFO met en lumière la culture francophone.  Plus grand centre culturel franco-ontarien : spectacles, services de garde, camps d'été, école de musique, cinéma, galerie, cours et activités récréatives.
public transit: OC transpo - Ligne 132  Arrêt Carriere/Orléans
mission: Depuis 1979, le Mouvement d’implication francophone d’Orléans met en lumière la culture francophone et favorise l’expression culturelle de la communauté d’Orléa...ns. La grande famille du MIFO crée des espaces, des expériences et des projets uniques qui outillent les francophones et les francophiles de toutes les générations et de tous les horizons.  Réel carrefour communautaire, il est un centre pluridisciplinaire qui offre des programmes et des services variés en français dans les domaines artistiques, culturels et communautaires. See Morens. La grande famille du MIFO crée des espaces, des expériences et des projets uniques qui outillent les francophones et les francophiles de toutes les générations et de tous les horizons.  Réel carrefour communautaire, il est un centre pluridisciplinaire qui offre des programmes et des services variés en français dans les domaines artistiques, culturels et communautaires.
column44: Depuis plus de 30 ans, le Mouvement d'implication francophone d'Orléans met en lumière la culture francophone et favorise l'expression culturelle de la communau...té d'Orléans. Il répond aux besoins artistiques, culturels, sociocommunautaires et éducatifs en offrant des services variés en français. Le MIFO favorise le développement d’une plus grande fierté et d’un plus grand sens d’appartenance.   L’organisme à but non lucratif se fait un devoir de célébrer les succès, de promouvoir les forces et de répondre aux besoins des employés, des partenaires et des bénévoles. about: Authentic, Southern Food Caterer & spot for blues music. Southern Suppers, & Private Parties. Does not operate as a 'regular' restaurant.
column44: Mississippi Queen Foods is a Southern Food Caterer, that also host special, Southern Supper events, offering a set, Southern menu, alongside blues music.  You c...an find additional information about these Southern Suppers, on the 'Events' page, as well as on the homepage of the website www.mississippiqueenfoods.com.   You may request the Catering Menu, which can be sent via email.  Catering Services are available every day.   You may also book your own private event at Mississippi Queen Foods.  This is ideal for groups of 10-20 people.  (Please note the liquor license is expected around the middle of April).   Mississippi Queen Foods is all 'bout Down Home Eatin', back woods livin', the blues, and nostalgic days of the past, and can comfortably seat around 20 guests, and the space is available for private events.       The owner, Connie, the Mississippi Queen, is from Pearl River County, Mississippi, and she offers up her Southern charm, and hospitality, along with the food, so you can enjoy it, in a way, that feels like you are Down South.   Catering services are available every day. If ya'll like to do some cookin', at home, Mississippi Queen Foods has Southern groceries, hot sauces, spices, and mixes for sale.   Southern desserts, available by special order, include Pecan Pie, Sweet Potato Pie, Peach Cobbler, Blueberry Cobbler, Mississippi Mud Cake, Pecan Pralines, Buttermilk Pumpkin Pie, Mardi Gras King Cake, Red Velvet Cupcakes, & Banana Pudding.   The Catering Menu is posted on the website for Mississippi Queen Foods.  You may also request that the PDF version be sent to you, via email. about: Outstanding classical music performed in intimate settings, 5 Sundays per season at 3:15pm.  Music & Truffles KIDS for children and adults at 1:15pm same day.
mission: Great Music for All
company overview: Mooredale Concerts is one of the most exciting and successful musical enterprises in Toronto. Designed to inspire and entertain the whole family, great classica...l music performances feature top professionals as well as brilliant young artists.  Fourteen concerts [3 different programs] of great variety are presented each year in which the public can enjoy instrumental soloists, chamber music, chamber orchestra, chamber opera, full symphony orchestra, vocal soloists, and choral works with orchestra.  We provide a cultural service to the community by keeping ticket prices very low, and because of our reputation for high quality at rock bottom prices, we are fortunate to have a terrific and very loyal following.    Our concerts are held at Walter Hall [496 seats], considered one of the fine chamber auditoriums in Toronto. It's located at University of Toronto, Edward Johnson Building. See Morel music performances feature top professionals as well as brilliant young artists. products: Our goal is to develop Canadian musical talent, instill in the young an appreciation of good music, and bring high quality musical experiences to the general pu...blic at family prices. Alumni of Mooredale include Isabel Bayrakdarian, Martin Beaver, Russell Braun, Stewart Goodyear, Erika Raum and James Sommerville.  Mooredale Concerts performances are offered within three distinct streams: Concert Series: 3:15pm Six Sunday afternoon performances by soloists, duos, quartets, and small ensembles offering world-class, distinctive programs from the Classical repertoires of 17th-20th Century music. North American artists are featured and there is at least one Canadian debut of international musicians per season.   Music and Truffles: 1:15-2:15pm Five hour-long shows using the professional musicians from the Concert Series presented for children ages 5 and up, their parents and adults who want to learn about classical music. Host Joanna interacts with the musicians and audience to create a fun atmosphere. Everyone receives a Lindt chocolate truffle at the end. Sweet!  Youth Orchestras: 3:00pm Three orchestras [junior - ages 12 and under, intermediate - ages 10-15, youth - ages 12-20 with Royal Conservatory Grade 8 and higher]; 120 young musicians trained in the classical orchestral repertoire for three performances each year - Nov, Feb, June. The Motley Kitchen is a lunch bistro, an event space, caterer and kitchen incubator.
column44: Downtown Sudbury is becoming the target of many housing developments, urban art projects, small business start-ups, infrastructure investments and other rejuven...ating changes. The Motley Kitchen is a new community economic development initiative, to be established as a creative space for the city's food industry entrepreneurs.   The Motley Kitchen has three main components: 1. Incubator kitchen: An incubator kitchen is where small food businesses can rent space on a per-hour or per-weekly basis. Starting a food business is expensive. The price of buying equipment and renting a space can cost upwards of $50,000, which can stifle the spark of many entrepreneurs. Not only that, but Ontario health and safety code requires all food products be made in a commercial kitchen if they're to be sold for consumption.  That's where we come in! We cover the overhead costs: the equipment, the space, hydro, gas, certifications, and health unit inspections, so our tenants can focus on making their ideas a reality. Incubators are also about providing new entrepreneurs business and marketing mentorship, which will be another focus of The Motley Kitchen.  We’ve already been contacted by more than 15 Sudburians who would like to rent space in the incubator kitchen.  2. Bistro: Every weekday, The Motley Kitchen will open as a bistro, serving delicious soups, sandwiches, and more to the hordes of Sudbury lunchtime goers. Our food is fresh and creative - comfort food with a twist. Natalie Lefevbre, the mastermind behind last summer's bright purple Dee-lish! food truck meals, is heading up the bistro. You know what that means? Mouth-watering burgers and ooey-gooey risotto balls will be finding a home on the menu.  3. Event space: The Motley Kitchen dining room will be available for rent by the community. Whether you're organizing a staff Christmas party, hosting a series of cooking lessons, or planning a film screening, The Motley Kitchen will be a creative and affordable rental space, and of course, catering can be done on site.
