about: Welcome to The Entertainment Icon of The Inland Empire! Administrative Office hours of operation 8:00 AM - 5:00 PM
column44: Built and owned by the City of Ontario, the Arena opened on October 18, 2008. Toyota Arena is a state-of-the-art facility that hosts Ontario Reign AHL ice hocke...y, NBA G-League team Agua Caliente Clippers of Ontario, Major Arena Soccer Team Ontario Fury and a variety of other sporting competitions, concerts, family shows, special events, and community activities as well as private events. The venue is the biggest and most modern arena within the Inland Empire.  We are conveniently located just north of Interstate 10 between Haven and Miliken Avenue. Our Venue includes 9,500 fixed seats with additional "portable" seating risers to accommodate capacities of 11,089 for concerts, 9,736 for ice hockey and 10,832 for basketball. The 225,000 square foot venue will also feature 36 luxury suites located on two levels and a continuous concourse hosting a variety of refreshment stands, merchandise kiosks, and the San Manuel VIP club and other fan amenities. about: UPAC is governed by the Bardavon 1869 Opera House Board of Directors and a full time staff of 23 plus over 100 volunteers.
mission: Bardavon 1869 Opera House, Inc. is a NYS nonprofit corporation that owns and operates two National Register theaters and the region’s orchestra. The 944-seat Ba...rdavon in Poughkeepsie is the state's oldest continuously operating theater and one of the US’s oldest. The 1500-seat Ulster Performing Arts Center (UPAC) in Kingston was built in 1927. The Bardavon acquired the Hudson Valley Philharmonic in 1999 (now in its 51st season), and merged UPAC into our operation in 2007. The Bardavon consistently presents quality music/dance/theater/classic films in both venues. Since 1994 the Bardavon has united artists, businesses, and government to produce outdoor events that draw thousands of residents and visitors to the region annually, providing free access to superb art as a source of community pride, urban revitalization and cultural tourism. Our Education Program partners with regional schools on both sides of the river to offer unique arts-based learning for students and innovative tools for teachers. The continued restoration and preservation our landmark theaters are also a vital aspect of our mission. The continued restoration and preservation our landmark theaters are also a vital aspect of our mission.
company overview: UPAC is governed by the Bardavon 1869 Opera House Board of Directors and a full time staff of 23 plus over 150 volunteers. Since the theater derives only 50% of... its income from ticket sales, it must rely upon the support of individuals, businesses, foundations and government to operate.  In 2006 Poughkeepsie's Bardavon Opera House took over the management of UPAC and in 2007 UPAC officially merged with the Bardavon. Today, the Ulster Performing Arts Center's historic Broadway Theater has emerged once again as a premier performing arts venue of the Hudson Valley , open year-round to present a diverse season of superb productions, including national and international headliners in music, dance, theater and more. With a 1500-seat capacity, it remains the largest proscenium theater between Manhattan and Albany. See More its income from ticket sales, it must rely upon the support of individuals, businesses, foundations and government to operate. about: Canada's Dockside Theatre. Presenting professional live theatre in the heart of the 1000 Islands for over 35 years.
products: Tickets, Subscriptions, Memberships
column44: In 1981, Greg Wanless returned home from a number of successful seasons at Stratford with the dream of reestablishing a theatre in Gananoque.  For a short time,... from 1967-1968, Gananoque had been home to the St. Lawrence Summer Playhouse, located in a tent in the parking lot of the Blinkbonnie Hotel. The theatre was extremely popular with locals and tourists alike, featuring a mix of Broadway musicals and American and British comedies.  But despite its success, it was soon moved to Kingston where it continued running until 1976.  Greg’s desire to bring theatre back to Gananoque was met with considerable support from the community, which had deeply missed the activity and excitement generated by the previous Playhouse. Under Greg’s leadership, and with the help of the community and a close group of artists and actors, the Thousand Islands Playhouse presented its first show on June 25, 1982.  The local Rotary Club sold the Gananoque Canoe Club to the Playhouse, community members donated money to renovate the building, and tradespeople generously gave of their time and expertise. That first season it was not unusual to come across a local businessman working alongside an actor building a deck, or a plumber teaching people how to install a toilet. Community members often dropped by after work to check on the progress of the building, and hosted dinners for hungry performers or production staff.  After such passionate community involvement in the theatre’s beginnings, it seemed natural that the Playhouse’s mission statement include an acknowledgment of our commitment to community life. Thirty years later, the Playhouse remains an important part of life in Gananoque and our commitment to the community continues to guide our artistic vision. about: Wind through Pacific Rim Park to downtown Tofino’s revitalized landmark and gateway to the water: Tofino Resort + Marina, 63 rooms overlooking the inlet.
column44: Inspired by Adventure Introducing Tofino's newest oceanfront resort.  ... Wind through Pacific Rim Park to downtown Tofino's revitalized landmark and gateway to the water. Tofino Resort + Marina, 63 rooms overlooking the Clayoquot Sound UNESCO Biosphere Reserve.  Come check out our flagship restaurant, 1909 Kitchen.   Honouring the history of our coastal locale, our restaurant was named after the year Tofino got its name. With a fresh take on local ingredients, our shared plates are devised by up-and-coming chef with an impressive pedigree, Paul Moran. Unwind off the water with wood-fired bites or a libation inspired by the tides.   The Hatch Waterfront Pub  Grab a friend and a cold one, and pull up a barstool. This is the Hatch: our local pub where wayfarers and locals alike take in the views and live music. It's the place to cheers the day, tell stories into the night, and leave with friends new and old. about: Producing concerts and tours for television productions, corporate entities, large scale festivals, government offices, private individuals, and the general public in Western Canada. Books for MacEwan Hall, Ballroom, The Den and Theatre Junction.
public transit: Producing concerts and tours for television productions, corporate entities, large scale festivals, government offices, private individuals, and the general pub...lic, Calgary based “Tooth Blackner Presents” has garnered a strong reputation in Western Canada.  Exclusively booking the University of Calgary venues, including the MacEwan Ballroom, The Den, and MacEwan Hall, along with the Grand Theatre in downtown Calgary, Tooth Blackner Presents produces over 100 shows per year, from folk to punk to children’s performances to jazz and everything in between.   While it was officially formed in 2005, Tooth Blackner Presents has been the work of sole-owner Greg Curtis, for over twenty years. Greg began as an employee, and then a contracted employee, of the University of Calgary Students’ Union and his business progressed from there. The formation of Tooth Blackner Presents has allowed for expansion of Greg’s working relationships, influence, and involvement in the music industry in Western Canada. Having spent years in the broadcast media and studying Theatre at the Univeristy of Calgary (BFA 1988), as well as working with numerous not-for-profit organizations including sitting on the board of The Calgary Folk Festival (Vice-chair), The Canadian Organization of Campus Activities, The Western Canadian Music Alliance, The Calgary Juno Host Committee Executive, and Music Calgary Executive, Greg is considered an asset to the live music scene in Calgary and Canada. general information: Our primary activities include:   -	The Fringe Festival: Presenting 150 productions chosen by lottery at venues across the city, the Fringe attracts 90,000+ att...endees and returns $400,000+ to participating artists -	The Next Stage Theatre Festival: Presenting 8-10 productions from the best Fringe companies across the world, NSTF is a showcase for emerging talent ready to be seen by new audiences and programmers -	Youth and Artist Outreach Activities: Our outreach programs offer in-depth support to young audiences and emerging artists, promoting participation in theatre and providing resources to professionalize independent artistic undertakings See Moreendees and returns $400,000+ to participating artists -	The Next Stage Theatre Festival: Presenting 8-10 productions from the best Fringe companies across the world, NSTF is a showcase for emerging talent ready to be seen by new audiences and programmers -	Youth and Artist Outreach Activities: Our outreach programs offer in-depth support to young audiences and emerging artists, promoting participation in theatre and providing resources to professionalize independent artistic undertakings
mission: We are dedicated to enabling access to creative opportunities for artists and audiences, and to encourage the enterprise of independent artists by providing the, space, time, and resources for their work to take shape.
company overview: The Toronto Fringe produces two annual festivals - The Toronto Fringe Festival & The Next Stage Festival.
column44: For 31 years, The Toronto Fringe has acted as an incubator for ideas, reputations and experiences, dedicated to helping artists succeed. Through the incredibly ...popular Fringe Festival, we’ve created a dynamic and diverse community that has proven the power of the independent spirit by becoming the largest theatre festival in the city and the launching pad for some of Canada’s most recognized cultural exports. Address: PO Box 81030, Harbour Square PO, 89 Queen's Quay W Toronto, Ontario
about: Toronto Island Marina
column44: Webster's Collegiate Dictionary defines Marina as: "a dock or basin providing secure moorings for motorboats or yachts". We believe this to be a fair descriptio...n of your average marina. Sure, we have secure moorings for your boat, the Toronto Island Marina has over 350 berths to accommodate you. However, we like to think of our marina as much more than a place to tie up your craft.   While most marinas may offer similar services to the Toronto Island Marina, we are certain that none offer the quality of our environment! Nestled between picturesque Centre and Muggs Islands in Toronto's inner harbour, it's intimate and calm; not just another liquid parking lot. The air is fresh and everywhere you look there is green. To the north, within an easy ferry ride, you'll see Toronto, one of the world's great cities.  As you step off your boat at the Toronto Island Marina, you step into 500 acres of lush park land. Enjoy island life - a peaceful setting for seafarers of all ages, with all the expansive greenery of the Toronto Islands at your disposal. Walk, or picnic, or play. Bring the children, bring the dog. Life's short. Have fun. For a change of pace, step onto our private tender, or stroll to the island ferry.  When you have had enough of the hustle, the noise and the concrete, remember you're just a wave away from an island of green peace and tranquility - the Toronto Island Marina.  So whether you're mooring your boat for the season or visiting for the weekend, come and get away - and be welcome to our world. See Moren of your average marina. mission: Toronto Summer Music’s festival and academy enrich lives through the shared appreciation  of music. company overview: An international classical music festival and academy now entering its 12th season, Toronto Summer Music (TSM) brings world-renowned performing artists to Toron...to for an unparalleled combination of performances and summer music education.    Programmed by our recently appointed, celebrated Artistic Director, Jonathan Crow, the TSM Festival offers classical music lovers a feast of engaging concerts, enriched by master classes, lectures, exhibitions and workshops.  The only summer music program of its kind in Ontario, the TSM Academy offers instruction at the highest level to musicians at the threshold of their professional careers through individual master classes and string quartet, composition and chamber music workshops. column44: At Townhall, we pair a comfortable atmosphere and exceptional service with really, really good grub. Let us be your stomping ground, your escape route, your saf...e haven, your happy place. Stop by to watch the game or join us for a drink (fyi, we’ve got more than a dozen beers on tap and 25 craft brews to choose from). We have a hunch that you’ll be enticed to stay and sample one of our classic pub offerings, all prepared from fresh, high-quality ingredients. More than just a pub, we care about the people in our community. That’s why we fundraise for schools and charities, strive to support local neighbourhood food producers and keep our communities out of harm’s way by participating in local safety initiatives. Let us be your stomping ground, your escape route, your safe haven, your happy place. And in return, we’ll offer you a night you’ll remember long after the sun comes up. With our cozy ambiance, top quality fare and cheerful grins, we know you’ll be able to kick back and unwind, as if you were lounging in your own living room. Just keep your pants on, ok? Address: 285 St. George Street, Box 310 Annapolis Royal, Nova Scotia
about: Annapolis Royal is a pleasure to behold for the visitor, a dynamic community with growing opportunity for business investment, and a home second to none for its residents.
general information: The Annapolis Royal area has gained a reputation as a vibrant centre for cultural activity, and over the years it has become a magnet for visual artists, crafts...people, performers and writers. No fewer than eight private studios and galleries are in operation within the National Historic District, not to mention an artist-run gallery (ARTsPLACE) and another art gallery at King's Theatre.  We're proud of our many well-preserved heritage buildings that make up one of the loveliest streetscapes in the country. We're also pleased to be recognized as a community where volunteerism is alive and well. Visitors are often surprised that so many activities go on in such a sparsely populated area. See Morepeople, performers and writers. Administration Office - come visit us h...ere for information on your taxes, to pay that pesky water bill or just get informed on the general information of what is going on in the community.   Open Monday - Thursday 8:00 am - 4:30 pm  and Friday 8:00 am - 1:00 pm  Community Resource Centre - The true heart of the community. Offering programs for babies all the way up to seniors, the community resource centre has something for everyone. You will also find employment services, Parent Link Centre, Adult Education, Literacy Services and much more here!   Open Monday - Thursday 8:00 am - 4:30 pm and Friday 8:00 am - 1:00 pm.   Public Works - looks after all of the maintenance of the town. Makes sure the potholes are filled, the toilets flush and the streets are cleaned. Recreation also offers recreation programs to the community as well as running our three campgrounds and making sure we have beautiful flowers and our grass is cut. founding date: 1999 (Amalgamated - Essex, Colchester North, Colchester South, & Harrow)
mission: The Town’s mission is to maintain existing services, and to develop new ones, assets and opportunities that will deliver an outstanding life experience for present and future residents, communities, businesses, and visitors.
column44: The Town of Essex is located in southwestern Ontario, approximately 28 kilometres southeast of the City of Windsor and is one of seven lower-tier municipalities... in the County of Essex. The Town of Essex consists of four distinct and unique centres – Essex Centre, Harrow Centre, McGregor Centre and Colchester Centre. These unique communities are surrounded by a thriving wine and agriculture industry and boast a wide range of recreational facilities, an excellent school system, and affordable living options. The current population of the Town of Essex is 19,600. See More in the County of Essex. The venue is the biggest and most modern arena within the Inland Empire.  We are conveniently located just north of Interstate 10 between Haven and Miliken Avenue. Our Venue includes 9,500 fixed seats with additional "portable" seating risers to accommodate capacities of 11,089 for concerts, 9,736 for ice hockey and 10,832 for basketball. column44: Owned by the City of Oshawa, and managed by Spectra by Comcast Spectacor, the Tribute Communities Centre opened in 2006 with a project cost of $45 million and w...as initially known as the General Motors Centre. As Durham Region’s premier Sports and Entertainment Facility, the Tribute Communities Centre provides a first-class home to the Oshawa Generals of the Ontario Hockey League, the Arena Lacrosse League and the Oshawa Sports Hall of Fame.  Since opening, the General Motors Centre has hosted major concerts and special events including Elton John, Cirque du Soleil, 2011 BDO Canadian Open, IIHF World Junior Pre-Competition, Alan Jackson, Hedley, Skate Canada Synchronized Skating Championships, Selena Gomez and The Wiggles; just to name a few! about: Thrash Metal gods (since 1986)
biography: Thrash metal outfit from Quebec City, Canada Recognized in the late 80s as one of the cult Canada's metal band, SOOTHSAYER broke the metal scene worldwide and o...btained the respect of their peers. Through their short career (1986 to 1990), SOOTHSAYER built an imposing waybill of live performances.  Some of those live appearances include gigs along the likes of Nuclear Assault / Sacrifice / Aggression / Possessed / Kreator / Slaughter / DBC / Crumbsuckers and many more!   In october '86, SOOTHSAYER went into the studio to record their first demo entitled "To Be A Real Terrorist" The result consists of five songs of pure thrash metal, intensity at its roughest!  Back then, the climax of their young career was, undoubtedly, the release of their album "Have A Good Time" This LP, recorded in early 1989 but released in late 1990, has been made available to the public by the Californian independent label New Renaissance Records through their Colossal division and distributed by Restless Records. That album created a certain infatuation among the US radio colleges circuit. In addition, highly respected European publications, such as Kerrang and Metal Forces, qualified SOOTHSAYER as a band to seriously keep an eye on!   The band split up in 1990 and reformed in 2007 after 17 years of hiatus.  In 2007, Galy Records (Montréal) re-released the classic “To Be A Real Terrorist” demo including a 1987 live concert recorded at Le Spectrum in Montreal, Canada.  All tracks were remastered by two members of the band.  The CD booklet has 6 full-color pages with rare pictures, flyers and liner. It also features notes from Rob (Sacrifice), Brian (Wehrmacht), Dave (Slaughter), James Plotkin (OLD/Khanate) among others.  They mainly reformed to play the “25 ans de Metal Québécois” festival in Montreal. Since then, the guys continued rehearsing and playing live. Most recently, they also played with Testament and were on the line-up of the “Trois-Rivières Metal Fest” and “Quebec Metal Fest 9” among others.  Late 2008, New Renaissance Records released a limited edition of soothsayer’s debut album “Have A Good Time”. The CD repressing was re-mastered by soothsayer`s guitarist Martin Cyr and limited to 3000 copies, also available through iTunes.  Spring 2011, Nuclear War Now! Productions (California) have come to an agreement with Galy Records to released the classic “To Be A Real Terrorist” on vinyl version. This LP re-edition have a “Die Hard” version with colored vinyl, gatefold jacket, A2 poster, woven patch, vinyl sticker, and 36 pages zine styled booklet.  In 2012 Soothsayer signed with Galy Records for the release of "Troops Of Hate" an album containing freshly new material composed. Recorded at Studio Summun in Quebec City with François C. Fortin at helm, the album mark the return of the troops with 10 devastating pure thrash songs.  The tracks list is as follow:  01. Govern Me 02. Over Myself 03. Narrow Minded (revisited) 04. Back To Evil 05. Where Are We? 06. Dark Star 07. Grotte 08. Chicken Pie 09. Enough 10. Anatomy Is Dead Sickness (revisited)  The CD is available on Galy Records eStore and digitaly through iTunes. about: Ukraine-Kyiv Pavilion is one of the original pavilions of Folklorama, an annual multicultural festival in Winnipeg, Manitoba, Canada.
column44: Український Павільйон Київ є один з оригінальних павільйонів на фестивалі «Фольклорама», щорічний мультикультурний фестиваль, який відбувається у Вінніпезі, Ман...ітоба, Канада.  This page is for visitors, guests, volunteers, and performers of Ukraine-Kyiv Pavilion, which is part of the Folklorama festial, and for those who are interested in finding out more about Ukrainian culture.  Ця сторінка призначена для відвідувачів, гостей, волонтерів та виконавців Українського Павільйону Київ під час фестивалю Фольклорама, і так само для тих, хто зацікавлені українською культурою.  This year, Ukraine-Kyiv Pavilion will run from August 11 to 17, 2019.  Цього року, Український Павільйон Київ буде тривати з 11 до 17 серпня, 2019 р. about: UPAC is governed by the Bardavon 1869 Opera House Board of Directors and a full time staff of 23 plus over 100 volunteers.
mission: Bardavon 1869 Opera House, Inc. is a NYS nonprofit corporation that owns and operates two National Register theaters and the region’s orchestra. The 944-seat Ba...rdavon in Poughkeepsie is the state's oldest continuously operating theater and one of the US’s oldest. The 1500-seat Ulster Performing Arts Center (UPAC) in Kingston was built in 1927. The Bardavon acquired the Hudson Valley Philharmonic in 1999 (now in its 51st season), and merged UPAC into our operation in 2007. The Bardavon consistently presents quality music/dance/theater/classic films in both venues. Since 1994 the Bardavon has united artists, businesses, and government to produce outdoor events that draw thousands of residents and visitors to the region annually, providing free access to superb art as a source of community pride, urban revitalization and cultural tourism. Our Education Program partners with regional schools on both sides of the river to offer unique arts-based learning for students and innovative tools for teachers. The continued restoration and preservation our landmark theaters are also a vital aspect of our mission. company overview: UPAC is governed by the Bardavon 1869 Opera House Board of Directors and a full time staff of 23 plus over 150 volunteers. Since the theater derives only 50% of... its income from ticket sales, it must rely upon the support of individuals, businesses, foundations and government to operate.  In 2006 Poughkeepsie's Bardavon Opera House took over the management of UPAC and in 2007 UPAC officially merged with the Bardavon. Today, the Ulster Performing Arts Center's historic Broadway Theater has emerged once again as a premier performing arts venue of the Hudson Valley , open year-round to present a diverse season of superb productions, including national and international headliners in music, dance, theater and more. With a 1500-seat capacity, it remains the largest proscenium theater between Manhattan and Albany. about: More than just Tea...comfortable yet engaging Licensed Cafe, Music Venue & Lounge in Ashcroft to Eat,Drink & Buy food, tea, coffee, beer, wine & cocktails!
general information: Nadine Davenport - Tea Lover / Owner
column44: UniTea Tea Room ...a comforting 'Oasis in the Desert'.  At UniTea - Our mission is to create a healthier Community one cup at a time by offering only the highes...t quality organic and fair-trade Tea Products at reasonable prices. We strive to provide friendly and knowledgeable Customer Service in an environment that encourages, stimulates and educates customers to learn about the countless health benefits of Loose Tea. More than just a Tea Room we are now licensed and offer a place to learn, gather, play, relax or just connect with friends and neighbours.  We offer Tea Tasting Workshops led by an employee or guest speaker will teach customers about the health benefits & origin of tea and its various historical roles. We have events & services focused towards Kids & Moms, Youth & Seniors.  We have ‘Monthly Entertainment Nights’ featuring everything from classical, jazz to acoustic roots, blues and world music. On selected nights in the winter months we hold poetry readings and an open mic nights. UniTea takes part each year in the Ashcroft - July 'Art Walk' .  From time to time we also welcome an artists work in residence.  We have weekly ‘Community Games Nights’ that encourage card and board games. Some board and card games will be available to customers at all times. Community nights you can expect to find new friends and players, as well as bring along their own game to share during the event. We are a meeting place for; Book Clubs, Meditation circles and for private Business Meetings or Workshops of all kinds. Phone us to book your event today ! PERFORMANCE OFFICE: performance.music@utoronto.ca  BOOKING OFFICE: music.booking@utoronto.ca  ALUMNI FACEBOOK PAGE: https://www.facebook.com/UofTFacultyOfMusicAlumni/  WHAT'S HAPPENING MONTHLY E-NEWSLETTER: bit.ly/UofTMusic-enews See More  PERFORMANCE OFFICE: performance.music@utoronto.ca  BOOKING OFFICE: music.booking@utoronto.ca  ALUMNI FACEBOOK PAGE: https://www.facebook.com/UofTFacultyOfMusicAlumni/  WHAT'S HAPPENING MONTHLY E-NEWSLETTER: bit.ly/UofTMusic-enews
public transit: We are accessible by the TTC (Museum subway station).
company overview: The University of Toronto Faculty of Music is a vital destination for the professional and scholarly study of music in North America. As part of one of the worl...d’s top universities, the Faculty is home to a diverse and dynamic community. With superb educators in every area of music study and dozens of areas of specialization, we offer an education that is both broad and deep. Our community members have garnered honours such as the Oscar, the Leonardo da Vinci Prize, Peabody, JUNO and National Jazz Awards, and Tier 1 Canada Research Chair, and occupy prominent positions with major performing arts organizations including the Toronto Symphony, the Canadian Opera Company, the Boston Symphony and Berlin Philharmonic.  The 2018/19 season marks the Faculty of Music’s 100th anniversary and we are thrilled to welcome distinguished visitors including Jessye Norman, Rob Kapilow and Toshio Hosokawa, and offer more than 150 public events, lectures and master classes. Collaboration is the watchword of our centenary as we join together with our external partners, student, faculty and visiting ensembles, and academic areas for an exciting year. column44: HISTORY  Written by Juan Rodriguez - the Gazette...  With its classic wood paneling, stone walls, long bar, and elegant linen covered tables Upstairs Jazz Bar & Grill is an intimate throwback to the golden age where musicians and fans alike considered jazz clubs a home away from home – a social meeting place, a headquarters, and above all a place of inspired musicality. As such, Upstairs is Montreal’s leading jazz club, presenting music 52 weeks a year in an atmosphere that encourages attentive listening, facilitated by a first–class sound system filling the cozy semi-basement.   Whether you like your jazz accompanied by a variety of libations and snacks or full course meals, Upstairs offers an optimum musical experience. Call it the art of making it an evening – as dressed-up or casual as you like.   Upstairs has hosted leading international exponents in jazz, encompassing a wide variety of styles, including Sheila Jordan, Kurt Rosenwinkel, Mark Turner, Larry Grenadier, Ingrid Jensen, David Binney, David Liebman, Houston Person, Mark Murphy, Jim Black, Greg Osby, Nate Smith, Bill Stewart, Tim Hagans, John Hicks, Donnie McCaslin, Ben Mondor, Antonio Sanchez and such local leaders as Christine Jensen, Renée Lee, Joel Miller, Chet Doxas, Lorraine Desmarais, Steve Amirault, François Bourassa, Jean Derome, Jeff Johnstone, Julie Lamontagne, and many more.  While Upstairs has become a key “intime” venue at the annual Montreal International Jazz Festival, the club also symbolizes jazz as a year-round affair in Montreal. The club is headquarters for the city’s finest musicians, no matter what style they play in. It has been the site of live recordings and it hosts numerous CD launchings, and its Monday night jam sessions, led by drummer Jim Doxas, amount to works-in-progress on the local scene.   Musicians appreciate the classy amenities at Upstairs. On showcase nights (Fridays and Saturdays), from the moment the lighting dims and club owner Joel Giberovitch’s voice intones a polite advisory that this is a jazz concert and silence would be appreciated, the musicians own the stage, and attention levels throughout the club quickly hit their peak. The club’s crystal clear sound system accentuates this vibe.  With its décor complemented by a panel of vintage album covers, a strip of autographed photos of musicians along a ceiling, and an impressively large framed photo of Sonny Rollins towards the back terrace, Upstairs spells jazz. Giberovitch describes running Upstairs over the years as “an education in jazz. My appreciation of the city’s great musicians has grown enormously over the years.”   Located in the heart of the city’s business and college hub, Upstairs also attracts a faithful luncheon clientele. about: Upstream Music where composition meets improvisation in Atlantic Canada.
general information: Upstream produces concerts and workshops at the Dalhousie Arts Centre  in Halifax as well at St Mary's University Art Gallery and the Khyber Arts Centre  The Up...stream Record label : Undercurrent Recordings has released recordings by the  founding  Upstream Ensemble and Aperture: a free jazz trio.  The group  toured to New Music America in 1992 and Jazz em Agosto in Lisbon Portugal in 2004 under the guise of the Paul Cram Orchestra. The Aperture Trio  did an Atlantic Tour to Festival du creation in Jonquiere in the fall of 2012.  The 20-piece Upstream Orchestra performed in Quebec, a festival of musique actuelle  in Victoriaville May 2013 See Morestream Record label : Undercurrent Recordings has released recordings by the  founding  Upstream Ensemble and Aperture: a free jazz trio.  The group  toured to New Music America in 1992 and Jazz em Agosto in Lisbon Portugal in 2004 under the guise of the Paul Cram Orchestra. The Aperture Trio  did an Atlantic Tour to Festival du creation in Jonquiere in the fall of 2012.  The 20-piece Upstream Orchestra performed in Quebec, a festival of musique actuelle  in Victoriaville May 2013
mission: Mandate Upstream Music Association  is a professional arts organization, which exists to contribute to the growth of a vibrant cultural community by nurturing t...he development and presentation of innovative musical works that explore the relationships among composition, performance and improvisation in a cooperative and collective spirit. See Morehe development and presentation of innovative musical works that explore the relationships among composition, performance and improvisation in a cooperative and collective spirit.
company overview: Upstream Music  For the past 24 years the Upstream Music Association has contributed  to contemporary  world culture as a professional producer  of small and la...rge ensembles performing original cutting-edge pan-genre, long-form, improvising orchestra music  of the utmost intensity .  History and Profile The company, based in Halifax, Nova Scotia, Canada on the Atlantic seaboard, was founded on April 4th , 1990.    The inaugural Upstream Ensemble concert was presented at St. Mary’s University Art Gallery under the auspices of gallery curators  Layton Davis and Ken Aucoin on May 13th , 1990.   The founding ground-breaking band featured   musicians Steve Tittle, Bob Bauer, Jeff Reilly, Don Palmer, Paul Cram, Tom Roach, Sandy Moore and Steven Naylor.  Over the years these   composer/performers  and subsequent Upstreamers have created a significant body of work, writing unique long-form musical works  that juxtapose notation and free improvisation in fascinating and entertaining ways. Upstream Ensembles have gone on to perform  these original  compositions in many more concerts at St. Mary’s and  around Nova Scotia. In addition, Upstream has collaborated with  Symphony Nova Scotia, performed in Scotia Festival, toured to the  Music Across America Festival and internationally to the prestigious Jazz um Agosto Festival in Lisbon, Portugal.  The Upstream organization continues to produce, perform, present, and provoke discourse amongst artists, musicians, scientists and citizens  of all stripes while featuring  21st Century long-form composed and improvised music from Nova Scotia and around the world.  International artists such as Fred Frith, Barry Guy, Lisle Ellis,  Lori Freedman, Alain Trudel, Matt Brubeck and Marilyn Lerner have recently  collaborated  with Upstream musicians and upheld the excellence of the founding energy with stunning performances of challenging new works. At the same time, Upstream reaches out to the community through inter-active programs such as our current  Composer Workshops featuring the Upstream  Guerrilla Orchestra. The Upstream sound is evolving with new groups such as A Love Upstream Nonet, Upstream 6.0,  and a new expanded Upstream Orchestra  . Upstream  has recently begun to make available its music on  Undercurrent Recordings.    The past few years  included a revolving door of artists such as James Hill (ukelele/violin) Emma Morgan-Thorpe (cello) Lukas Pearse (bass), Signe Bone (violin) Danny Parker (bass) Anne Davison (cello) Dawn Hatfield (sax/flute), Janice Jackson, (voice) Douglas Cameron (drums, Tim Crofts (piano/electronics) Geordie Haley (guitar), Lee Park (violin) Jeff Torbert (guitar) Matt Myer trumpet, Rick Waychesko, trumpet, Martha Kelly – trombone, Jeff Reilly – bass clarinet, Adam Linson – bass, Don Palmer – sax, Paul Cram – tenor sax/clarinet, and  D’Arcy Grey – percussion. See Morerge ensembles performing original cutting-edge pan-genre, long-form, improvising orchestra music  of the utmost intensity . biography: Urban Science is the 7-piece live band that hosts the #LeCypher Thursday night hip-hop & soul party. Featuring some of the city’s most sought-after musicians, t...hey have performed and/or recorded with such artists as Talib Kweli, Nelly, KRS-One, Illa J, Snarky Puppy, Erik Truffaz, Bran Van 3000, and Imhothep (IAM). Notable achievements amongst its members are 2016 world champion of End of the Weak, 6-time King of the Dot champion, an appearance on the Tonight Show, artist sponsorships from Soultone Cymbals, Dream Cymbals, and numerous studio recordings, including Mac Miller’s “Dang!” (#2 on the Billboard 200). Urban Science #LeCypher has held down residencies at the Montreal Jazz Festival’s after-hours party series every single year since 2015, and was the regular house band for the Rap Battles for Social Justice until 2018.  In 2018, URBN SCNC XL, an expanded version of Urban Science, produced an historic show called “RapKeb Allstarz”, backing the top francophone Québécois rap artists for the closing of the 30th edition of the Francofolies.  Off-shoot project Urban Science Brass Band has hosted the MTL Hip-Hop Parade since 2016 and also held down Jazz Festival residencies since 2017.  Urban Science est le groupe de 7 musiciens qui anime les jeudis #LeCypher, party de hip-hop et soul. Mettant en vedette les plus renommés des musiciens de la scène locale, ces membres ont performé ou enregistré avec artistes tel que Talib Kweli, Nelly, KRS-One, Illa J, Snarky Puppy, Erik Truffaz, Bran Van 3000 ou encore Imhothep (IAM). Les accomplissements notables de ses membres sont par exemple, le titre mondial 2016 de End of the Weak, la victoire à 6 reprises du King of the Dot, une prestation à The Tonight Show, les commandites artistiques de Soultone Cymbals et Dream Cymbals ainsi que plusieurs enregistrements en studio, incluant “Dang!” de Mac Miller (#2 sur le Billboard 200). Urban Science #LeCypher a été invité pour des résidences aux Festival International de Jazz de Montréal à chaque année depuis 2015 et était le house band pour les Rap Battles for Social Justice jusqu’à 2018.  En 2018, URBN SCNC XL, une version élargie de Urban Science, a produit un spectacle historique appelé “RapKeb All-Starz”, en accompagnant les plus grandes vedettes de rap franco-Québécois pour le spectacle de fermeture du 30e édition des Francofolies.  Projet antenne, le Urban Science Brass Band anime la Parade Hip-Hop de Montréal depuis 2016 et a aussi été invité à des résidences au Festival de Jazz depuis 2017. about: L’Usine C est depuis 1995 un centre de création et de diffusion pluridisciplinaire dynamique du quartier Centre-Sud de Montréal. Elle regroupe deux salles, un studio de création et un café.
general information: Suivez nous via Twitter / Follow us on Twitter : UsineC.
public transit: Métro Beaudry, Bus :  125 Ontario, 45 Papineau et 24 Sherbrooke
mission: L’Usine C est depuis 1995 un centre de création et de diffusion pluridisciplinaire dynamique du quartier Centre-Sud de Montréal. Elle regroupe deux salles de diffusion de 440 et 120 places, un studio de répétition, un hall d’exposition et un café.
company overview: Fondée en mars 1995 par la compagnie Carbone 14, l’Usine C, située au cœur du quartier Centre-sud de Montréal dans l’ancienne usine Raymond, est devenue un lieu... incontournable pour la création et la diffusion des arts pluridisciplinaires contemporains. Durant les 17 dernières années, l'Usine C a soutenu le travail d'artistes parmi les plus saisissants et innovants de la création contemporaine sur la scène québécoise et internationale.   Founded in March 1995 by the company Carbone 14, Usine C, situated in the heart of the Centre-South area of Montréal in what was once the factory Raymond, has become an indispensable centre for the creation and dissemination of multidisciplinary contemporary arts. For the past 17 years it has supported the work of some of the most striking and innovative artists in contemporary creation on the international scene. about: The historic Uxbridge Music Hall, situated in the heart of downtown Uxbridge hosts a number of performing arts and theatrical events.
column44: The Music Hall is the gem of the many facilities in the Township. Known for its superior acoustics, the Uxbridge Music Hall is a thriving cultural centre. Widel...y used by theatrical groups, and music groups, the Uxbridge Music Hall is an outstanding specimen of our local heritage. The interior of the hall has been restored and the original opera chairs are still in the balcony encircled by the beautiful carved iron railing. In the centre of the building is the original cut glass chandelier with a diameter of approximately three feet. This beautiful historical facility is air conditioned, making it an ideal facility for all seasons. See Morey used by theatrical groups, and music groups, the Uxbridge Music Hall is an outstanding specimen of our local heritage. The interior of the hall has been restored and the original opera chairs are still in the balcony encircled by the beautiful carved iron railing. In the centre of the building is the original cut glass chandelier with a diameter of approximately three feet. This beautiful historical facility is air conditioned, making it an ideal facility for all seasons.

about: Vancouver's Annual Fringe Theatre Festival! September 10-20, 2020! Mark your calendars and get ready for some legendary good times!
mission: Presenting live theatre in an informal, accessible, and inexpensive environment, the Fringe strives to break down traditional boundaries between audiences and a...rtists, encouraging open dialogue between theatre-goers and theatre-creators. Audiences are invited to experience the work of seasoned veterans and emerging artists. Local, national, and international artists benefit from working together and learning from each other in a vibrant and exciting festival atmosphere. See Morertists, encouraging open dialogue between theatre-goers and theatre-creators. Audiences are invited to experience the work of seasoned veterans and emerging artists. Local, national, and international artists benefit from working together and learning from each other in a vibrant and exciting festival atmosphere.
company overview: The Vancouver Fringe is a celebration of every kind of theatre imaginable. Over 11 days in September, more than 80 different theatre artists and companies come ...together to share their creativity on stage. Audiences are as varied as the performances with theatrical offerings for all tastes and ages. The uniqueness of the Fringe comes from the “everyone is welcome” selection technique—the Mainstage shows are literally drawn out of a hat, giving all artists a chance to participate. There is also a category for artists who find their own venue, Bring Your Own Venue (BYOV). The Fringe welcomes their performances as well, some of them in surprising locations like inside bathrooms or in the back of a car. Many of these are part of the Fringe Onsite program, which cultivates this type of site-specific work for the nooks and crannies on Granville Island. The Fringe revels in its identity as part theatre, part party. Every night of the Festival, Fringe artists, audiences, volunteers, and everyone involved, are welcomed to take in live music and share their experiences at the Fringe Bar. With over 500 volunteers supporting 700 performances in 11 days, the Fringe is a cultural experience unlike any other—bustling with the energy of an unwieldy stable of untamed creative beasts. about: Every year the VJS presents the TD Victoria International JazzFest, the Vancouver Island Blues Bash, and year round concerts.
general information: Find us on Twitter and Instagram! @VicJazzSociety
mission: The Victoria Jazz Society is a professional arts organization committed to presenting the highest quality of jazz possible to our community, by presenting music... in performance, with acclaimed musicians.  Since 1981, through its innovative artistic vision, the VJS has attracted thousands of leading artists from around the world to perform in Victoria. Hundreds of thousands of fans have enjoyed many outstanding festival and non-festival performances that have featured the full spectrum of jazz and improvised music - from the traditional and mainstream, to the avant-garde, including worldbeat and the blues.  The Victoria Jazz Society's primary activity is to produce two major multi-day music festivals in the summer, TD Victoria International JazzFest and the Vancouver Island Blues Bash, as well as a series of concerts from September to May, all featuring international, national and regional jazz artists. See More in performance, with acclaimed musicians. company overview: We are a fully independent, family-run business established in Shoreditch with a focus on supporting the arts since 2001, part of JaguarShoes Collective.   The ...stunning 50s bar island takes centre stage in the venue – illuminated and boasting the kind of drinks offer you’d expect to find: JaguarShoes classic cocktails, locally brewed craft beers and a selection of new and old world wines.  The music room at The Victoria has been on the radar of gig-goers for more than three decades and is one of the best live rooms in east London. In the spring of 2015 we re-launched the space independently to the pub, working with the industry’s best promoters and building an exciting new programme of live music and club nights.  #artmusicparties #jaguarshoescollective #dalston See Morestunning 50s bar island takes centre stage in the venue – illuminated and boasting the kind of drinks offer you’d expect to find: JaguarShoes classic cocktails, locally brewed craft beers and a selection of new and old world wines. By Car:-  Outside the Congestion Charge zone, the venue is located on Holywell Ln, just off the main thoroughfare of Great Eastern St and in close proximity to Shoreditch Highstreet, Bethnal Green Rd, Commercial St and Bishopsgate.   There is one daytime car park near Village Underground which is located just next to 55 Holywell Lane. It’s open from 6am - 7pm, Monday to Friday, and you can contact them on 07548 807722 for more details.   There is street parking on Curtain Road, and Scrutton Street which are located on the south side of Great Eastern Street around 5 minutes walk to the venue. You are free to park here outside of the following hours Mon-Fri: 8.30am – 6.30pm, and Sat: 8.30am – 1.30pm. Parking between these times require permits. about: Hey Calgary, it takes a Village to raise a Brewery....
general information: Tour and tasting - $15. Includes tour, samples of our beer and a pint at the end of the tour - you get to keep the glass as a souvenir as well. Call 403.243.3327 to book.
mission: To gather people around community.
products: Village Blonde  - Natural Golden Ale Village Blacksmith - Alberta Black Ale Village Wit - White Wheat Ale... Village Neighbour- Canadian Pale Ale  Village Squeeze- Lemon Berry Helles   Now in 6 packs, 12 packs and 4 Packs of Cans . See More Village Neighbour- Canadian Pale Ale  Village Squeeze- Lemon Berry Helles   Now in 6 packs, 12 packs and 4 Packs of Cans .
column44: IT TAKES A VILLAGE  Some of the best things happen over beer. Ideas are born, friendships forged, deals struck, communities built. That’s how Village Brewery be...gan, friends sharing beers and dreams.  Around the table, we had close to a century and a half of brewing experience.  One of us was a legendary Canadian brewmaster. Naturally the talk turned to the art and craft of better beer, then to secret sources of malts and hops. By last call we had dreamed up a true community brewery.  A brewery that would support Calgary’s artists and craftspeople.  A brewery that would create the excellent ales and lagers our friends and neighbors deserve. That talk over beer started the brewery that handcrafted the fine brew you hold in your hand.  Please join our table, lift a pint and salute the Village of Calgary. It takes a Village to raise a beer. And a beer to raise a Village. See Moregan, friends sharing beers and dreams.  Around the table, we had close to a century and a half of brewing experience.  One of us was a legendary Canadian brewmaster. Naturally the talk turned to the art and craft of better beer, then to secret sources of malts and hops. Please join our table, lift a pint and salute the Village of Calgary. It takes a Village to raise a beer. And a beer to raise a Village.

about: www.villedemont-tremblant.qc.ca
general information: -Nétiquette de la Ville de Mont-Tremblant-  Bienvenue sur les médias sociaux de la Ville de Mont-Tremblant. La nétiquette est un outil de modération qui contien...t des règles de bon usage et de bonne conduite sur les médias sociaux.  Veuillez prendre note que les comptes Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, YouTube ainsi que le site Internet de la Ville de Mont-Tremblant sont gérés par le Service des communications et des relations publiques et qu’un suivi est effectué durant les heures d’ouverture de l’hôtel de ville, soit de 8 h 30 à 16 h 30, du lundi au vendredi.   Véritable espace public numérique, les médias sociaux permettent à tout un chacun de s’exprimer. Ce sont des moyens efficaces afin de commenter, partager, s’exprimer et faire des suggestions dans la mesure où ces échanges sont effectués dans un climat sain, harmonieux et que le contenu soit en lien avec la Ville de Mont-Tremblant. Les échanges doivent aussi respecter les règles énoncées dans cette nétiquette afin de valoriser une communication constructive.   Sur ce, il est formellement interdit de: -	Tenir des propos diffamatoires, sexistes, xénophobes, homophobes; -	Tenir des propos blessants, violents, haineux, menaçants ou diffamatoires; -	Enfreindre la confidentialité, l’identité ou les droits de propriété intellectuelle d’un individu;  Il est également interdit de publier des pourriels, des SPAMS et de la publicité. De plus, l’usage de la majuscule est à proscrire, puisqu’elle est considérée comme agressante, voire violente.  La Ville de Mont-Tremblant se réserve le droit de supprimer les messages qui contreviennent aux interdictions décrites dans cette nétiquette. La Ville peut modérer, supprimer sans préavis et même bannir un utilisateur qui ne respecte pas ce code de conduite. La Ville de Mont-Tremblant se donne également le droit de vous corriger si l’information apportée dans une publication est erronée ou incomplète.   En publiant sur les médias sociaux de la Ville, l’utilisateur consent à ce que la Ville de Mont-Tremblant utilise les commentaires publiés, gratuitement et de façon illimitée, à des fins pratiques ou statistiques.   Soyez assurés que l’information que nous communiquons par le biais des médias sociaux concerne la Ville de Mont-Tremblant et son actualité, ces activités et événements culturels, la protection et la santé publique et tout autre information ou promotion jugées utile. Notez que la Ville de Mont-Tremblant ne fait pas la promotion d’événements ou d’activités externes, à moins que la Ville ne soit directement impliquée.  En utilisant les pages Facebook, Twitter, Instagram et YouTube et même le site Internet de la Ville de Mont-Tremblant, tous les utilisateurs s’engagent à respecter les propos énoncés dans cette nétiquette.   Communiquer dans le respect pour partager et découvrir, c’est le moyen pour faire avancer notre communauté.  Au plaisir de vous lire et de partager avec vous! __ *Cette nétiquette peut être modifiée sans préavis. See Moret des règles de bon usage et de bonne conduite sur les médias sociaux.  Veuillez prendre note que les comptes Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, YouTube ainsi que le site Internet de la Ville de Mont-Tremblant sont gérés par le Service des communications et des relations publiques et qu’un suivi est effectué durant les heures d’ouverture de l’hôtel de ville, soit de 8 h 30 à 16 h 30, du lundi au vendredi.   Véritable espace public numérique, les médias sociaux permettent à tout un chacun de s’exprimer. Ce sont des moyens efficaces afin de commenter, partager, s’exprimer et faire des suggestions dans la mesure où ces échanges sont effectués dans un climat sain, harmonieux et que le contenu soit en lien avec la Ville de Mont-Tremblant. Les échanges doivent aussi respecter les règles énoncées dans cette nétiquette afin de valoriser une communication constructive.   Sur ce, il est formellement interdit de: -	Tenir des propos diffamatoires, sexistes, xénophobes, homophobes; -	Tenir des propos blessants, violents, haineux, menaçants ou diffamatoires; -	Enfreindre la confidentialité, l’identité ou les droits de propriété intellectuelle d’un individu;  Il est également interdit de publier des pourriels, des SPAMS et de la publicité. De plus, l’usage de la majuscule est à proscrire, puisqu’elle est considérée comme agressante, voire violente. column44: La Ville de Mont-Tremblant a été créée le 22 novembre 2000. Elle est issue du regroupement des municipalités de Lac-Tremblant-Nord, de Mont-Tremblant, de la Par...oisse de Saint-Jovite et de la Ville de Saint-Jovite. Toutefois, avec la Loi 14 du gouvernement du Québec, qui permettait aux citoyens de se prononcer sur la fusion lors d'un référendum tenu le 20 juin 2004, les citoyens de l'ancienne Municipalité de Lac-Tremblant-Nord ont décidé de reconstituer leur municipalité. La reconstitution a été effective le 1er janvier 2006 par  décret  prononcé par le gouvernement.   La Ville de Mont-Tremblant est située à une centaine de kilomètres au nord de Montréal. Elle occupe la partie centrale de la MRC des Laurentides et occupe une superficie 235 km2 sur le Bouclier canadien. Le territoire municipal est bordé par les municipalités de Lac-Supérieur au nord, de Brébeuf, Huberdeau et Arundel au sud, de Saint-Faustin-Lac-Carré, à l'est et de Labelle et La Conception, à l'ouest.   Cette étendue de terre est principalement caractérisée par la présence de forêts, de la vallée de la rivière du Diable, de hautes collines et du parc national de Mont-Tremblant qui occupe toute sa partie nord et d'une superficie d'eau douce de 2 083 hectares (plans d'eau et rivières); ce qui représente près de 8 % de la superficie du territoire. Celui-ci compte une longueur de près de 300 km de cours d'eau (rivières et ruisseaux) et plus d'une centaine de lacs . La qualité du paysage naturel en fait un lieu traditionnellement recherché par les villégiateurs et les touristes amants de la nature.   La diversité et la complémentarité des éléments de la Ville de Mont-Tremblant font en sorte d'offrir aux citoyens, aux villégiateurs et aux touristes une gamme de services, d'attraits et d'activités. See Moreoisse de Saint-Jovite et de la Ville de Saint-Jovite. about: Elegance in the heart of Downtown London. Villa Cornelia is sure to impress. A blend of Taste & Tradition, featuring timeless decor and innovative dishes that change weekly. Enjoy the ambiance of dining within a spectacular historic mansion built in 1892.
column44: ABOUT The mansion which houses Villa Cornelia was built in 1892 by Alfred M. Smart, a prominent businessman and President of Ontario Loan and Debenture. The hou...se ranks among London’s finest examples of Queen Anne architecture. It was meticulously restored to its original beauty and splendor in 1987-1988. In 1988 the house was designated as an architectural heritage property. Villa Cornelia is a place to relax, to reflect upon our past, to appreciate the gracious elegance of Victorian architecture, and to enjoy the delights of fine continental cuisine.  HOURS Lunch:  Mon-Fri | 11:30am until 2:30pm Dinner: Mon-Sun | 5pm until 9:00pm Monday Dinner – Reservations Only Brunch: Sat-Sun | 11:30am until 2:30pm Closed All Statutory Holidays See Morese ranks among London’s finest examples of Queen Anne architecture. about: Joyful music learning for people of ALL ages & abilities in the heart of Vancouver. Lessons, group classes, ensembles & lectures for infants to seniors.
general information: Envisioned by VSO Music Director Bramwell Tovey, Arthur H. Willms (VSO Board Chair) and Jeff Alexander (VSO President and CEO) in 2003, the VSO School of Music ...was created to provide a modern educational institution next to the Orpheum Theatre, where students of all ethnic and socioeconomic backgrounds could enjoy lifelong learning and the majority of instructors would be members of the Vancouver Symphony Orchestra.   Macdonald Development Corporation was approached by the VSO to buy the Capital 6 movie theatre that formerly occupied the site, with the intention of building a music school: the concept, including a residential tower above, was immediately embraced by the company. Wall Financial Corporation later took over the lead role in the project, and oversaw the construction of the school and residential tower designed by Bingham Hill Architects.   Made possible through the City of Vancouver’s Cultural Amenity Bonus Program, the residents of British Columbia have now been provided with a new community music school, serving students from 3 months old to senior citizens, catering to all ability levels from beginners to aspiring professionals. mission: We are dedicated to providing the most rewarding musical experience possible to students of all ages and abilities. We offer the highest quality music instruction in an atmosphere that is positive, engaging, warm and supportive.
products: Private music lessons on a wide variety of instruments, group classes and ensembles, rehearsal, performance, function space rentals and cafe
column44: We offer tuition in all orchestral and a range of world instruments, as well as classes in music theory, history, appreciation, early childhood education and Al...exander Technique. Students can also participate in chamber music programs.  The VSO School of Music has over 50 instructors (the majority of which are members of the Vancouver Symphony Orchestra). Our brand new facility has 18 instruction rooms, 6 practice rooms, 2 classrooms, an ensemble room and a 120-seat recital hall.  The VSO School of Music opened to the public on August 2, and lessons began September 6th, 2011. See Moreexander Technique. Students can also participate in chamber music programs. Page Types: Live Music Venue | Nonprofit Organization | Performance Art Theatre
about: A musical association that produces six professional and cultural concerts per year.
column44: For more than half a century, our Association has enriched the cultural life of our communities. We have presented musicians who have interpreted works of the ...great composers, while others have performed jazz, popular or folk music. In addition, we have presented both Canadian and internationally acclaimed ballet and dance troupes that have consistently been favourites of our members. In 1947, a small group of local citizens met and decided to bring professional concerts to Welland. From that beginning was born the Welland-Port Colborne Community Concert Association, which was in effect a licensee of Columbia Artists, a New York based corporation. Artists were chosen from a list presented by Columbia.  In 1982, a decision was made to become independent of Columbia. This was done to enable us to have a wider choice of artists with a special emphasis on Canadian content and to have more control over programs at more reasonable rates. Our name was changed to Welland-Port Colborne Concert Association, and our programming changed to a wider spectrum ranging from jazz to classical music. We have become one of the great success stories on the Canadian musical scene. A number of concert associations have ceased to exist and the surviving ones envy our success. Not only do we have a “sell out” every year, over 90% of our members renew their memberships.  In addition, we have consistently maintained a long waiting list of prospective members. Our membership is principally drawn from the southern tier of the Niagara Peninsula including a number of smaller communities in addition to the larger centres of Welland and Port Colborne. We have in the past presented four concerts, but since our fiftieth season (1996-1997), the number was increased to five, and currently six concerts are presented.  All of our work is done by conscientious and hard-working volunteers in a non-profit and member-owned organization and we take our hats off to each and every one of them. Each Spring a brief campaign promotes the sale of subscriptions. This entitles each member to 6 concerts. Traditionally, we sell out quickly year after year. Renewals must reach us no later than Mid-April. See Moregreat composers, while others have performed jazz, popular or folk music. mission: Mission Statement ... The West End Cultural Centre is a dynamic, not-for-profit community arts organization enriching the lives of artists, audiences and the community through the sharing of music and culture.  Mandate ||To provide opportunities for citizens to be involved in the arts ||To increase community access to Canadian artists and music out of the mainstream ||To provide educational opportunities in the development of artistic expression   Statement of Values Integrity - Foster, and facilitate live music and creative presentation, maintaining the highest standards of artistic integrity.  Relevance - Provide an inviting, intimate environment; program interesting and vibrant music at an affordable price.  Responsibility - Develop sustainable finances and maintain the highest levels of ethical business conduct.  Diversity - Provide unique programming, including live music out of the mainstream; promote an experience that is unique, intimate, excellent, accessible and stimulating.  Accessibility - Ensure musical experiences are available to all levels of the community; provide opportunities to participate in music education in a learning environment.  Support - Support emerging artists by offering a nurturing performance environment. company overview: West End Cultural Centre  586 Ellice Ave at Sherbrook... Winnipeg, MB R3B 1Z8 phone (204)783-6918 fax (204) 783-1884   OUR STORY 	  The West End Cultural Centre (WECC) was established in 1987 when the founders and a team of committed volunteers set out to renovate an old church into a community arts facility. The first concert ever to take place in the hall, on October 23rd of 1987, featured Spirit of the West and proved to audiences that the WECC was ready to fill a void in the music community, dedicating itself to the best in almost every genre of music and art. Since then, the WECC has entertained audiences with a large variety of productions including dance, literary readings, concerts, and festivals.  Primarily a music venue, the WECC is a non-profit organization that promotes Manitoban, Canadian and international artists by fostering artistic development. We present, enable and encourage live music and artistic expression and provide a meeting place for artists and the community. Many musicians have walked through our doors on their way to stardom. Performers appreciate the intimate nature and superb sound of the theatre, as well as the dedicated audience and devoted volunteers. A few of the performers to play the WECC have been: Ron Sexsmith, Bruce Cockburn, Neko Case, No Means No, The Weakerthans, T-Model Ford, Sarah Harmer, Danny Michel, Gordon Lightfoot, Victoria Williams and Lyle Lovett. products: Tickets ... Tickets to all of our shows may be purchased ||in person at the WECC, 586 Ellice Avenue ||over the phone at 204.783.6918 ||from Eventbrite at www.eventbrite.com   There are no age restrictions on any shows at the WECC; performances are open to people of all ages. However, everyone attending must have a ticket (babies in arms exempted).  There are no reserved seats at the WECC, your ticket guarantees you admission but not a specific seat.  Some performances have limited seating; please arrive early to ensure your best choice of seats.  Most performances start at 8:00 pm, with box office sales and will-call opening 45 minutes before showtime.  	 The WECC is wheelchair accessible throughout the main floor and bathrooms via the front entrance with use of a wheelchair lift.  If you have any accessibility concerns or questions please feel free to contact our office at 204-783-6918  Independent Productions  The West End Cultural Centre often rents its facilities to Independent Producers who are responsible for staging their own productions, doing their own marketing and making their own arrangements for selling tickets. While we make every effort to obtain as much information as possible, complete details are not always readily available for independent productions. What we have, we have placed here. Shows are subject to change without notice. Tickets for select shows are available at the West End Monday-Friday 10-5, cash only. mission: Vision West Vancouver will inspire excellence and lead by example. Collaborative government and a spirit of personal civic commitment will power the innovations... that shape our shared future. The strength of this relationship will secure our treasured quality of life and will be the measure of our success as a community.  Mission We champion the opportunities that demonstrate our deep commitment to:     - Foster a sense of shared and individual responsibility for community well being, social unity, inclusion and respect for our full heritage.    - Protect, restore, and defend our natural environment; legislate efforts to effect positive change.    - Encourage diversity in housing, land use and innovative infrastructure within our distinct neighbourhoods to meet changing needs.    - Enrich community vitality, health and understanding through integrating arts, learning, inter-cultural experiences and physical activity into our daily lives.    - Maximize the potential of our economic base and services, balancing the effective, long-term use of resources for current and future generations. column44: Official Facebook Page of Whitewater Brewing Co.   Whitewater Brewing Company believes in the pursuit of the ultimate balance between work and play. Our adventu...res live on through the stories we share with the good people we surround ourselves with. We recognize the important role that good beer plays in sharing these moments, so we work hard to carefully nurture a handcrafted beer using the highest quality ingredients brewed under small batch conditions. The result is a variety of beers worthy of the adventurous spirit inside us all. Whitewater Beer is brewed by friends, for friends. about: The Williams Lake Stampede. Since 1920. Canadian Professional Rodeo Association action in Williams Lake, BC, Canada Day weekend.
column44: Established in 1920, the World Famous Williams Lake Stampede is held annually on the Canada Day long weekend at the start of July, and features Canadian Profess...ional Rodeo Association action including bull riding, barrel racing, bareback riding, tie-down roping, steer wrestling and team roping. The Williams Lake Stampede plays host to many top cowboys and international rodeo competitors from Canada and the United States most of which continue on the circuit to the Calgary Stampede, the following weekend.  The Stampede festivities also include a parade of floats from local organizations, such as 4H groups, native bands, community service groups, the stampede royalty and local merchants.   The Williams Lake Stampede which originated in 1920, began as a gathering of friends, neighbors and ranchers for the sole purpose of providing some entertainment. It gave the cowboys a place to ride some Broncs and Steers, to rope and race on horseback. Horse owners brought their best horseflesh and held flat races. It was an opportunity to show off the best riding and cowboy skills and the best horses in the Cariboo.  Today, the Williams Lake Stampede is a community wide celebration with many local events and things to see and do.   *All contest winners must be available to pick up their prize from the Stampede Office during office hours - times and locations to be communicated to the winners after draw announcement* See Moreional Rodeo Association action including bull riding, barrel racing, bareback riding, tie-down roping, steer wrestling and team roping. column44: Le festival Woodstock en Beauce, qui se tient chaque année sur les terres de St-Éphrem de Beauce, présente sur ses scènes les meilleurs artistes de la scène mus...icale du Québec, ainsi que des artistes d’envergure internationale. Des spectacles sont présentés en journée et se poursuivent jusqu’à tard la nuit.  Tous les festivaliers sont invités à dormir sur le site puisque ce dernier est aménagé pour recevoir des milliers de campeurs. Le Woodstock en Beauce a bâti sa bonne réputation grâce à l’ambiance de paix, qui lui vaut d’ailleurs son célèbre slogan de « fun en paix », et aussi grâce à la qualité et à la renommée des artistes invités chaque année.   __________________________  Already 23 years ! This festival, held each year in Saint-Éphrem-de-Beauce, presents the top artists from Québec and the international music scene. Of course, all festival-goers are invited to sleep on site, which is prepared to host thousands of campers. See Moreicale du Québec, ainsi que des artistes d’envergure internationale. column44: Formerly known as Enzo’s Sports Bar, X-Cues’ had it’s humble beginnings in the heart of the West End when two brothers immigrated from Italy to Winnipeg. The In...fantino Brother’s were host to a home away from home to immigrants from all over the world! When families arrived to the Winnipeg airport with nothing but the clothes on their backs, taxi drivers knew to bring them Enzo’s where they would get a meal, a roof, and immediate acceptance into a community on Sargent Avenue.  To this day, the diverse X-Cues’ community continues to thrive and grow throughout generations.  Since then our business has changed and grown into an award winning authentic Italian lunch restaurant (Urban Spoon), musical venue, diverse cultural hub, and sports venue projecting the most watched events on our 5 big screens! See Morefantino Brother’s were host to a home away from home to immigrants from all over the world! Page Types: Jazz & Blues Club | Live Music Venue | Lounge
about: Official page of the YARDBIRD SUITE and Edmonton Jazz Society (EJS.)  The Yardbird Suite - Edmonton's jazz venue since 1957. The performance venue of the Edmonton Jazz Society, we present the best in local, national and international jazz.
column44: Operated entirely by volunteers, The Yardbird Suite, is the only facility of its kind in Canada. Every weekend between the middle of September and the end of Ju...ne (with the break for the New Year) a new jazz experience unfolds in the Suite's casual and intimate atmosphere.  In addition to an average of 75 concerts per performance season, the Yardbird currently hosts weekly Tuesday Night Sessions, sponsors the Littlebirds Big Band, and provides concert space to other organizations.  Our programming has enabled local musicians to play with some of the world's luminaries of jazz. In partnership with the CBC and Radio-Canada, we have broadcasted nationally. In the past we have provided jazz appreciation courses, weekend workshops with visiting musicians and sponsored various bands.   On March 23, 1957, the original Yardbird Suite opened on 10444 Whyte Avenue. Founding members included Terry Hawkeye, Zen and Ray Magus, Ron Repka, Gary Nelson, Ken Chaney and Neil Gunn.  In 1959 Yardbird Suite relocated to 9810 Jasper Avenue. When the Steak Loft moved from its original location on Jasper Ave and 98th Street into a new building further west on Jasper, the Yardbird Suite moved into the vacated Steak Loft premises. The Yardbird Suite operated in that location pretty well as the present operation is run, with the exception of the fact that the volunteers in those days were all musicians and their wives and girlfriends.  It ran most often five nights a week.   In 1967 an old VW garage across from the old CP station on the south side (corner of 102 Street and 81 Avenue) became Yardbird Suite new location.     In 1973 the EJS re-organized and staged concerts at the Captain's Cabin on 89 Avenue and 99 Street, Palm's Cafe and other locations.  On September 13, 1984, with a crew of dedicated jazz  volunteers, the Yardbird Suite re-opened in its current location (known at the time as Malone Warehouse) at 11 Tommy Banks Way. See Morene (with the break for the New Year) a new jazz experience unfolds in the Suite's casual and intimate atmosphere. about: Niagara's 1st Bar & Grill and the first stop on the CENTRE STREET Shuffle! (or last, depending which way you're going)
For reservations & functions please contact us on (03) 9417 0005 or email functions@theyarrahotel.com.au For band bookings email bands@theyarrahotel.com.au
general information: Hidden down the “wrong” end of Johnston Street is an old gem named The Yarra Hotel. Under new management since 2016, The Yarra is run by musicians for musicians..., and is fast becoming a not-so-secret destination for live local music.  With a big beautiful beer garden, tasty local beers on tap, delicious food, a massive bespoke vinyl collection and live music four nights a week, we’d like to think we offer everything you want in a venue, and more.  We pride ourselves on showcasing some of the best bands from Melbourne and the world. Highlights include legendary front man of The Church, Steve Kilbey, Shayne P. Carter of Straitjacket Fits, China’s Carsick Cars and a host of Melbourne’s finest talent. With a focus on emerging acts, there are plenty of bands who played their first shows with us now dominating the local scene, and who’ve found a safe space to perform here at The Yarra.   Good vibes are our philosophy and good music is our lifeblood. Whether you want to fill your belly, treat your ears or just have a bloody good time, we’ve got you covered here at the Yazz. about: World class beer brewed right in Edmonton!
public transit: Bus # 7, #112, #8, LRT stop Bay/Enterprise Square
mission: Our goal is be Edmonton's flagship beer.
products: Our current beer is Yellowhead Premium Lager.  Yellowhead's history dates back to 1894 as the first ever commercially produced beer in Edmonton. Today the beer ...has been reinvented and revitalized by a team of passionate local craft beer mavericks. Today's Yellowhead Premium Lager is a naturally carbonated brilliant German Style Lager. On the palate it is crisp with a gentle malt sweetness. Fresh grassy hops aromas lead to a delicate complexity and a refreshing smooth finish.   The beer has no preservatives, and is made with only four ingredients ensuring that it is characterized by purity and quality. See Morehas been reinvented and revitalized by a team of passionate local craft beer mavericks. Today's Yellowhead Premium Lager is a naturally carbonated brilliant German Style Lager. On the palate it is crisp with a gentle malt sweetness. Fresh grassy hops aromas lead to a delicate complexity and a refreshing smooth finish.   The beer has no preservatives, and is made with only four ingredients ensuring that it is characterized by purity and quality.
awards: Canadian Brewing Award Bronze for Premium Lager 2013
column44: We are a locally owned Micro Brewery. Our specialty is brewing beer.   Yellowhead is an Edmonton owned and operated community based brewery which engages with l...ocal small businesses, arts and cultural organizations. The brewery was designed by local architect Gene Dub and houses state of the art equipment making it arguably the finest production facility within Edmonton. Come for a tour and we will prove it to you!  In addition, Yellowhead has a unique event space which can be rented for private functions. It is perfect for parties of all kinds, from birthdays to weddings,  corporate events, and networking functions.  Our tasting room is open Thursday thru Saturday 11:00am-9:00pm. We offer all our pints on tap as well as in house smoked meat sandwiches. Call ahead to reserve a keg and book a tour of our brewery!  Contact Loni at events@yellowheadbrewery.com for more details. about: Hamiltonians have been raving about since 1979. Whether stopping by for a pint or planning a night out with friends, come make our pub your pub.
column44: Since 1979, Ye Olde Squire has set the standard for today's modern pub experience. We pride ourselves on offering a diverse menu filled with authentic homemade ...traditional pub fare using only the finest fresh ingredients complimented with many classic Canadian dishes to satisfy even the most discerning value seeking pub goer.  Whether you are drawn by the wide assortment of the industry's most popular poured draught brands, our mouth watering steak pies or our award winning wings, you can always be assured that when you drop in there will be a familiar face awaiting you. Come let us exceed your expectations with our outstanding warm and friendly service, home grown live entertainment, frosty pints and savoury menu selections. Address: 800 Niagara St. N. SeawayMall Welland, Ontario
about: IT'S YOUR PUB!!
public transit: Available
column44: Ye Olde Squire Welland is locally owned and operated by Cheryl and Denis Lapalme. We have been serving hungry and loyal patrons since 2008! We are dedicated to ...fresh-cooked food, made from scratch, in a warm and inviting atmosphere where friends and family gather, just like home.  Our promise to you is to provide a relaxing pub experience where our easygoing staff gets to know you by name, and have your favorite drink ready for you even before you're ready to order.  Over the years, our guests have come back time and time again to enjoy our signature hand-breaded chicken fingers, house-made burgers, soups prepared daily, award winning fish and chips and of course our home-style meat loaf!  A must try is our Bleu Cheese Burger, Bacon Mac and Cheese, and Steak and Guinness Mushroom pie to name a few. Denis' favourite is the classic Feta Bruschetta bread, and Cheryl can't get enough of Squire's Own Deluxe Nachos.  Thank you sincerely for choosing Ye Olde Squire. We realize that you have many choices in where you can spend your hard-earned dollars, and we are grateful that you have chosen us! We hope that you enjoy your experience in our cozy Pub. Should you have any special needs, requests or dietary restrictions, please let us know so that we may accommodate you. †  Once again, thank you so much for being here.  Cheers!  Cheryl and Denis  † Although we carry gluten free options available on request, we are not a gluten free establishment and cannot guarantee against cross contamination. column44: Ye Olde Orchard De La Montagne provides a pre-game and pre-concert atmosphere like no where else in the city! Whether you’re in town for a visit or come by regu...larly our loyal staff is always ready to show you a good time. Our staff loves to have fun, in fact it has happened before that guests have given up tickets to a Habs game to stay and enjoy our party! And you can always expect the same great service at the pub. We are so consistent you could call us Cheers! People come back for the same quality food and service, no matter how far away they are! Just ask George who visits us once a year from Ohio… and we always remember his favourite drink and meal. The Ye Olde Orchard is a perfect blend of Celtic pub meets sports bar meets neighbourhood watering hole. If you are in downtown Montreal and want something a little less ‘mainstream’ Ye Olde Orchard De La Montagne is your diamond in the rough! about: Alexandra Palace is an iconic London Landmark, host to concerts, events and exhibitions, with 196 acres of parkland, and an international sized Ice Rink
column44: Alexandra Palace is the iconic North London venue that offers everything you need for an event, along with the best panoramic views of London.  The People’s Pal...ace has great transport links, located just off the M1 and M25 and only 10 minutes from London Kings Cross.  Ally Pally has been the centre of music, sport and events for over 130 years. The venue is bursting with culture and heritage that no other destination in London can offer.  The 7 acre Palace is surrounded by 196 acres of beautiful parkland, and grounds that boast a pub & restaurant, boating lake, pitch & putt course, 1,500 free parking spaces and much, much more. about: Arts Commons is an inspirational gathering place for all Calgarians and visitors alike.
mission: To ignite imagination, to provide the public with cultural experiences that exceed expectations, to assist artists in Calgary and throughout Alberta to realize their visions and to enable the artistic expression of all citizens.
company overview: Occupying a full city block, Arts Commons is a six level complex measuring over 400,000 square feet (almost 10 acres). It is one of the three largest centres in... Canada. The excellent downtown location offers an unrivalled variety of vibrant and attractive spaces, including four theatres, and the Jack Singer Concert Hall, home to one of Canada's largest pipe organs, the Carthy Organ.   Nearly half a million people experience the excitement of the Arts Commons yearly at 1,800-plus performances and events, including: live theatre, dance, spoken word and readings, children’s events, experimental theatre, art exhibits, public forums, weddings, training sessions, meetings, arts education activities, sporting events and competition, award ceremonies and concerts from symphonic music to jazz, folk, blues, world, rock and much more.  Arts Commons is proud to house some of Canada’s foremost cultural producers who present exemplary artistic programming season after season. See More Canada.
